Medium aroma with citrus, slightly over aged fruits and some malts. Golden/orange color with small white head and medium hazy liquid. Medium taste with pine, slightly over aged fruits and malts. Balanced with medium taste spectrum and long aftertaste with fruits, hops and malts. Medium body with low/medium carbonation. Overall, reference APA that has no deficiencies. For own taste could have more punch and some own character.

Pours a cloudy orange yellow with a thin white head. Aroma of citrus, cantaloupe and a slight twinge of pine. Taste is malt forward with a biscuity middle and a rounded bitter finish. Dry. Good but not great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Finally got to try this. Nose is wonderful juicy hops. Appearance is dark amber with a very thin head. Taste is packed with juicy friut (not the gum) hops. Must try. The perfect pale ale.

Draft. Amber beer with a cream head. Summer fruit and grapefruit aroma. Nice summer fruit and grapefruit flavor with light backing malt. Medium bodied. Summer fruit and grapefruit linger with backing malt.

Have had this a few times but an going to finally enter it since they were pouring at rbwg festival. pours out a nice golden topped with a white head. nose is great hoppy and a nice light malty sweetness. Taste is so crisp a great hop balance with the malts. This was a very nice one.
Great beer. Strong odor of hops but when tasting it the beer is so well balanced! The color is great, overall a great beer

Apricot in the mouth. Delicious, succulent, juicy apricot. Golden color with excellent overall balance. Hoppy, but not overpowering. Should note it was tasted alongside Bells Hopslam & Souther Tier Unearthly IPA.

12oz bottle...finally managed to get a bottle of this ($2.99). This is an exceptional example of the style and very well made. Great aroma, taste...a standard by which others should aspire to. But is it worth the hassle and expense just to get a 12oz bottle? Nope.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Bottle from Dale. Why hunt whales, when they wash up on the beach from time to time. Wasnt expecting this gem to turn up at my house tonight, but most certainly am very appreciative. Smooth, delicious, subtle, outstanding, too many other superlatives to mention. Just damned good...

Normally I'm not a pale ale fan, but this is not your typical pale ale. Has a pleasant citrusy aroma and pallet. Does not have an aftertaste. Every time I am in Munster I always pick up a couple of cases. I am glad to see that they are almost done with their expansion. They Will be able to produce at a higher volume.

From a 12 oz bottle less than two weeks old. Pours gold amber with head and lace in a Choufe glass. Aroma of straw hops, pineapple, grains, sweet malt. Significant carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of rich grains, straw hops, minerals, amber malts, slightly bitter herbs. Overall rich, flavorful, full bodied, nice.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Bottle shared by Ster of Amsterdams BeerTemple, cheers! Thin, off-white, lacing head over a hazy peach blonde beer. Strong, aromatic bouquet of toasted onion, grapefruit, white pepper, mango, sundried tomato, gooseberry, biscuit. Clean fruity onset, hints of mango, pineapple and orange on a dryish background, bit yeasty, supple biscuity maltiness and aromatic, gentle but rich hop finish, very citrusy, bit spicy, bit piney and orange peel-like, drying but not thoroughly bittering. Very aromatic and accomplished example of the style, but considering the hype, I think I expected more of it, as it does not really seem to distinguish itself from many other APAs or even IPAs.

Pours a standard light amber, dark orangish color, with a fluffy white head. Aroma is nothing to shout about, light malt, and earthy/citra hop. Taste is hop citra, very light malt, sweet, somewhat bitter, and sticky. Light mouthful, no detection of alcohol, wet, and lingering. Overall, a good pale ale.
Good beer. Why don't they make more? Three Floyd's get to brewing more beer.

On tap at Hopleaf in Chicago. Clear golden appearance with a white head and light lacing. Aroma of zesty hops, citrus, tropical fruits and light floral notes. Similar flavor, fresh and juicy with a zippy hop bitterness. Balanced and easy to drink. Absolutely delightful overall.

Pours a dark golden orange color with tangerine edges and a two finger frothy white head that slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Excellent retention, taking a while to settle and coating the glass with large streaks of soapy lacing.

Dank floral hop aroma with earthy resins and freh cut grass countered by sweet citrus/tropical fruit and a pale malt backbone. Grassy pine and dank buds along with grapefruit, pineapple and blood orange zest. Really nice sweeter counterbalance to the bitter earthiness. Pale malts evident without hindering the hop character with notes of biscuit and grainy cracker. Smells pretty good.

Medium body but on the full side for a pale ale. Blast of dry, earthy bitterness up front that lingers over the sweeter hop notes and pale malt backbone into a crisp, dry finish. Grassy pine, spruce tip and dank, sticky resins followed by a nice tropical/citrus fruit presence. Some tart ruby red grapefruit, pineapple and zesty orange peel. Pale malt with subtle caramel sweetness, toffee, light toast, biscuit and grainy graham cracker. Malts are stronger than expected but dont interfere with the excellent hop flavors. Instead, they provide great balance and contribute to the drinkability of this crushable beer. The bitterness is just so dank and flavorful without being too strong or overpowering. Another very nice beer from Three Floyds.

Smell of tropical fruit, citrus, orange peel
Slightly cloudy. Beautiful white foamy head with small bubbles. Pours great. Orange color. 
Front of the mouth tropical fruits and citrus, orange peel, grapefruit
Middle of the mouth dry breadiness with lingering citrus. Very dry crisp finish with a lingering bitter after taste. Finished beautiful and gets better as you drink.

If God wanted to brew a pale ale that captures the essence of Northern California and placed it into bottle, hed be wasting his time if he didnt just copy Zombie Dust by Three Floyds. Golden in color, the intense citrus hops bring a crisp, citrus taste that blends well with a pine scent and finish. Perfectly bitter.

22oz bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

Tried this side by side with a pseudo sue. 

Typical cloudy ipa appearance. Aroma is very nice. Citrus and a touch if pine. Body is a little thinner than I would have liked. Okay mouthfeel.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Bottled. Has a nice copper orange. Has a nice light body but the taste is bold. Big citrus flavor with a hint of piney grassy data orangey hops. Great beer.
Pours with medium head and medium card. Smooth citrus ale and a great after taste.
Full bodied, aroma off the charts, this is a damn fine representation of the citra hop. The head is almost creamy and has great retention. I would drink this every day if I could find it!

Hazy golden pour similar to a wheat beer. Aromas of mango, peach, grapefruit. Huge citrus notes. Flavors of similar citrus aromas, juicy fruit gum. Nice smooth palate very slightly dry, lightly carbonated and a wet palette.

Admittedly Im a stout-first guy. I enjoy a variety of beers, but I tend to gravitate toward them. Being from Indiana and enjoying the craft beer scene, I am familiar with Three Floyds and knew the legend of "The Dust" although having one alluded me for the longest time. Not that I sought it out hard, but I knew I wanted to try one. Recently I got my chance when my favorite local watering hole got some on tap.

Pours a golden yellow with an amazing citrus smell. I was surprised at its almost cloudy look, but it laced the glass fabulously and one taste had me sold. Maybe its rarity makes it taste better than it really is, but I dont think so. If you get the chance to try it, do it. You wont be sorry.

Every now and again you find a beer that reaffirms your love of beer and why you got into craft beer in the first place. This beer pours somewhere between a dirty yellow and orange, with a light and active head. You can smell the citra hop when you put your pint glass to your mouth, but the scent is intriguing and not all in your face. Perfectly balanced between an IPA and a pale ale, this beer is worth searching for, trading for, and flaunting in the face of your non-Chicago area friends. If you see it, get it. You wont be disappointed.
Clear golden of color with a white head. An aroma of hops, citrus and lemon. A flavor of citrus, lemon, hops and very fresh.

Great citrusy hop nose with taste that follows. One of my favorites, particularly when fresh. Lives up to the hype!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, at the CTBCAIPAT-O. Pours a gorgeous amber-orange with a high, solid, white head with massive lace. Nose is lime, orange, clementine, gardenia, lavender, and biscuity malt. On the tongue -- holy crap. Some beers are not worth the hype. This is. Sweet, honeyed stone fruit, tropical fruit, and all that good Citra stuff, backed up with citrus pith and apple skin bitterness. Finish is velvety, clean, and long. Perfectly balanced. My buddy chased a beer truck to six different stores in Chicago to get some, and he said it was worth every minute. I concur.
A lot of citrus. Really good. Super IPA/APA flight with John (Schlafly TIPA, Founders Harvest Ale, Pliny the Elder, Zombie Dust, Alpha King, Sierra Nevada Celebration ale)
Strong citrus and floral nose, which is delightful. It is a beautiful dark gold/light amber color, with a nice head. Powerful notes of citrus and a great strong hoppy flavor. Long bitter finish
Bottle thanks to sarky northner. Golden ok head. Aroma is caramel citrus grapefruit pine taste same good sweet malts nice bitter finish. Nice chewy mouthfeel. Very good.

Attractive cloudy apricot color with fluffy white head. Bright citrus and pine aroma. Taste- intensely citrus, lemon, grapefruit and floral orange zest along with some mellow tropical fruit. Long slightly resinous finish. Well balanced. Lives up to the hype. Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bit opaque, orange yellow, off-white lasting, lacing foam head. Quite strong hoopy aroma, some barley, some citrus. Quite strong bitter taste, lasting long in mouth. Again citrus notes, something else - roses? (Munster 201510)
Smells awesome. Looks great. Leaves a large head on aggressive pour. Most importantly, tastes incredible. Juicy delicious hop taste. Overall- One of your fav pales/IPAs.
Super strong grapefruit aroma upon opening. Pouring brings out even more grapefruit and citrus. Slick and smooth mouthfeel. Very drinkable for the alcohol content.

Got two bottles from family brought back from Chicago while on business trip. Wonderful Citra grapefruit, faint tropical fruit aroma. gold and hazy in color with a nice head. Good body and mouthfeel. taste has slight caramel malts to it upfront and finishes with nice Citra bitterness. Not overly bitter and very easy drinking.

Amazing aroma jumps out as soon as the bottle is opened. Cloudy dark orangy/yellow pour with a gorgeous creamy beige frothy head. Light lacing on the glass. Hop presence is strong but not overpowering like some in this genre tend to be. Aftertaste is damn near perfect. Cool label as well!!

Citra hops at its best! One of 3floyds staples that never sits on the shelf. Try it you won't regret it. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Citra hops grown in the Yakima Valley. Know the only combination of words more exciting than that sentence? Zombie Dust. This beers reputation is stratospheric. How can something like this possibly meet expectations? Especially on a night like ours, where Zombie Dust shared the table with other renowned hoppy ales? I dont know. I cant tell you how any of that is possible. Yet, Zombie Dust shook my world. Balance is sublime. Mouthfeel is creamy but somehow also crisp. Grass, tropical citrus juice - especially orange and lemon, evergreen, and a hint of cannabis. In some hallowed dimension, Zombie Dust has a permanent place in my fridge. Let it be so.

Ive had this on tap a few times. Honestly not sure what all the fuss is about. Sure its limited, but there are better beers that are easier to find. Hoppy enough to be an IPA but not as powerful as some FFF beers. Certainly not as complex as some of the stronger beers like Dreadnaught, Arctic Panzer or Permanant Funeral.

(Thanks, Josh! "StFun")

A- Orange marmalade, juicy, citrus, sweet cream.

A- Orange color, hazy liquid, white head.

T- Orange marmalade, slightly sweet, juicy, toast, 

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, sweet juicy finish.

O- Holy shit. Im not a pale ale guy. But this is about as good of a beer as Ive ever tried. Love me some citra hops and this was mindblowing. Very little bitterness and a ton of juicy fruits, but it as a orange marmalade/jelly flavor with a hint of spice to it. I would consider driving 10+ hours to Indiana just to buy a case of this.

Bought from Lizardville and poured into a snifter at home. Golden color with a modest head and some lacing. The aroma was solid cereals, citrus, mild pine, and wet grass. Taste is well balanced grains, citrus and pine hops, and the wet grasses. Very fresh and crisp. Clean finish. Very nice.
Pours a hazy golden orange. Very hoppy citrus nose. Taste is slightly bitter and very well balanced.

Pours hazy orange with a nice off white head. Head retention is good. AROMA: pineapple, coriander, malty, herbal hops, spice, tangerines, grassy bitterness, herbs, caramel, citrus, pine bitterness, slight yeast esters, orange, peppercorn and tropical fruit. TASTE: crisp malt, hop spice, grassy bitterness, pineapple, citrus, herbs, tangerines, pine bitterness, coriander, peppercorn, spice, tropical fruit, orange and little tamarind. AFTER TASTE: malty, hop spice, citrus and pine bitterness with an oily light body finish.
The finish of this beer is what I really love about it. There is no bitter finish at all. You get all the hop blast that you would want then no bitter finish. Each sip leaves you wanting more!!

Pretty much what you want all pale ales to taste like. Amazing aromas from the citra hops. A ton of lemon zest and a hint of something richer. Kinda like limoncello. Flavors are similar and was absolutely blown away by the mouthfeel, big, but balanced with spot on carbonation and a spicy dry finish. Lingers with a nice lemon oil bitterness to clean it all up.

Aroma is big from citra, citrus, grapefruit and oranges. A pretty sweet maltbase crawls up like a zombie and tries to drag you down, but the hops lift you up and you stay upright and manages to carry you over the finish line. Good bitterness. Superb beer.
Orange clear pour. Citrus hop aroma. Flavor of fresh hops and mango and some other light fruits. Flavor is some malty and mostly hops. A must if you are a fresh hop fan.
Bottle. Sharp hoppy orange peel aroma. Pours dark orange with a small head. Nice sharp hoppy flavour but not too overpowering.Fruity orange finish.

Bottle at Millers pub. Hazy medium amber with a small white leaving lots of lace. Nose is big citrus with grapefruit, orange, and lemon with significant pine notes. Sufficient malt sweetness to support a huge bitterness from start to finish. Medium slickmouth with average carbonation and a long dry finish. Superb.

12 oz bottle. Sunset orange, with a thick but short lived head, nice lace. Aroma is juicy citrus, lemon, grapefruit, tangerine. Picking up a little floral hop as well. Flavor is similar, juicy hop bitterness, Grapefruit, orange, light pine, spice, with some sweet caramel and toast to balance it out.
So juicy, both on the nose and the tongue. Citra is a fantastic hop for pales since they can otherwise be a bit boring.

From tap. Hazy yellow golden color with white to off white head. Aroma is heavy hoppy, citrusy fruity, grapefruit, orange, grassy, pine, light caramel malty. Light sweet and heavy bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
From a bottle. Great hop aroma, citrus, pine. Intense hop flavor, malt is there but behind the hops. Full flavor. Excellent flavor and aroma for a pale ale.

Pours a slightly hazed sunyellow color, with a big, stable head.

Smells of sublime bitter, fruity lemon zest with balancing, white-bread malts to it. Citrus got a flowery, inviting note to it, enhancing the beers juicy, ripe lime pulp impression. 

Drinks outstandingly easy, with a medium, soft carbonation to it, resulting into a very pleasant, citrus forward pale ale. 

Tastes of citrus peel from the very beginning, while the malts provide a fantastic soft mouthfeel, exhibiting a hint of honey, as well as juicy lime. Also yields a soft minerality, creating a very clean and crisp hop profile, showcasing the pungent exotic fruit perfectly. Finishes with biscuity malts among an aqueous softness and pleasantly metallic carbonation, together with a well weaved in citrus hoppiness, which shines during the very end of tasting the beer.

While its hoppiness provides a pleasant assault on the tongue it is perfectly integrated and balanced by all other ingredients of the beer. This creates a great softness on the palate, resulting in an outstandingly easy drinking beer, for which you dont necessary need to be a hophead, more of a beer which convinces you to be one.

On tap at Jakes in Chicago in Lincoln Park area. Pint glass. Orange golden in color with good lacing and frothy head. Hops are at the forefront of the aroma. Taste is very solid with a balanced hop undertone and good sweetness. Easy to drink while still bringing a good alcohol level to the table. Mouthfeel is soft but with a hop bite at the end. Definitely worth drinking again. Name sounds like a hit song in the 70s and Im up for another listen.

Tap at Jakes in Chicago. Light orange with small white head. Really nice clean hop nose. Some grapefruit. Full in body. Really well balanced. Hops not overwhelming. Really nice mouthfeel. Well done beer.

Served on tap. Orange color with a white head. Citrus hop aroma. Hops up front with a slight bitter finish. Smooth easy drinking beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Hamei fructat și note de pin și vanilie - are de toate dar sunt slabe. Vârstă? E smooth. Foarte bine, dar nu ieșit din comun.

Bottle to snifter. Yellow-gold with lasting head. Nose of colorful lemon & grapefruit, juiciness, gentle pine. Extremely well-balanced flavor, clean finishing, lemony, bright citrus, subtle floral pine. Very appreciative of the clean finish on such a hop-forward ale. However, I would expect more vibrant flavor from a 100-rated brew. Still awesome. Midwest, get it while its hot. Its making its rounds in the shops right now.
I know, I know, I just like this beer because its such a big name in the craft world..... But thats bit correct, this beer is amazing on every level.
bottle courtesy of Robert poured into a stem glass..golden orange with a fluffy white head..aroma of grapefruit,pine,resin,florals..tastes of grapefruit,pine,resin..excellent.

Aroma is slightly fruity, I get hints of pineapple/mango/grapefruit. This beer defines a great APA. Hoppy, smooth, and just the perfect amount of bitterness in an APA. One of my favorite beers of all time.

A bottle straight from Indy thanks to Fitz. Pours an amber orange color with a white foam head. Soft aroma of caramel with some citrus and grapefruit. Light sweet caramel taste with gentle grapefruit notes and a mild hop hit. Some slight grass mixed in with resin on the finish. Perhaps the best APA I have had.

On tap at Hopleaf (Chicago, IL). Slightly hazy, golden body with a lasting white foamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with citrusy and piney hints. Its sharp, well balanced hoppy taste carries citrusy, malty, herbal, and piney hints. Ends with a long bitter finish. Awesome!
Fantastic in all ways. This beer is smooth with juicy hops through the first sip to the last ... great beer and does not have a harsh bitterness.
I am not a huge fan of APA but this is the best one I have had so far. Definitely recommend it.

Nice balanced hoppy beer. I enjoyed that it wasnt too resinous tasting, sometimes those flavors can destroy my palate. Drank it during dusk at an old haunted stone building on the lake. No zombies were witnessed.
Appearance and nose out shine the flavor, a bit funky in the mouth but not bad. Just dont quite get the 100 score.

Pours hazy orange with a thick long lasting head. Initial aroma of bold orange and pine hops. But the initial taste is actually more mellow than expected. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Slightly hazy with a medium white head. Sweet citrus nose. Smooth full bodied flavor with a lot of floral
Hop flavors

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught sample at CBC 2015. Slightly hazy amber-golden colour with a small, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, spruce, floral hops, pale and caramel malts. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes lasting dry and bitter with citrus fruits, oranges and sweet exotic fruits. Truly a benchmark APA.

Pours hazy orange with a white head. The aroma has pineapple, cream, lime, some fruit, caramel and heavy dank notes. It has a medium fairly smooth body with fairly soft carbonation. The flavor starts with dry bread, pine, grapefruit, pineapple and woody hops. The finish has caramel, resin and citrus zest. Great IPA.

3F beers are always sought after and Zombie Dust is one of those illusive ones. It is often gone before you even know it is for sale or had been tapped. It is a crisp and citrusy single hopped pale ale. I dont really buy into all of the hype nor do I believe it is a 100 point beer but it sure is awfully damn good. If you get the chance to sample some, I would highly suggest. I think besides Dreadnaught, it is 3Fs best beer.

12 oz bottle pour. Fresh stuff to say the least. Bottled on 4/28/15. Since I enjoyed a beer from the same pack about a week ago, this is the second freshest Zombie Dust Ive ever had. Thanks a ton Tcon for sharing this. Pours a super cloudy orange color with a hop fronted, ocean like aroma. Very earthy hops. Has notes of onion, which makes it a little different than the typical pale Im used to. Very easy drinking, and very tasty. Awesome pale.
Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150501. Colour is clear orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, minerals, some citrus, some grape, hops and malts.

Draught @ CBC 2015, Blue Session, København
Pours slightly hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, grape and pine. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter with a long citrus, grape, pine and slightly dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottled:Very fruity with a long, resinous bitterness. Very good!

Bottle at tasting. Golden pour. Nice aroma of citrus, malt and caramel. Taste has a lot of citrus, some caramel and a little grain. Great APA indeed, but also quite overhyped. Theres only so much you can do with this style, this is definitely no 4+ beer.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 Pours clean and rather dark with solid head. Sweet tropical and citrusy scent (grapefruit and maybe pineapple) with the bitterness undertones of the hops. Incredible taste, crisp and light as it hits the tongue, slowly fading to the bitter, piney notes. This no longer holds as high a place in my heart as it once did, but fresh Zombie is still very good.

Bottle. Bottled on 12.17.2014. Amber body with white head. Aroma is fruity mostly apricots with some citrus and some pine. Taste is also very fruity with citrus and some malts backbone. Aftertaste is bitter with some malts.. Very nice I hope I will get it one day a little bit fresher.
Sample at CBC 2015. Amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and Taste of malt, hops, fruit, fresh, caramel, citrus, grapefruit and bitterness.

Tap cbc15. Pours clean bright golden with off-white head. Aroma is super fresh, citrus, hoppy, pine, resin and a lot of juicy pineapple. Taste is really fresh, lemon drops, hoppy, resin, tropical fruits. Malty backbone and medium bitter finish. So well balanced!

Draught at the Hair of the Dog, Portland, OR. Cloudy orange colour with a small white head. 
Super balanced fruity hoppy aroma. The flavour is resin, fruits, touch of grapefruit, moderate bitterness, dryness and balancing malt. Extremely tasty. Perfect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours golden with a small off-white head. Aromas of malt, citrus, tropical fruits, mango and peach. Tastes of malt, citrus, fruit and mango. Full bodied, perfect balance. Good bitterness. Delicious.
pour pale golden, with a fine white head. light grassy, light cheasy light toast aroma, light bitter taste, medium bodied, great mouthfeel, with a light bitter aftertaste

A golden/orange color wit a one finger white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, hops and floral notes. Taste is predominantly tropical fruits a nice hoppy finish. Very similar to Stone Enjoy By.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A friend brought back a six-pack to Hong Kong for me while this was still super fresh in February. Obviously there are times where I just like to sit back and enjoy a beer instead of always reviewing and as it is, two and a half months on, Im down to my last bottle and so heres the review. This 12oz bottle was bottled on 13 February 2015 and poured into a pint glass. The beer poured a slightly hazy golden orange colour with a nice one and a half finger white head that dissipated fairly quickly leaving nice stringy lacing. Intense aromas of tropical fruits especially pineapple and mango hit first, followed by some citrus grapefruit and a hint of bready malts finally ending with some hoppy pine. Much like the smell, there was tropical pineapple, citrus grapefruit, some bready buscuity malts and a very nice bitter finish. Very crisp, light and with medium carbonation. Overall, I had high expectations before trying it and it lived up to those expectations. It was a very easy APA to drink and this is a must buy if available for me. It was best when it was freshest. Now lets see about 3 Floyds distribution to Hong Kong hmm, I guess distribution = friends!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Bottle shared by koleminer20. Aroma is sweet tropical fruit, pine, slight dank. Appearance is amber golden, slight haze, white head. Taste is slight malt, tropical fruit, pine, pretty good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, decently crisp carbonation, nice tropical fruit aftertaste. Overall, Ive had many better APAs now. This is solid but nowhere as good as some other stuff Ive had by now. See Toppling Goliath pseudoSue or Tree House Lights On.
-short review cbc- pine, citrus, spice and floral. Dry, fruity and green finish. Fresh. Close to ipa in style. Hyped.

Pours almost clear golden with white head. Pine and citrus aroma. Good bitterness. A very good well balanced pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at CBC- København. Clear golden color, good foam. High aroma intensity; hoppy , citrus, fruity. Medium body & complexity. Very high bitterness- a bit unbalanced in that regard. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of my favorite beers, this thing consistently delivers. Great mouth feel with lots of tropical hops going on. Even after a month since it was bottled it is insanely good. Aroma is filled with oranges, grapefruit, lime, and mango. It also has a nice dry finish that makes you want that next sip even more.

On tap at Hopleaf. Pours a clear amber colour with a creamy tan head. Aroma is a little grassy with lots of citrus fruits, grapefruit in particular. Taste is moderately sweet throughout, but the sweetness is quickly overtaken by an intensifying bitterness which is quite nice. Medium body, smooth and creamy on the palate, and well carbonated. Overall a really awesome beer.

Review is of a 20 day old bottle

Pours a clear, bright orange body. Head is 3/4 of an inch and pearly white. Lacing was good and head retention was outstanding.

Smell is of floral hops, rye malt, and spice like cardamon or coriander. Fresh cut grass comes through as the beer warms. Not much alcohol is detected.

Taste is of earthy and floral hops. Getting some lemongrass, pine, rye, and maybe ginger or something a tad spicy. Malt is pretty light and alcohol is barely detected.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied for an IPA, well carbonated. Nice head added to the body.

Overall good beer but I was expecting more because of the hype. I gravitate more towards the fruit forward pale ales, maybe thats why I didnt rate it higher. Solid beer though
From tap at Mikkeller bar, Viktoriagade, Copenhagen. Amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, fresh, caramel, citrus, grapefruit and bitterness.
Poured medium w amber with a small off white head. Aroma of moderately sweet citrus and soft malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, moderately bitter.
Brought back to New England by a friend. Not a great nose but a fantastic finish.
Pours cloudy amber with thin white head and persistent lacing. Aroma is definitely citra with ample sweet malt. This beer is just delicious, one of the best single hop pale ales!

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slight creamy body; Aroma of fresh floral hops, citrus, & pine; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel, pine hops, floral, some fruit, and rich citrus; Finish is dry & bitter; Nicely balanced; Incredible APA.

Look - Dark gold almost orange with bright white head. Good lacing. 

Smell - This has a great smell for a low IBU / ABV pale ale. Bready and dank. 

Taste - A great taste for what it is. Bread hits first and dank hops mellow out to the finish.

Feel - There is no sting on the tongue. It feels like soft water. 

Overall - Why drink an imperial or double when you can get the taste from this pale ale? I really cant believe I only bought a 6 pack of this at the brewery.

From bottle to pint. This beer pours with a delicate head. One of the most beautiful floral bouquets I have smelled. Citrus, violets, mango, pine....the good stuff. The flavor doesnt quite match the aromas, but still absolutely delicious. Apricots, mangoes and spruce on the palate. The mouth feel is very good. Nice weight to this beer. Hoppy but not overly so. One of the best beers around. If you see it on a shelf buy it and enjoy, or get ahold of me. Ill take it off your hands. Cheers!
Bottle share at Dominion Wine and Beer. Hazy orange-gold with small white head. Loads of citrus hops with some resiny pine coming through on the tail, along with a malt base. Fantastic.
Citrus and pine. West coast like alcohol not prevalent like alpha king. Nice bitter finish.

One of my favorite beers. A good hoppy pale ale but also has citrusy flavors that finish it perfectly. I have friends who will drive to another state for this beer .

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
aroma: citrus, hops. palate: not much carbonation. taste: zesty lemon rind, piney hops, citrus.
Its tasty with a unique after taste. Smells a little better than taste though. All together very good.

From bottle into a snifter, this beer has an amazing nose, so floral. Also has a great palate to it, dry finish with a little stickiness. I know I'm in the minority, but as far as Chicago IPAs go, I prefer anti hero from revolution. That being said, they're both incredible beers, and choosing between both is a good problem to have!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a very light gold with a fluffy white head. For a single hop brew, the nose is fantastic. Lots of hops with huge citrus coming through. Not too over the top in bitterness. Has a caramel malt backing that goes well with the Citra hops. Tremendous beer

12 oz bottle. Tasted on 4/7/15. Bottle courtesy of Joe. Aroma was juicy full of hops. The taste was great with tons of citrus, hops upfront with just enough malt to balance it out. Extremely smooth & messy to drink... Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Lives up to the hype.  Hazy orange color.  Great citrusy hop forward flavor. Very clean finish. Great pale ale!  Wish it was easier to find.
Bottle. Pours slightly hazy golden amber. Fluffy white head and big lacing. Nose is big citrus and pineapple. Taste is tropical and pine. Dry aftertaste. Great.

12 oz Bottle. Appearance is slightly hazy, orange color with medium, off-white head. Aroma is heavy citrus with notes of orange sweetness, grapefruit, and mango. Taste is well-balanced with nice moderate sweetness overlaid with a smooth citra hop bitterness. Some resinous piney notes also present. Palate is light- to medium-bodied, slightly thin texture, light but lively carbonation, and a dry finish. I was a little disappointed at first but the complexity came out as the beer warmed up. Well-crafted brew.

Sample, draught, during the Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savoured on October 4 2014; eye: golden, clear, no effervescence, tiny sheet of white head, light lacing; nose: resinous hops, pine, tropical fruits, freshness, light grapefruit; mouth: resinous hops, pine, tropical fruits, freshness, light grapefruit, light astringency, finale in hops with fruity presence, medium body, good carbonation, quite bitter, slightly sweet, harsh texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, en fût, lors du Great American Beer Festival (Denver), savourée le 4 octobre 2014; il : dorée, limpide, pas deffervescence, petite couverture de mousse blanche, légère dentelle; nez : houblon résineux, pin, fruits tropicaux, fraîcheur, léger pamplemousse; bouche : houblon résineux, pin, fruits tropicaux, fraîcheur, léger pamplemousse, légère astringence, finale en houblon avec présence fruitée, corps moyen, bonne carbonatation, pas mal amère, très légèrement sucrée, texture râpeuse; en résumé : bien
What can I say that hasn't been said before? It's wonderful stuff, unparalleled, expertly balanced and clean.
Draft at Millers Pub. Aroma is piney hops. Light bodied, thin hollow palate. Sharp piney and floral hops on the finish. Highly carbonated. Drinks like a SIPA.
Poured from a six pack of bottles, nice looking glass of beer. Taste was tropical fruit, some fresh hops, very little bitter, went down smooth and quickly. Could have been stronger for the price.
On tap at Tap-House Munich. Hazy, dirty golden with a healthy offwhite foam. Hoppy passion fruit aroma. Exotic fruits hop bitterness, dwarfing the hints of toffee. No compromise hop bitterness!

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.

Aroma was almost all citrus. Appearance orange. Taste was a very well balanced citrus without the harsh bitterness you would expect for this style. Outstanding IPA.

12 oz bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled 10/1/2014, will re-rate whenever I get a fresher one. Hazy orange with a finger of off-white head. Aromas of caramel, malt, toasty notes, biscuit, citrus. Tastes of grapefruit citrus, biscuit, caramel, malt. Medium body with a dry finish.

Eminently drinkable considering the octane. Well balanced was the first thought that came to mind, hops, citrus in the grapefruit direction. Not overly hopped like some Three Floyds manifestations. The aroma did not register with me as much as other reviewers, perhaps they had it on draught.

Wow this is awesome, its no wonder its so sought after. Big hoppy aroma and the taste follows, if you were to drink this blind you would think IPA. Citrus and piney flavors all the way through and they hang out long after the finish.

Bottle pours dark apricot with a fluffy persistent head. Smells of Citra hops: tropical scents of mango, papaya, pineapple. Smooth, balanced palate of sweet mango, with a refreshingly bittering finish. Overall, a nice, lush, fruity style APA.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Tap House, MÜ 2015/3. Luminous ice tea orange pour Whilst remaining demure and only lemon tea-like in aroma in taste it delivers a confidently balanced, crisp punch of condensed orange peel, dosed citrus leaf and rind on a thin but gratifying cracker malt base. Just the barest hint of toffee and sweet maracuya. Superbly dry, very crisp for a strong APA. Shiny, sessionable example of the style. Impressive feat on the part of the Tap House for having this fresh on ample kegs. This almost cancels out the depressing experience of not being let in at their stuck-up-their-own arse brewpub.
Dunkelorange im glas, schaumig. Sehr tropisch, Mangonoten. Am Gaumen sehr crisp, fruchtig, Mangonoten, sehr rund.

Light copper-amber colour with a frothy white head and excellent lacings. Aromas of pineapple, mango, spruce, lime and caramel develops on the nose. Light soft carbonation, smooth-slick with a medium-full body. Fruity, grapefruit, orange peel, caramel flavours develop. Sweetish with some bitterness well kept malt center, complex yet very drinkable! Medium hoppy lasting finish. Balanced and excellent!

Shared 12 oz in a snifter. Aroma is strong sweet citra hops. Flavor is very mango citrus. Intense fruitiness but without bitterness. I am not usually a fan of this style and was expecting to hate this, but felt I had to, but this wasnt bad. Probably wouldnt go through the effort to track it down again but was pleasantly surprised.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Pungent hoppy aroma, grapefruit, pine, mango. Taste of hop juice, mango and grapefruit. Long citrus fruit finish.

Firm hazy golden, greasy bubbly greyish head. Minty mango, sweet and sticky lime. Initial taste is lean spicy hop sweetness, lean leady grapefruit. Overlooked carbonation, peppery and a little bit justifiably sticky. Finishes lean sweetness, cornflakey and smoothing fruit citrus. Full on for the ABV. Bottle, Japan Centre Online, Sake Monday tasting

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2015 Bottle at Craigs. Thanks Paul! Pours clear golden amber with a thin white head. Aromas of caramel, crystal malt, light orange citrus. Taste is light sweet, pine, mango. Bitter finish.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale amber, nose is sweet toffee, pine, citrus, taste is dry, crystal malt, fruity, bitter, sweet.
bottle at home ... copper ... small white head ... soft zezty orange and the crystal toffee nose ... soft fruits ... soft toffee fruit ... orange and passion fruit ... and that toffee . bah

By far the best American Pale Ale Ive tasted to date. The hop pop in this baby with the towel dry finish. Thin head and medium body. What else can I say this is one damn good beer and glad I got to finally try. Will be beer hunting more of this real soon. Cheers!
I love this beer. Its my favorite beer besides the Dreadnaught. I wish I could drink this everyday.

Draft at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours clear orange with a medium white head. Aroma has some citrus, hops and tropical fruits. Taste is of damp hops, hay and is a bit too bitter. Palate is sleek and easy. Overall I was a bit disappointed, though it is not bad.

Poured into DFH IPA glass showing a finger of clean white foam and cloudy honey amber. 

The nose shows a lot of fresh juicy tropical & citric fruit (mango, pineapple, notes grapefruit pith, orange zest). Some hints of malt sweetness here & there. Very full and abundant nose. 

The palate shows high carbonation and a light body. A very slight malty sweetness appears briefly in the beginning. Then taken over by a lot of the same fruit flavors described. Very good intensity and freshness. Light bitterness on the end thats barely noticeable because the fruit attack of the hops are so unbelievably juicy and prominent. Extremely drinkable and great on a warm summer day.
Bardzo ale to bardzo dobre, ciezko dostać o cennie niema co wspominac oólnie super
12 oz bottle- pours a nice straw color. Very good nose- lots of hops and citrus, of course. Great APA if you like Citra hops. I do... so it was good

Pours amber gold with a nice rocky head. Aroma is great, grapefruit and barley. Taste is nice, bold citrus up front and sweet malty goodness on the (slightly dry) back end. Nice light mouth feel and mildly carbonated. Overall a fantastic pale ale. Almost perfect version of the style if you are a fan of hoppy ales.

Slightly hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is orange peel, light dankness, weed, sesame bread, orange blossom, mango. Light-medium bodied, bittersweet on the palate, well balanced, fruity finish with a lightly bitter aftertaste. Taste is orange peel scones, orange blossom honey, citrus zest. Great citra showcase.

Twelve ounce bottle from my nephew (thanks, Andy!), tasted on December 24, 2014. Very cloudy orange/yellow hue, strong piercing bittersweet nose, somewhat light but complex bittersweet flavor. This bottle was a bit old--would like to revisit this beer. It would probably be even better.
Powerful citrus aroma, awesome, taste is all citrus, without much backing tastes a touch thin, good stuff

Bottle, 330 ml, courtesy of Miro. Shared with Marko and Marko & Miro from Nova Runda. Pours dark orange with off-white head. Bit perfumy and sweet fruity floral aroma. Citrus, fruity hoppy flavor. Bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours murky brown with thin white head that clings to the edges. Pepper hop aroma over light carbonation. Nice malt balance with hop bitterness that's juicy with a mellow finish. Reasonable complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!
This is the perfect APA. Not over the top with hops, but they are prominent to the point of being delicious. I don't think I've ever had a better APA.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 14.1.2015. Hazy amber with tropical fruit and pine aroma, bitter taste with notes of mango and pineapple, rather light-bodied, rather soft carbonation and soft, fruity notes.
Bottle @ Le Trappiste Bruges, flewn over from the brewers itself! The best pale ale I drank so far! Huge amount of hops!
Had on tap at 3 Floyds. Nice flavors of hops, citrus/grapefruit, and resin. Probably the smoothest IPA that Ive had.

#1500! Pours a rich honey-golden, thin white head, nice retention, spotty lacing. Smells of tropical fruits abound! Sharp lemon, pineapple and mango. Some nice malt sweetness creeps in under the nose too. A nice balance of hop bitterness comes into play alongside the citrus flavors. Wish this was always available to me...

This is truly the beer that I search out and enjoy. Incredible showcase of the citra hop. Pours a wonderful golden yellow color with an amazing head and great lacing on the glass. Taste the hoppy but balanced flavor of the citra hop. Amazing beer by Three Floyds.

In draft. Pours a beautiful dark gold with a great white head that stays around for a good while. Aroma of citra hops and citrusy notes that accompany. Tastes very crisp and smooth with a great mouthfeel and finish. If I had to compare, I'd say it's closest to two hearted but slightly lighter. Great beer though.

(On tap @ Mikkeller Bar Stockholm, Dec 29 2014) Pours a slightly hazy medium orange with a moderate, dense pillowy off white head leaving lots of lace. Looks like an IPA. Aroma pungently fruity citrus, dank and almost funky citrus peel blend, ripe mango, orange flesh, hop leaves, tropical melange etc, smells great. On the plate, just a touch of caramel sweetness to hold lots of citrus peel and flesh and mango, little papaya and pineapple, seems like more tropical stuff I cant identify, a little dank. Drier towards the finish with citrus oils to the fore, fairly light bitterness and a resinousness that is more like aforementioned oils than typical hop bittering. Average mouthfeel with moderate carb. Just a bit more malt than most APAs but still totally aromatic hop focused with restrained bitterness. Some citra beers seem a little one note but this was really lovely, great fruit flavours with the quality expected from Three Floyds. Would be one hell of a daily drinker at that ABV.

Overall, probably one of the best IPAs out there from midwest breweries (ehhem mad shouts out to Dark Horse Crooked Tree). Ill start with the the downside(s), which is a short list. 1. They do not make enough of it. It is incredibly hard to find. Obviously this isnt against the quality of the beer, just a general annoyance that lingers when one approaches the experience of the zombie dust. I wish I had a "I am incredibly happy I finally found anouther six pack of this beer" feeling but I dont. It sours the mouth. 2. The aroma belies the actual complex and satisfying experience of this beer. Contrary to what it is held out to be, I found the aroma to be a sterile and trite PA smell: some je ne sais quoi PA smell--citrus, pine, whatever, something indicative of PA. The taste is another story. It accomplishes what it sets out to do: be an american pale ale, but does so with an unabashed americanism that will rejuvinate the dead parts of your soul, hence the name, zomie dust. Hints of caramel, cooking bread, nuts, and almost roasted coffee beans combine into what almost turns into drinking candy with a satisfying bittered finish--literally due to the hops but also due to the fact you wish you could keep drinking this beer forever. It also has a good ABV too at 6.2% for everything it accomplishes in the taste and look dept. w

Ive had this a number of times but havent had rated it. Pour from a bottle is a nice light orange amber with a small white head. Aroma is a nice subtle combination of pale malt and hops that remind me of orange zest. Taste is a little sweet with a nice bitterness. Leaves a clean taste at the end.

A centimeter of dense white head on a chestnut beer. The aroma is beautiful, with peach, mango and citrus notes, while the taste is no less wonderful and fruity, with lots of passionfruit. Beyond that, its nothing complex, but very clean and drinkable with firm bitterness at the finish. Thanks for the Xmas present, Janet!
355ml bottle courtesy of the sister-in-law and man. A fabulous pale ale; strong yet refreshing. Hoppy tastes lead citrus and elderflower. Bitter aftertaste. Perfect accompaniment to crisps or nuts.
This is one of those American Pale ales that Exemplifies this style. Beautiful with a resin-y delicious smelling head. The flavor follows through in a big way. Just delicious!

WHY DIDNT I BUY A CASE!!! Thats you reaction after you taste this at 3 floyds brewpub and then try to go to their attached store only to find out that they are sold out! If you like an aggressive beer with bold hop forward flavors then I highly suggest buying at least one case of this without hesitation. I should have.

Drucken på Mikkeller, Stockholm. Svagare doft än väntat, men när drycken når munnen blir det annorlunda. Perfekt kropp och smaken är en fin symbios av beska och passionsfrukt. Grym!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

What can really be said about Zombie Dust? Golden orange appearance with soft, white head. Nose is of pine, resin, bitter orange, grapefruit, and catty. Taste is of pine sap, orange, savory caramels, sulfur, and alcohol. Yep... Its good.

(Draught at Mikkeler Bar Stockholm, 12 Sep 2014) Golden amber colour with frothy, white head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of crystal malt, citrus, grapefruit and resin. Malty, hoppy taste with slightly harsh crystal malt, citrus, grapefruit and a generous resiny/citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty, with a generous hop presence. Nice one.
12 oz bottle pours a hazy amber with a two finger white head and nice lacing. Aromas of grapefruit, citrus, and spruce. Flavor is medium lingering bitter. Delicious!

2014.12.11 - glass courtesy Fuzzy. My first Three Floyds. Big hop presence, yet super smooth. Very nice, repeat purchase worthy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I am such an IPA freak now most Pale Ales don't do much for me. This is a very good Pale Ale with great taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with pillowy white head, good retention and lacing. Aroma is amost as resinous as fresh hop flowers with notes of melon, dragonfruit, rosehips, orange peel mild hints of crushed pine needles. Flavor really follows through on the promise of the nose - mild sweetness,apricot, passionfruit, lingering cantalope notes - lots of fruitiness here from the hops and very little barley showing through. A very pleasant mild resiny bitterness and apricot lasts minutes after a sip. This beer almost works as a reversal of the brewing adage that hops are added to temper the sweetness of the malt, here we have a backbone of hops and just malt added to contribute enough sweetness to balance the pungency of the hops. Exciting.
This beer was awesome. I thought possible the hype for it would make it a disappointment but it did not. Nice foamy white head, hoppy taste as expected, but smooth with a subtle aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2015 Bottle at Borefts, thanks 77Ships! Clear golden, maybe orange little white foam. Aroma of grapefruit, melon, citrus, pine. Taste is malty, caramel, grapefruit, citrus, hops. Gorgeous.

Rerate: Colder this time, very refreshing, all above is still true. Upping the score a bit since this time the experience was better.

Pint at Middletown Fine Wines and Spirits. Pours a orangeish yellow with white head. Nice lacing on the glass. Big, huge hoppy flavor. Pine with citrus, mango, and did I say pine. Very dry finish. Im not a real fan of pale ales however, this was very enjoyable.

finally get to try the legend. Touted as the one of the top pale ales in the world, is it? In a word yes. Deep orange color with 2 fingers of very fluffy white head. Instant lacing. The aroma is one of tropical fruits, pineapple, orange juice. The Citra hops really shine through. The taste is more of the same, orange juice, some pineapple with slight hop bite, but not too much. If there is a better pale ale out there, I havent had it, Exquisite.

355ml bottle 07/29/2014 from Mikkeller webshop. Hazy orange golden colour, frothy white foam head leaving lots of lacing and aroma of malt, caramel, hop resin, tropical and citrus fruits, some pine. Taste is malty caramel nicely balanced with juicy citrus & light pine bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry hoppy clean finish. Very drinkable APA.

Aroma citris, pine, and hop. Amber with nice suds. Taste a smooth citris and hop. Pleasant hop aftertaste. Picked up fresh on my way back from Chicago. It was worth the drive. Gold standard of pale ales.

Worth the hype. Pours bright orange with a nice white head. So much fruit on the nose with a bit of a grassy note. Taste is loaded with citrus and fresh fruit. Nice hoppy finish. Pretty much a perfect beer.
Cask at the Map Room: pours golden amber with a foamy white head, hoppy and grainy aroma, nice hoppy flavor with a dry finish.

300ml on tap. Wow. Aroma is orange zest, pineapple, citrus. Appearance is cloudy orange with a nice white foam. Taste is bitter, gets light sweet and back to bitter. Amazing. A fine dryness, little carbonation. Just right. I love it.
On tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Citrus and spice on the nose. Balanced taste. Refreshing. A great pale ale.
Lighter colored pale ale. Creamy head and crisp finish. Not the bite of some pale ales...beryl smooth. At chop shop Chicago

Bottle from trade. Thanks James! Hazy amber/orange pour with a fluffy white head. Melon, citrus, spice, and wood in the aroma. Its an excellent pale ale. Delicately balanced hop flavors, lemon rind, mango, and pressed olive oil. Long fruity finish.

Received a very fresh bottle from a friend. Pours a nice slightly hazy golden orange color with white head. Citrus, and lots of it, some pine and grass as well on the nose; follows onto the palate. Im really surprised that this has almost no bitterness on the finish. Really good.

Citra is a decent hop... Little plain... But yeah. The balance definitely leans towards the fancy side as opposed to the really drinkable side. Its good, Id buy it... But I wouldnt drive a million miles to get it. I had I back to back with oddside cpa, and it was better... But not like THAT much better.

This is a pretty good beer. Its some kind of nix between pale ale and IPA. Its light like a pale all, but more hoppier towards an IPA. Very citrusy. Its an interesting mouthfeel that I havent tasted before. Its very good, but a lot of people make very good beers. Ive heard this is a world class beer and I dont really buy that. But I would buy a 6 pack of this.

12oz bottle - 

First, thank you to bluesnbarbque for this one (I think it was you bro!). The brightness in this beer was astounding and sooo refreshing. A woody, with great citrus notes, like zesting a fresh Meyer lemon. Moderately high hop flavor, with a clean supporting malt profile but wonderfully hop forward. Finish is clean, hop lingering...a little mouth stripping in the hops which I love. Great beer!

Pours hazy golden. Aroma and taste dominated by tropical fruits, mango, pineapple and grapefruit with some grass, pine and herbs. Extremely well balanced hopiness. Probably the best APA Ive had so far.

On tap at mikkeller. Nice amber pour, thick off white head. No lacing but they were really busy and the glass could have been still wet. Aromas of pineapple, tropical, bit of skunk, pine resin. Medium body, crisp finish with lingering bitterness. Scary good and easily drinkable for the ABV.

Pours a light golden color with an ample off-white head that recedes to a thin lacing. The aroma is full of juicy pineapple, citrus, some tropical fruit & hints of banana peel. The taste is full of tart grapefruit & resinous pine, some lemon zest, a hint of onion, & modest malt foundation on the palate. The finish is drying, slightly herbal & grassy with lingering hints of sweet fruit. Excellent!
Bottle. Surly Darkness Eve 2014. I am unable to find written tasting notes on this.
Bottle shared at Darkness day. Pours golden color. Strong hop and citrus smell. Taste of bitter grassy hops. Good beer but not my style.
12oz bottle pours a yellow amber color with a bit f head. Mild well balanced hop flavors without any harsh bitterness. Nice APA.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen 24/10-14. Aroma: Hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, pine needles, caramel. Taste: Dito. The finish is dry and bitter.

Poured golden to light amber colour with white head. Left beautiful lacing. Soft aroma of primarily citrus with notes of cracker, but nothing overwhelming. Flavor was a hoppy citrus and pine with a mild wheat malt undertone. Medium body with light carbonation and mild bitterness. Very drinkable.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy orange golden with a fine white head, that leaves some lacing. Aroma is citrus, fruit, fresh and mild. Medium bitter, medium body, average carbonation and a piney and resinous finish. Very drinkable.

Cloudy orange with a sandstone coloured head

Aroma is oranges and bitter

Taste is bitter followed by a pleasant orange tanginess with notes of grapefruit. The bitterness is a tease in this one, it entices you with its aroma then leaves you longing for more as it lingers around once the beer makes its way south.

This beer feels fluffy in the mouth, almost feels like youre drinking cotton candy except this cotton candy is the result of a crazy Heston Blumenthal experiment. 

Perfect.

Bottle from unknown in trade. Pours a medium pale orange, lots of white head, full and lacy. Aroma sharp and fresh, pineapple, some resin, graham cracker. Body full yet light, very crisp and refreshing. My second or third time having it, but first since joining RB. Not too shabby.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2016 Tap. Wonderfull fresh hop aroma - citrus, light apricot and lychee. Cloudy orange-yellow, creamy off-white head. Medium light body, creamy mouthfeel. Fruity sweet base, all the hop aromatics a bit grass, slightly wheaty malt base. On the sweet end of the spectrum, but still fresh and drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 GABF 2014. Gold color with a large head. Strong piney aroma. Grainy flavor with a light bitterness. Medium body.

Re-Rate, 4/11/17.  Bottle.  Slightly hazy copper color with a thin head.  Aroma of pine and a kind of danky spice.  Bready, dry caramel malt flavor.  A little resiny.  Moderately bitter.  You could never convince me this beer has Citra in it.
caramel, grass, citrus, woody, amber, hazy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body,, average carbonation, bitter, long finish, medium body,
Light citrus/grassy aroma. Nice golden color with a frothy head that lasts. Good amount of citrus flavor comes, not over powering. Nice balance of malt to hop. Very enjoyable beer.

Pours golden with white head. Immediately hits you with a sweet mango, citrus aroma and some bready malts. Taste is similarly citrus, pine, and faint bready malt. Pretty well balanced and drinkable. Crisp and fresh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from West Lakeview Liquor. Pours a vibrant bright orange with a nice white head. Nose has grapefruit, pine and citrus. Smells fucking fantastic. Taste is more grapefruit with a piney/citrus backing. Caramel and toast malts coming through. Dry bitterness. Soft mouth feel. Perfect carbonation. Drinks incredibly well. Wow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a medium gold color with a big white head lots of lacing on glass. Strong smell of citrus. Taste follows nose with some pinyness and a big hop bitterness. Im not big into the citrusy IPAs and APAs but this is a good beer but not one I need to "truck follow" for.
Golden pour wih a small head. Rich aroma and taste of citrus hops and bready malts. Pretty tasty. Got it quite fresh at mikkeller tasting
