Hazy amber colour, small off-white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, wooden, earthy and some mild herbal notes. Flavour is fruity, wooden, some mild toasted notes along with mild earthy notes. Didnt work as Zombie Dust should work.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2014 355ml bottle served in a pint glass.
A: No comment on the bottle art. Perfect design of Tim Seeley. A zombie that looks coming from a Spawn Graphic Novel. Pours a dark orange color. Slightly hazy. Forms a big, creamy and soapy yellow head with excellent retention and tons of lingering and soapy lacings left in the glass. A thin creamy layer remains forever on the top
S: Citra is really a great hop. I like it very much, mainly because of its tropical fruits profile. Its quite like mango and passion fruit mixed up. Strong malt character too. Caramel malts, mainly. A bit bready in the very end
T: Pretty like the nose. A slightly sweet upfront. Very fruity. Again, strong notes of mango and passion fruit. A bit of oxidization. A bit bready. Strong notes of caramel malts. Moderate but excellent bitterness. Excellent bittersweet balance
M: Medium body. A bit molasses. Good carbonation. Bittersweet caramel aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Excellent FFF
[ BA Review @ 7/26/2013 ]
A little skunky hops used are clean, the flavors are balanced, carbonation is balanced

Pours a glowing deep golden orange tinged hue, dark with light haze, a sunset mysyique and a big offwhite cakey head that laces well and stays moderate sized. Aromas smack from quite a distance away: lively Citra hops provide a boquet of fuzzy peach, grapefruit, tangerines, and lemons, touches of floral, biscuity and pale bready malts interwine with a a big peachy presence, apricots and grapefruit. Tempting. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, big tart peach, citrusy grapefruit and lemons, touches of tangerine, floral bitterness, some grass, lingering fruity melange coupled with pale malts, bread, biscuits, and grainy malts. This brew really is all about displaying this hop varietal though.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2014 Light bronze hue, fairly hazed and capped with trimmed white. Celery seed, papaya, weird aroma. Rocky, mineral, and salty. Caraway and herbed focaccia. Bits of lime and lemon zest. Just crazy. Cant tell if its old or fucked or what.

The flavor doesnt move on from this, and it isnt what I remember in this beer. Its all pungent, garlic and green vegetables, seedy spices, salts. Crusty bread, healthy minerals, and distant citrus pith cant compete with the weirdo herb-salt thing that still leans toward celery, dill, and cracked bitter seeds.

Black tea like texture, with mild carbonation and slick, acidic body. Sugary mid palate, syrupy bittersweet finish.  Bottling date shows 09/19/14 and it seems incredible that so little time could affect this so much.

Pours a clear, bright orange with a thin, white head. Aroma is a big, wet, juicy, pine forest with citrus, and resin. Taste is a strong bitter. Big resin, pine forest, slight grass, and orange citrus. Big, dry hopped taste. Medium body and carbonation. Clean in the mouth with a big, dry finish. Overall a really great beer. Huge wet hop aroma and taste. Resin, pine, and citrus. Awesome.

Pours a slight hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is of mango, tropical fruits, and citrus. Smells of a strong fruity IPA. Flavor is sweet tropical fruits up front and turns to a strong caramel malt backbone. Finishes slightly bitter for a pale ale but overall from aroma to flavor it is well balanced.

Pours a very clean golden color with a nice white head. Huge Aroma, of citrus and pine resin, floral, a little earthy, grapefruit. Tastes of lemon, lime, grapefruit, citrus zest, pine, very bready malt and cereal malt. Nice and aggressive in the hop notes and the body complements this beer perfectly. One of my all time favorites.

Crazy citrus aroma, but not as hoppy as one would expect. Malt backbone makes it very drinkable. Looks beautiful in the glass and it would be easy to knock down a few of these in a row. A nice beer, but not complex enough to be the worlds best pale ale. FFFs Alpha King is more interesting and enjoyable, IMHO.

Big thanks to FlavioSP. 33 cl. bottle @ Borefts 2014. Drank about half. Amber, orange, little white head. Lots of rich pine rein in the nose, sharp, almost touch bark; Thick oily resin taste, nicely bitter, great balance, bitter grapefruit, lots, good malt body but no heavy; Substantial body, every easy to drink. Amazing, one could drink a lot of this. Also the label is spectacular on top.
Sample@ Borefts 2014. Thanks PriorL! Yellow/golden colour, some white foam. Very well balanced Pale ale. Fruity (mango, passion fruit) with bitter finish. Easy drinkable. Very good!
@ Mikkeller. Fantastisk aroma, väldigt fruktig. Bra blanserad humlig beska i smaken. Fin fyllighet och lagom kolsyrad. Gul/orange grumlig.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2014 "well...now FFF makes 2 of the top 3 or 4 pale ales out there. id love a head to head with alpha king. admittedly im a citra sucker and this beer showcases the hop well, but has more complexity than most any other single hop beer i;ve had. i could drink these all day. citrus anyone?"
Not my "cup of tea" as it is a strong IPA tasting brew. I like a few IPAs but this is not one. My friend loves it, so different strokes. The citrus taste, especially the grapefruit, is off putting.

So, I was making my way to Zmajskas prerelease, when I chanced upon the Nova Runda guys & Iznogud having a tasting at Ro&Do, and NRs Marko invited me to try something... Something really, really special. This. Enormous thanks guys (especially Iznogud who brought it I guess). Dark amber/orange. Fresh, "chewy", pungent aroma, gummibears & very very light alcohol (?!), perfumey and sweetish. Damn attractive. Drier interesting silky taste, creamy/yoghurty peachy taste, notes of orange, slightly salty (?), fine bitterness, lovely. Medium bodied, just right. Mild, enjoyable bitter aftertaste. Damn well executed APA, extremely glad to have tried it!
Aromas of orange soda, cardamom, lemon and lime zest. However, lots of lupulin and earthy notes on the long, rich palate. Lush hops, and a great cereal background to showcase them.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Tap @ Mikkeller bar.

Okay, slight hoppiness on nose, citrus, grapefruit, stone fruits and pine. Not in your face hoppiness at all, but more so balanced hoppiness. Taste does not live up to the nose, malt body is quite easy and a nice foundation. Expected more, but it feels like theres something wrong with Mikkellers hoppy beers on tap, or they are all old.
Tap på Mikkeller Stockholm. Dimmig ljus bärnstensfärgad vätska med ljust skum. Mycket Välbalanserad Apa men hypen gjorde att jag förväntade mig mer.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours orange with a small white head and beautiful lacings. Aroma is honey, grapefruit, peach and thyme. Taste is just pulsating with grapefruit. Lovely beer, perfectly rounded and balanced. Medium bitterness and carb. Goes right to the top of my APA-list...right next to Amager's and a Three Floyd's Arctic Sunstone.

- with thirst, Niklas

Served in a glass mug at Local Option. Zombie Dust has a fantastic nose of piney herbal hop goodness. A zesty sharp palate cleansing carbonation scrapes your tongue clean and leaves behind a fruity bitter dank hoppiness. Definitely a hop forward beer and I can see why it is beloved by hopheads. Too bitter for me but impeccably made.

Wow - great beer! Picked some up on the way back from Chicago directly at the brewery. This really has a "grapefruit" kick to it, in the citrus/bitterness taste. The only reason this beer isnt a perfect rating is because I am not the biggest "bitter" beer lover, but it is very good, top few beers Ive ever had. I drank straight from the bottle, and I found the beer very drinkable for being a bit on the bitter side. This would compliment food very well. Overall, not even being my style of beer (not a big Pale Ale guy), I love this beer, and it remains the best Pale Ale I have ever had.

Timothy O'Toole's Pub, Chicago, draft. Aroma is of sweet hops and pink grapefruit. Very fragrant. Cloudy and golden color. Delicious. Not overpowering. Soft and luscious palate. Average lacing. I could happily drink only this the rest of my life. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Not sure why it is labeled pale because it has a sharp citrus flavor with a clean dry finish. Excellent!

Fat på Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm. 
Dimmig/grumlig bärnsten med vitt skum. 
Doftar så jävla bra av tropisk frukt, ananas, mango osv. 
Perfekt balanserad i sötman och beskan. Jag är mållös och då är jag ändå förkyld! 
Vilken jävla öl...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22-AUG-2014, draft @Mikropolis.
Hazy orange with lasting, creamy, lacing, off-white head.
Aroma is extremely hoppy, grape fruit, pine, citrus, exotic fruit. Taste the same with over ripe fruit, caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Fantastic APA. Really fresh.

Bottle 355 ml thanks to Knä (not on ratebeer) Sampled on August 23, 2014. Bottled 3 July 14.Hazy golden color, off-white to yellow head. Hoppy, intense, sweet, caramel scent. Hoppy, bitter, caramel taste. Medium to smooth, still fizzy, mouthfeel. Medium high bitterness. caramel, hoppy, bitter aftertaste.

Zombie Dust pours a mostly clear light yellow with a thick creamy off-white head that lasts a good while. The aroma is citrus, citrus and more citrus. The flavor is citrus heavy with a but of caramel and bread. Overall this is a tasty beer.
Bottle. Finally I got to try this beauty. Hazy amber body with a forever lasing offwhite head. Fruit, pineapple, peach, hops, citrus. I think im in heaven. So delicious.

Kveldens andre fatøl på Ghost Brewers Night på Cardinal: nokså kort skum, men en nydelig aroma og frisk munnfylde. Slank og allikevel enormt smaksrik. Citrus, sydfrukter, appelsin(marmelade). Varig ettersmak. Balansekunst av klasse - en femstjerners apa som jeg bare må prøve igjen.

On tap at Mikkeller Bar Viktoriagade, july 24th 2014. Hazy yellow body with a lively white head. Citra bomb aroma, fresh and crisp grapefruit and orange, taste is similar, with a subtle honeyish sweetness. Good bitterness and a dry fruity finish, an excellent thirst quencher with lots of citrus taste
Hard to find much wrong with this. Drink it fresh of course, as without that it loses its fantastic citra aroma and balanced bitterness. Pretty much the perfect drinker.

It poured a cloudy amber/gold color with a white head. The aroma was of grass, citrus, grapefruit, peach, pineapple with some pine and sweet malty notes. The taste was sweet with some mild hoppiness, tropical fruits and floral notes. Good stuff.

On tap at 3 Floyds. Pours a beautiful dark amber orange color with lasting white head that leaves thick lacing. Aroma is bright citrus with muted orange and grapefruit. Flavor is perfect pale ale: quenching hops, bright hop bitterness with mild malt balance. Bright carbonation, perfect mouthfeel. Amazing.
Tap, Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Hazy, light amber. Small offwhite head. Piney, passion fruity aroma. Very dry bitterness, clean, fresh. Long, dry finish.

On tap @ Cardinal, Stavanger, Brewers night. Pours a slightly hazy golden with a small creamy head. Aroma is nice and hoppy with apricots and orange peel. Creamy body with soft carbonation. Flavour is bitter with orange peel, peaches and some tropical notes, as well as a good sweet malt backbone. Lingering citrusy finish.

On tap at Cardinals Brewers Night.
Pours hazy orange with a small creamy off-white head. Aroma of oranges, tangerine and citrussy hops, lovely. Crisp and fresh clean mouthfeel. Taste is light sweet soft and creamy pale malts, followed by a fresh citrussy hop bomb, lingering bitter herbal and minty finish. Good ++

On tap at Cardinal. Misty golden body with a lasting small white head. Pollen, citrus and tropical fruits mix with pine and resin to invite me to taste the beer. Refreshing hop juice rich with fresh hop aromas. Medium bodied. Smooth to drink.

On tap at Cardinals big Brewers Night, Golden colour, moderate white head. Lovely aroma of tropical fruits and citrus. Lovely hops in the flavour too, but the malty base is a tad too sweet for my taste, with the typical American crystal malts / orange marmalade character. Still a fine beer, which Id be happy to sample again.
DWF Cardinal ølsmaking. Lyst fint skum. Herlig lukt. Malt og humle. Balansert og fin.

Hazy amber. Quickly disappearing off-white head. Wonderful aroma of grape fruit and orange marmelade. Grape fruit in taste as well. Lots of taste as well as good drinkability. Bitter grape fruit seeds in aftertaste.
On tap at Mikkellers Øl & Brød, paired with lobster/calf sweetbread tartelettes. Amber color, off-white head. Aroma of hops: citrus, pine. Taste is very sweet, well balanced with sweetness.

12oz bottle - thx Dan - pours a vibrant gold with fluffy off white head . Great lacing . Sharp citrus nose . Mostly citrus flavor with a hint of earthy hops. Soft lingering bitterness . Outstanding brew . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Strong in hops, but not too bitter. Had this right at Three Floyds pub. Loved it.

Fresh from a newly bottled batch this beer has wonderful citrus with an earthy quality. Dry finish which leaves hops on the pallate. Wonderful malt back bone. I've had bottled examples that didn't seem to hold up like the beer I had at the pub. The fresh bottle was wonderful. Straight up. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had to go to Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen to find this beer! Couldnt get any last time I was in the states, seems like it should be called hens teeth its so rare! Perhaps, I was expecting a religious experience based on the ratings here. It was good, very good, but it had such strong competition in that bar that it needs frther testing for sure. It smells just heavenly, probably one of the most enticing aromas of any beer. Worth the wait? Perhaps.

What else can be said about this amazing beer. I am thankful to live in the Chicagoland area where I have regular access to Three Floyds beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I'm a bit spoiled in that being from the region I've enjoyed this beer pretty much on demand for years now. But I'm actually rating it after drinking from my trading stock while in Oregon and was motivated to do so after trying some great Northwest style IPAs. Zombie has great amber color, the aroma is this sexy BO thing, the Citra hop is perfectly balanced and the finish lingers leaving you wanting more. Truly a world class pale ale (it's really an IPA), distinctive and drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at Munich Tap House, 23rd July 14. Very solid APA, full hp flavour, lots of citrus. Nice and easy drinking. Great stuff

Bottle: First off, lets be honest. This is not a pale ale. Its a friggin IPA. Gold color with a nice head and super hoppy in flavor as well as finish. What was nice is that even though it was dominant in hops in the finish it wasnt blunt bitterness. You could taste the hop characteristics as well.

Draft at Taste the Rarity

Oh man, the line was longest for this, but I went back for it 3 times I liked it so much. Tied for best of the day for me with the Union Gose. 

Pours a hazy orange with a pretty white head. Hay, peaches, and of course grapefruit in the aroma. Imminently drinkable, well balanced tending towards the drier side, clean and balanced. Wonderful APA

If I were about to become a zombie I would kindly ask the zombie about to convert me (eat a healthy but convertible amount) to kindly pause and allow me one last taste of the human world. This might be my choice. 

Full bouquet aroma and after-taste coupled with a perfect citra taste to the tongue. Perfect hoppiness.

Cask tap at Fountainhead in Chicago.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Piece with the Duke. Pours a dark clear gold with a lasting off white head, nice lacing. Aroma of pink starburst, guava, mango, tangerine, oozy pine sap, grass. Flavor is sweet tangerine and tropical fruits up front, morphs to bready malt into a piney finish. Balance here is impeccable, perfect execution of the style. Light/Med mouthfeel, tickly carbo. If zombie dust tastes this good, I'm hoping for the apocalypse.

This beer definitely seperates itself from the pack in being so nicely balanced in hops, brightly floral, crisp, and showcasing a very distinct hop note without booziness or too much complexity. Very drinkable and enjoyable during this season, but could use a little more hop complexity for my taste. Overall very nice.

How: Draught.
Where: Mikkeller Bar, Stockholm.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Sweet malt, hops, caramel, citrus, tropical fruit, hay.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, grass, tropical fruit, pineapple, hops, spices.

Fresh Bottle shared by Tony at RBAG. Golden pour, light whithe head. Aroma is tropical fruit, light hops, malty sweetness. Taste is light floral hops up front, light sweetness follows with some tropical fruit mixed in, crisp clean mild bitter finish. Excellent stuff.

Tasted at Jasons anti-Homebrew-Club gathering, thanks for sharing! It poured a mostly clear golden colour, some chill-haze, with thin but persistent white foam and lace. Non-descript maltbill overpowered by intensely citrusy American hop bitterness, flavour, and aroma. Light-medium body, average carbonation, hoppy aftertaste. Good but not great. Having hoped so long for a chance to try it, perhaps I was bound to be a bit underwhelmed.

Bottle, massive thanks to Richthevillan for this beauty. Hazy golden amber beer with medium frothy head. Aroma is superb. Tropical fruits, mango, pineapple and a little sweetness. Taste is tropical fruits, mango and some grapefruit and fruity pith. A little chewy on the palate. Excellent stuff.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: went to brewpub in munster. i have had this beer previous but did not appreciate it. pours golden with a decent head. aroma is slight hops with some fruit. .taste is orange with grapefruit and pineapple balanced with slight bitter finish. great beer

Bottled from Mikkeller. Bottled in april. Pours orange golden with a white head. Aroma is orange, grapefruit, pine, biscuit. Taste is light/medium sweet with a medium smooth rounded bitterness, finish is smooth fruity bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation.

Tap at mikkeller viktoriagade. Light golden colour with a lasting white head. The aroma has notes of pineapple, citrus fruits, mango and light caramel. The taste is light citrus, bitter grapefruit and floral hops. Very nice and easy drinking.

Wow. Dufter godt, ser godt ud, lækker smag, kompleksitet. God øl. God øl god øl god øl. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its like Christmas in my mouth. Smell is dank pine and citrus, appearance is hazy amber with fluffy white head taste is sweet fruit at first which quickly turns into a little pine bitterness that disappears quickly.
On tap at local option. Great aroma, clean and crisp full of taste. Great beer but I wouldnt say its theTHE best ipa out there!
Not a fan of Pale Ales, but this one is absolutely brilliant. Had it at the brewery and was blown away by the bite that dissipates as the brew leaves the palate. Amazing.

Pours golden yellowa with white head. Citrus, hop, floral, caramel, pine and malt aroma. Hop, citrus, floral, caramel, pine, honey and malt flavors. Medium body and carbonation with a citrus hop finish.

aroma: nondescript citrus

appearance: golden; fizzy carb bubbles. 

taste: nondescript citrus. little sweetness.

palate: slick. lively carbo. refreshing.

overall: overhyped; but quaffable.

Pours a hazy honey color with a nice fluffy of whitehead. Smell is of sweet skittle candy shells and citrus hops. Reminds me of gumballhead a bit but a little bit more hoppy. Taste is hoppy, citrusy and not overly bitter at all and very clean. Fairly dry. Full body but not syrupy or heavy and nice lightly prickly carbonation. From what I can remember it has a pretty typical Three Floyds hop profile and its very drinkable and tasty.

Probably one of the most unique beers I ever had which is a saying a lot. But I find after one or two I dont really want to drink any more of it. I know this might sound weird but it has a dusty but fresh flavor. Its hard to find and something to cherish.

Incredible citrus pale ale. Light copper pour. Nose of grapefruit and citra. Taste is super crisp and ever so slightly bitter. It does what it does so well. Phenomenal stuff...glad I got to try some at the brewpub.

Poured from a bottle. Hazy copper in color. White, creamy head. Thick lacing. Grapefruit aroma. Very hoppy but not overpowering. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Stunning citrus APA, infinite hoppiness with a rich grapefruit character. Would love to drink this every day if it was not that hard to find, one of my holy grail brews!
On draft. A light copper color with white head. Grapefruit and citrus aroma. Tastes of alcohol and citrus. Great beer.

Great aromas of grapefuit and pine, along the lines of a good IPA. Very easy to drink given the low ABV, but still quite flavourful. Pleasant hazy amber when poured. Quite an enjoyable beer. Thanks to bytemesis for the bottle (and also had at the brewery in Indiana)

Thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing this! Very smooth flowery nose. The beer starts fresh and very minty. Lots of menthol-aroma, citrus, very fresh, great combination. The aftertaste is long, minty-fresh, floral with a moderate bitterness and a smooth sweetish caramel body. A really great brew!! 
14/13/14/14

Draught at Local Option, 4/18/14Mostly clear (slight chill-haze) very pale blonde beer with a small but well-retained white head.Grass, nectarine, watermelon, orange peel; such things as youve come to know (and love?) from ye olde citra hop...Honestly, Im pretty middle of the pack on my support for citra. Its fine, probably a lot more aromatic than flavorful. The flavor leans too much towards cat pee, dry, acidic, near-astringent citrics and cheesey, leafy earthiness at its worst. At best, the citrus is still a bit overpowering, though the tropical fruit notes it provides are very enjoyable and can be quite complex.This pint seemed very fresh and the nose was grassy, dusty, citric and had light pale malt sweetness and doughiness on the backend. Clean, no alcohol and a medium-high to high strength of aroma. Of the IPAs I had this weekend, I will grant that this probably had the freshest, juiciest, strongest aroma. So far so good...The flavor delivers much of what the nose promises; citrus, grass, soft pale malts, touches of dough and honey. Some light astringency/dullness from either the hops or yeast (though the beer seemed quite bright, so I was a bit surprised by this). Only a touch of resin on the finish, coupled with a moderate amount of bitterness and tons of lemon and orange zest flavor. Mouthfeel is a touch watery, appropriate for a session pale but the carbonation is ample and not overdone while the sugars are well-attenuated. Great beer, very drinkable, well-made.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2016 12oz bottle poured into a tulip. Pleasing aromas of citrus rind, lemongrass, peaches, and toasted caramel are picked up from the start. After it settles a bit, more of a fresh baked bread crust and tangerine comes through, and even later, the bread crust turns more towards a blackened pizza crust. It pours a slightly hazy copper-orange color with a creamy white head that retains well; it leaves a thick puffy ring with a creamy island and a decent, messy lace along the glass. Great balance between medium high levels of sweet and bitter. The texture is creamy on the palate with a body towards the higher end of medium. The carbonation is a touch effervescent or fizzy, but overall, soft. There?s a very pronounced grapefruit tartness up front, but it mellows quickly after the first few sips. It finishes with a zesty combination of lemongrass, caramel, and stonefruit. The aftertaste is primarily sweet, overripe tangerines and it?s peel with a tart grapefruit bitter lingering in the mouth. Overall very refreshing, straddles the line between IPA and APA.

On tap at Mikropolis, CPH.
Great aroma and taste.
The perfect thirst quencher!

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 12 oz bottle. Thanks Tim! The pour is a clear amberish gold with a decent white head and some phenomenal lacing. The aroma is huge on the citrus with a mild hoppiness and a great piney resin and beautifully done hop profile. The flavor is huge on the hops and delightful on the resin with a great light lingering citrus that I just love. The mouth feel is just great. There is a light body and a medium carbonation and a lingering citrus with a piney bitter hoppy aftertaste. Pretty damn good ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bière dorée, légèrement voilée, vêtue dune mousse blanche modérée. Le nez est explosif et tropical. Des agrumes et des ananas percent ici et là. En bouche, on confirme le miracle  un jus de fruit dangereusement désaltérant. Le Citra fait son oeuvre, mais un profil herbacé très dominant vient offrir un équilibre houblonné redoutable. En finale, quelque chose de poivré demeure avec une touche qui rappelle le gingembre. Un délice du début à la fin. En plus, jai été obligé de la partager... Gneh!
On tap at Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Dominated by tropical fruits, mango, pineapple and grape. With some grass, pine and herbs. This is one excellent beer. Probably the best APA ive had.

(draught) pours a hazy golden-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of heavy green tea, herbal hops and grapefruit, slightly yeasty and green, with a hint of pepper and some lemon peel. flavour is more green tea, oranges and salted peanuts, slightly resinous, with a hint of pale malts in the light-bitter finish. medium- to heavy-bodied with lively carbonation.

Nice amber with a foamy white head. Lots of mango and tropical fruit on the nose. Malty sweet, light caramel, and citrus hop flavors blend well together. Listed as a pale ale but more suited to the IPA category. Dry, fruity, and somewhat bitter finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller Bar, Köpenhamn (55 DKK/20cl). Fruktig och maltig, exotisk frukt och tallbarr, grapefrukt, medelbeska, medelfyllig. Avslutningen är besk med humliga och fruktiga toner.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Leuchtend Orange im Glas, cremiger Schaum, blumig Citrus in der Nase, Malz weniger süß als die Farbe vermuten lässt, gute Hopfenbittere. Schönes Pale Ale

Bottle from Mikkeller Shop. Pours a slightly hazy light amber body with a medium creamy off-white head. Nose is grapefruit, lemon zest, mild peaches, pine, nettles and hints of tomato plant, lime and caramel. Taste is apple cores, citric peel, grapefruit, tomato plant/herb-like grassiness and hints of straw and caramel. Medium body and carbonation. Very nice, and probably even better fresh (mine was a bit older than that).
Bottle. Nice orange pour with a decent head and lovely passion fruit and mango aromas. Flavor is perfect with that and a bit of resin. Amazing stuff. Thanks, Robert!
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle from a recent trade. Sadly my bottle may be a little dated. Not getting the wafting hop aroma others are mentioning. Still a really nice drink with a good aroma, hop profile, and caramel malt body. Apricot, peach and light citrus aroma. Flavor is tropical again as you would expect with a citra hop beer. Finish has a touch of metallic bitterness and good flavor. Medium malt body. Prefer others as a top ipa but will not pour this out.

Bottle to glass. Pours a mostly clear amber orange color with light tan head. Aroma has a light caramel malts with tons of hop character, apricot, peaches, light floral notes. Flavor is a perfect balance of fruity hoppy bitterness and sweetness. Light to medium in body, maybe a bit more than Id expect for a pale, but still incredibly drinkable. Maybe more of an IPA? But honestly, who cares? This stuff is liquid gold.

Bottle sent by vw73182, thanks! Approaching one month old. Pours orangey gold with small white head that subsides. Aroma is tremendous dank and lightly scallion-y pine, candied mango, pineapple, lychee juice, orange peel. Maybe the best pale-ale aroma Ive experienced. Taste is orange peel and mango with hints of honey and pine. Crackery malt, fruity but not sticky. Lingering bitterness. So refreshing and delicious.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2015 Bottle shared at home. 

Pours a cloudy amber/gold with a medium frothy white head. Aromas of grass, citrus, grapefruit, peach and pineapple with slightly pine and sweet malty notes.

Taste is sweet, raw citra hops with alot of tropical fruit. Alot of floral notes to it aswell. Slight grass. An extemely nice APA.

Rated on 5-19-2012 (Bottle courtesy of a neighbors son) This beer pours a small semi-fizzy off-white head with a short retention, slightly hazy gold body, fizzy, fast rising carbonation, and spotty lacing. The aroma is malt, pine, floral, and grapefruit hops. The flavor is lightly bitter, pine, grapefruit hops, and caramel malt. The mouthfeel is lively and this beer is medium bodied. This beer has a lingering hoppy aftertaste that is not offensive. It is not overly hoppy tasting and is worth trying.
Draught at Mikkeller Bar. High creamy long lasting off-white head. Clear amber body. Powerful flowery aroma. Nicely hopped fruity flavor. High carbonation. Long bitter finish.
The hops smack your nose as soon as you pour. Color is a cloudy golden brown. Huge citrus flavor especially grapefruit and lemon. Great finish that stays with you while. Incredible beer.
Smell is like a pure hop package, very fruity and flowery. Taste is lemon and mango. A little bitter in the middle.

Thanks to whoever randomly handed this over at the Surly Tap takeover. Comes together extremely well. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Finishes with medium bitter finish. Nice floral-tasting hops in here. Bottle I assume.

Bottle received in trade (thanks Bruce!) - Very hoppy aroma right from the opening of the bottle. Nice copper color and a generous head. Lots of grapefruit in this one. Nice texture and medium dry. Some might consider this a blasphemous statement but this beer and Alaskan Freeride seem very similar to me.

Bottle poured into tulip glass. Zombie Dust never fails to disappoint. This beer pours golden with an appetizing haze. The aroma hits you with a burst of fresh cut grass and chopped fruits. The mouthfeel is satisfyingly medium bodied with a lively fizz and a depth of taste that awakens your tongue. There is a je ne sais quoi here - something that drives both hopheads and casual beer drinkers alike to go wild over this beer. I think it has something to do with the bold but not overpowering hopping and the incredible gush of tropical fruit that sets this apart. There are many beers with a similar feel but this is very highly rated and for good reason.

Large creamy heads rich amber pour strong carbonation aromas floral crisp hops tropical note citrus pine stone fruit grass the flavours medium strong bitter caramel citrus goodness peel or zest touch grapefruit peach mango lovely sweetness grassy note floral touch ripping ale the finish good all round tastes hops are superb strong bitter and balanced sweetness cracking stuff

On tap at Out of the Park Pizza in Anaheim. Crisp, clean grassy hop nose with lemon zest, light pine, dry hay and a bit of grapefruit. Pours the color of clear light yellow honey. Super clean taste of pine resin, very bitter hops and touch of sweet lemon and light spices. Very dry finish. A deliciously clean and refreshing pale ale through and through.

Only Three Floyds could place an American Pale Ale at the top of Ratebeer. Not only in its pale ale class, but overall against IPAs, stouts and porters. This beer is a must for beer enthusiasts. Pours a clear amber. A clean, flavorful beer. Highly recommended.

On tap at Cobblestone. A cloudy, dark golden poor. Piney aroma. Some sweetness coming through underneath, but the bitter leads. Sharp carbonation. A little lingering bitterness. Another very good 3F beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
IMO, this is the perfect representative example of the type. Buy as much as you can fresh and drink it all.

På tap Mikkeller bar Viktoriagade dagen före CBC 14. Sitter ute och solen steker. Som alltid lite svårt att fokusera på sensoriken utomhus, men ingen tvekan om att humlen är pigg. Tydlig doft av weed. Mycket bra balans, väldigt balanserad och god.

Immaculate in the glass with creamy lasting clean white head atop a burnt-orange body. Nice spider-vein lacing. 

Aroma is toffee malt together with generic citra qualities (grapefruit, grassy, floral) and growing pine. Textbook. Sadly no deviation.

Palate is little oily but smooth and pleasant. Taste is more textbook. Fairly sweet pervasive orange, citrus partners a light toffee malt. Bitterness is light and earthy.

Like a hitter that hits .330 year after year but only gets a handful of HRs, it eschews the razmatazz to focus on fundamentals. It is immaculate in that regard but Kernels PAs and Beavertown Gamma Ray are its equals, if not better. Perhaps I was just seduced by its hype and it needs another taste.

Bottle from Justin. Pours clear amber with a small white head that dissipates quickly. The aroma has a ton of hops. Very resinous, some grapefruit, tons of pine, almost a floral weedy note. The taste has a nice bitter kick, semi dry. There is tons of acidic citrus.. Grapefruit orange and more. There is more bitterness on the finish. I think this and alpha king are about as good as pale ales can be. Wish it was more available in my area.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a frothy beige medium head. Aroma is peach, citrus, petroleum, caramel, grapefruit, herbs. Taste is light+ sweet and light+ bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes light sweet, crisp, nice bitterness and hoppy.
So close to an IPA I feel it should be. Amazing use of Citra. Golden wheat color. Foamy white head. Such a citrus aroma. Quelled by the malt quite nicely

Pours golden with a finger of fluffy white head. Bold aroma of honey malt, grass, resin, candied citrus peel and orange blossom. luxurious palate with a perfectly fitting medium carbonation. Initial taste is sweet, almost candied malt that slips it a musky light resin with highlights of citrus peel and herby grass. Finishes off sweet with a medium, earthy citrus bitterness.
Bottle - Boozy orange and caramel with a bit of spice. Clear gold with a thin white head. Caramel and floral hops. Perfumy and oily. Nice and well balanced.

A- Pours a orangey hue with a two finger, off white head.

S- Citursey, bready, zest.

T- Citrus up front, lemon zest, orange, tangerine that moves into bready notes and finishes with a light hop bitterness.

M- Medium bodied with crisp carbonation.

D- Awesome beer. Easy drinker that is one of my favorite pale ales to date.
On tap at mikkeller. Pours clear golden with a white foam. Aroma of grass and pine. Taste is intensly hoppy, very nicely balanced with malt.

c/o NeoHippie. Thanks again!

Aroma - very bold WC hop and caramalt, with some grapefruit
Appearance - orange-coppery body; clean and clear; 3/4" white head, eventually rings out with some foam on top
Taste - West Coast hops perfectly balanced with caramalts, and some nutty like quality, with a bit of grapefruit
Palate - body is medium; slightly oily; carbonation is average; finish is a nice hop burn
Good. Best part of the brew pub. Let down by food it was paired with. So needs another try.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2014 Hoppy fruity aroma. Hazy orange color with a thick head that quickly dissipates. Strong hoppy taste with a bitter finish. Had heard great things about this beer. if you like hoppy you?ll love this. A good beer may give it a second chance some day but too hoppy for me to love it. Bitterness mellowed after a bit. Very cool name and bottle though.

Thanks to Gumballhead for the bottle. 

Pretty excited about trying this one. Im going to be as partial as I can though. Pours a beautiful murky golden orange with a one finger white head that seems to be holding up well. Aroma hits you right as you open the bottle and start pouring it. Apricot, tangerine, pineapple, pear, honey, and pine sap. The aroma is about as good as it gets for a pale ale. Flavor follows suit by being perfectly balanced and drinkable. Sweet citrus flavors, the perfect amount of bitterness from the hops, and a nice malt back bone to round it out. Not overly complex but very well crafted. Overall this is the best APA that Ive had in a long time, maybe ever. Im going to keep this short so I can sit back and enjoy this one.
Draft at brewery - nose is cat urine straight up. Sips is way better: malty back bone, citrus note and slight grass. Balanced compared to the previous three other FFF I just had.
Orange color with 1 finger white head. Orange and grass smells. Grapefruit tasted, and bitterness.

Finally getting a chance to try this awesome brew. This is insanely dank and amazingly drinkable. Nose is dank and pungent, so unique. Overly ripened fruit like pineapple, mango, and papaya. The appearance is perfect; golden sunset with a sticky offwhite head. The taste is again dank and sticky with a wonderful hop flavor that follows the nose. Not to much bitterness but rather very well balanced with a super smooth mouthfeel for a pale ale. Finishes not to dry and the hops die off rather quick making you want another sip. Overall, this is definitely worth the hype.

Served: 12 oz bottle
Look: pours a golden honey color. Slight haze to it
Smell; smell of hops. Strong citrus aromas
Taste: strong taste of alcohol, lemons, grapefruits.
Feel: light feel. heavy carbonation. 
Overall: good flavor, nice even beer. Good for summer evenings.
First drank: home Decatur March 2014

Orange gold, with a small white. Predominantly citrus, pine, some floral notes, some bubblegum. Bitter, some sweetness. Medium body, quite acidic. Really good. Very well balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I can see why this is such a sought after beer. Nothing about it is weak. It has a nice golden color, great smell and a taste that reminds me of Lagunitas Sucks.

Födelsedagspresent till mig själv. Infriade mina högt ställda förväntningar. Kunde lika gärna kallas en IPA, grym balans.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle at home. Smell is citrus and grapefruit, floral. Pour is a golden hazy body and a white head. It tastes just like it smells. Grapefruit with citrus. Overall this is a great beer...Would definitely try again.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 Solid beer, worth the hype. Pours hazy orange with a small white head that disappears quickly. I didnt get much lacing on this either. The nose on this is herbal, pine, mango, pineapple, citrus. Nice fruity hoppy taste throughout. Very smooth, not much bitter that I got. More of a sweetness factor in this. Thought the flavor would burst and pop a little more based on what Ive read, but overall I wasnt disappointed. As far as APAs Ive tried, I like only Pseudo ahead of this.

Poured into a sniffer... all grapefruit and citrus in the nose. Nice light fluffy head with a golden hazy body. This beer doesnt dissapoint. Falls just shy of an ipa, showcasing everything that we have lost in pale ales. This hits all the way in the back of the jaw. An excellent beer.
DAMN!!! This is some great stuff! Has an aroma that is reminiscent of B.O. But the flavor is sweet and hoppy and citrusy. LOVE IT! Super smooth too.

Cold bottle, 2 months old. Pours dark orange, hazy, slightly sparkling, minimal white head. Aroma - orange pith, slight pine. Body - medium, quite foamy in the mouth, carbonation is medium to high. Taste - sweet, musty caramel, pine, grapefruit, peppery finish. Good balance. Overall - an accomplished pale ale. Nothing too special at 2 months old, but I dont think I could get it any fresher in the UK.

Sampled @ Hunahpu Day 2014. Ive wanting to try this for quite a while and finally had it and it didnt disappoint. Pours hazy orangish color with off white head. Aromas of citrus and pine wit a hint of malt. Grapefruit and pine flavors with moderate bitterness. Medium body with average carbonation. Very nice.

Very nice APA. Good balance and strong malt backbone. Aroma is slightly citrus sweet. Taste follows. Not as crisp as a psuedo. Dark amber in color, I prefer more orange. Bitter aftertaste does not stay around too long which is good.

Pours hazy golden orange with a semi dense white head. The nose on this is bonkers. Just the perfect ballance of aromas. You got crispy herbal pine along with fruity mango, pineapple and abricot. The mouthfeel is on the lighter side which is great. Drinkabilty is high and I like that in an ipa. The flavours are well ballanced too and the best part is that theres not much bitterness in the finish. Just fruity hoppy goodness all the way to the bank.

Bottle shared by Andre -- thanks! Hazy, gold with white head. Aroma is huge on citrus, pine, tangerine. Big big fresh aroma. In the mouth, the body is surprisingly light. Very dry, moderately bitter finish. A little caramel malt underneath. Now that Andre mentioned it, theres mustard in the finish. Weird, but hard to shake now. Overall: damned nice.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2014 Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop.
Amber, moderate hazy body, with a big, creamy, lacing, white head.
Wonderful aroma of citrus, passion fruit, peach, candy, some pine.
The taste...What a taste!! Lemon peel, peach, passion fruit, pine, some biscuit, some candy sweetness, super crisp, super fresh, perfect!
Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a medium carbonation and it finishes smooth, medium bitter, dry, with citrus and slight pine notes.

Amazing stuff! Spotlessly clean, fresh like spring and with an almost unbelievable balance of aroma and drinkability, complexity and crispness! The ratings are just true, there is no better APA at all and Im not even sure if there is an IPA that keeps up with this for me. The first beer that I gave a 10 for taste, citra hop orgasm!!

DUft: lime gran, citrus, meget sød i duften. frisk frugt, 
Smag malt. gran citrus, meget fin bitterhed af humle som prikker godt på tungen

Pours clean amber with a nice, slightly orange, white head. Aroma is incredibly fruity and fresh. almost minty fresh. Pine, citrus, resin. Taste is quite bitter, but has a nice, fruity sweetness to it as well. Not as fruity as the aroma, but still prominent grape fruit and some unripe pear or something.
Not extraordinary in many ways, but man this is well balanced and tasty! An almost perfect pale ale!
This is what put Three Floyds on the map. Good, but unlike most, I dont think this is the greatest thing I have ever had. Lots of hops, citrus. Enjoyable.

I love this beer when extremely cold. Creates a unique experience. I would buy more often if it weren't so hard to get. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle supplied by WillRunForBeer. Opened at his Merrimac flat. Many thanks! To long-stemmed tulip, it pours a copper-toned orange with which a snowy white head 1 finger stood. Aromas of hop oil, pistachios, wool, Bible paper, krill oil, elderberries, and Crystal malt. Tastes the same with the addition of cedar bark, sesame seeds, pine needles, and gym socks. Could drink a lot of these. Just enough enough sweetness to take the edge off.

12 oz. bottle poured into a perfect pint. Slightly hazy orange liquid. Aroma of citrus peels, floral hops and a touch of pine. Not a hop bomb, but the citra showcased in this beer is spot on. Really well balanced with the malts. Medium mouthfeel with a lingering bitter hop finish. Very drinkable!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ home. Bottled 12/05/13. Clear golden yellow, big white head that settles nicely, good lacing. Aroma, hops, fruits, citrus, orange, passionfruit, grapefruit, peach, floral, pine, malt. Taste, malty, with a lot of hops, similar to the aroma. Medium body and oily mouthfeel. Bitter pine aftertaste.

12 oz bottle from Steve
Well what can you say grapefruit bitter hops fantastic

An incredible beer.
Aroma: Citra hops, grapefruit essence and a hint of spruce.
Appearance: Amber orange
Taste: Light bitter
Palate: Medium, a creamy and lively taste with a long finish
Overall: Thoroughly enjoy this beer. Just wish it was not so hard to get.
Even getting the beer at the brewery is like being in a Seinfeld episode. It truly has cult following.

Bottle: Thank you kindly Sir Matt for this extra! Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized snowy white foamy head on top of of a hazy orange colored beer.
Aroma has lots of hoppy aromas like the typical fruit, (grapefruit, citrus, lemon and apricot), herbal and flower tones, also hints of something malty, some caramel, yeast and light mealy tones.
Flavours of hops, hop fruits? , hop bitters, malts, porridge, some caramel, herbs, bitters and yeast. Very floral fruity with all the hop spirits up front!
Aftertaste is fruity, bitter, light malty, light herbal, some yeast and some woody porridge.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied and a creamy texture.
Wow, very nice!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: I CANNOT get enough of this beer! I am lucky enough to be able to score a case every few weeks here in Wisconsin. It hasnt been delivered in a few weeks, but hoping I can score some more of this masterpiece soon as it is hands down my favorite beer to try yet.

Love the citra nose and taste a little under carbonated on tap but this beer is a great pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Such a great beer, wish it wasnt so popular now... nearly impossible to find.
I got a case and thought I was gonna get jumped walking out of the beer store... I only didnt give ZD a perfect score because last years taste seemed to have a hint more body.

A: The best citra flavor ever. Skunky, sticky, citrus.
A: Sam Adams Boston lager glass... came out Golden Orange with the FFF zombie king staring at me in the background.
T: I missed you ZD. Perfect hop balance with not being too bitter, except about 20 seconds after the taste. Like I said though- I thought I remembered more body in my previous tastings.
P: Medium Light, creamy texture that has a soft bitter aftertaste.
O: I love this beer, if you havent had it and you are an IPA/PA fan then you need to plan a trip... there are similar beers with the same citrus flavor but none as delicious as this pale. I just wish it wasnt so popular and damn hard to find!

Pours a cloudy amber with a white fluffy head. Aroma hits with strong orange and grapefruit. Taste matches aroma nicely. The hops dont overwhelm but instead the whole beer is balanced and really enjoyable.

From bottle, pours a cloudy amber with a tight 1 finger head and oh so sticky lacing. Aroma punch of grapefruit, citrus and dank hops. Lovely. Taste nearly the same as aroma but with a nicely balanced malt backbone. Smooth mouthfeel with just the right amount of carbonation. Slight piney hop bitterness on the finish. Truly one of the best beers available. My favorite so far.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 On tap at Three Floyds Brew Pub. Pale golden colour. Aroma is fruity hops. Taste is big for a pale, even an American styled one. More like an IPA, but super sessional. Fruit and hops all rolled into one package. Mild stickiness. Overall, looking forward to drinking more of this one!

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 Bottled 8/12/14 (today is 8/19). Crystal-clear gold with some bubbles and a thick head that dissipates quickly. Smells is grass, citrus, slightly warm, hint of soap. Full-bodied, slightly sweet orange-tangerine that quickly dries out into resinous grapefruit. Very good.
Poured from bottle. Color is a hazy darker orange. Aroma is not too strong. Can hardly taste the alcohol. Real smooth solid taste.

Bottling information is unreadable.
Appearance: Slightly hazy amber-orange body with a frothy off-white head.
Aroma: Big citrus aroma, some floral and grapefruit with big orange and hints of mango. A bit too focused on the citrus, with a slight harshness to it. Almost great, but maybe Im discovering I dont love this hop as much as I thought I did. My homebrew pale ale isnt far off from this in the aroma.
Taste: This is balanced very nicely until the finish where the bitterness is a bit out of balance. Big orange throughout with lime and hints of floral mango and grapefruit. Papaya sits on the palate after the sip.
Palate: Soft bodied with mild carbonation.
Overall: Boy for all the hype this receives Im wondering why people dont just homebrew. You could brew a similar beer to this for $40 or so whenever you want it. I have a homebrew that I thought I fucked up, an all Citra pale ale, and nope it just isnt a hop profile I love like I thought I did. This isnt bad by any means but hell its not even close to being hard to replicate this on any level and the hop profile is definitely something you better enjoy if its all youre using.

UPDATED: MAR 17, 2014 Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a tight 1 finger off white head and nice lacing. The aroma is citrus hops with a touch of bready malt in the background. The taste adds sweet bitter notes and a little vanilla. The palate is super smooth and drinkable considering the hop bitterness with just the right amount of resin. Excellent pale ale, perfect balance all around. Iâm glad I got to try this. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fresh on tap. My favorite APA to date because it delivers the dank west coast pale characteristics at just the right ABV. The flavor doesn't get lost as you swish around a time or two and you ain't going to fall over after a couple.
as a non-hophead this is not for me. but if you are, seek this stuff out immediately.
Really good. Sweet hops up front with a good malt backbone. Not much more that hasnt already been said. Dig it.

I have had this many time and it is always consistently great. Has a nice hoppy grassy aroma and a clear golden amber color with an off white two finger head. Taste is on the dry side with that good hop grass and straw flavor. Carbonation is just right with this beer going down very smooth. An all time favorite for me.

From T-Roy.  Pours a clear deep orange color with off white head. Citrusy hop character followed by piney and danky notes. More of the danky piney hops in the flavor with some mild citrus. Pretty goooood beer.

thanks to seth823 for making my first beer trade great. On to the beer, zombie dust is a very fantastic brew, it has a nice citrus/hoppy nose and pours an orange color. the taste is immediately met by a slight sweet bitterness but then quickly followed by a powerful citrus taste and a smooth clean finish. when comparing between TGB Pseudosue i would say they are dead even in quality even though they are different from each other in their own way.

01.03.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, leafs, newly cut lawn, hops, sap, light malts, hints of dried fruits and pine needles. Taste is grassy, leafs, hops, sap, lawn, bark, light malts, hints of pine needles. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

Fresh bottle. Pours clear orange with tall white head. Great aroma - floral, grapefruit. Taste is that distinct citrate hop (sweet, grassy) with some orange and lemon. A "juicy" beer for sure with a clean finish. Glad to finally try this one.

12 oz bottle - nice, fresh trade extra! Aroma has intense fruit notes with loads of orange rind, passionfruit, light mango with moderate straw and sweet malt. There is a pine quality as well. Not crazy dank, or oily, but the hop profile is very well mixed. Pours a deep orange with slightly off sticky white head. Very nice retention that leaves big webby lacing around the glass. Taste is up front citrus rind, with soft tropical notes of mango and passionfruit. After taste is mostly sweeter malt, light hop bitterness and almost no astringency. Mouthfeel is creamy with a somewhat light body and medium-high carbonation. Lingering hop resins with a nice citrus bite on the palate. Overall a super flavorful, and hoppy pale ale that is not bitter or too dry as some IPAs are. Good creamy mouth.

Two week young bottle pours a golden orangeish hazy hue with a modest amount of white suds. The around is a beautiful fresh orange tangerine citrus bouquet with a little grainy sweetness. The beer starts rich and grainy with a great balance and an orange marmalade jam thing. The initial pop of fresh hop flavors leads into an earthy citrus dried pine bitterness that lines for a while blending back into the sweeter marmalade and grain flavors. Bright refreshing balanced and refined, this is one great American pale ale.

12oz bottle from M&F CPH. Bright gold with thin white head. Fantastic aroma: pure citra brilliance. Loads of juicy mandarin, peaches, passion fruit, mango and white grape. Taste follows suit, huge tropical fruit followed up by bitter grapefruit and a touch of spruce. Clean biscuit malt adds just a touch of sweetness. Medium bodied. Dry finish, lingering tropical juiciness. Stunner

Hazy golden pour with 2 finger fluffy head. Nose is grapefruit, floral hops citrus, pine resin. Taste is super smooth, with sweet grapefruit juice, hop spicing, pine, a title bitter kick at the end. Very juicy quality, has some body, super smooth and drinkable. The juicy quality mellows the hops a lot, but you still get that pine/ hop flavor without too much bitterness. Up there with the best pale ales I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Its number one on my favorite beer list. I just wish it was sold over by me

It tastes great!

Wow is this a really good beer. It has a nice aroma, it has a nice appearance, it has a nice taste, and it has a nice palate.

From the bottle this pours a hazy, golden orange color and topped by a small head of off white foam that quickly recedes and leaving streaks of lace on the glass. The aroma is bursting with notes of grapefruit, orange, lemons and resinous hop oils. There is also ample amount of floral hop bitterness to go with the toasted bread malt base and a touch of honey for balance. The flavor follows with the orange, lemon, and grapefruit citrus hop taste up front followed by some toasted caramel malt to lend balance. Medium bodied with effervescent carbonation that leads to a nice and dry finish with the hop bitterness following through. Each sip begs another. This is an awesome pale ale and another winner from the guys at 3 Floyds. Good stuff.

12oz bottled 2-11-14, courtesy of Bytemesis, Thank you! Complex aromas of dried citrus rind, sweat, diesel, fresh cut grass, resinous herbs and florals. Full, rich palate with average carbonation. Big flavors of citrus, pine and mango, intermingled with dried florals. Impressive for a single hop pale!! Basically an IPA in my book. Awesome stuff!!

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 35 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden amber with a white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, tangerine-esque citrus, flowers, and pine - with a dry finish. Not necessarily that different from how I saw it last time (from what I can read), but the aroma really is lovely.

21/2 2014:
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours golden amber with a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, citrus, flowers, and pine - with a dry finish (3.7).

12oz., bottling date 2/11/14, so 9 days ago. Hugely aromatic nose, juicy and fresh, plenty of citrus fruit and hop florals, with notes of orange, tangerine, pineapple, faint toast and a light degree of honey, candied lemon peel and caramel sweetness in the background. Lightly hazy light golden-amber in color with a very fine, lasting head of white. Flavor profile is very nicely balanced between the leafy, fruity, juicy, citric hop flavors, mild degree of toasty malt sweetness, and the light-moderate levels of hop bitterness, drying out nicely at the finish, providing a very refreshing feel. Palate is sufficiently effervescent and refreshing, carries the flavors well, just a touch of resin here and there, and with a medium body. This is the real deal. Absolutely stellar.

American pale ale
6.4% ABV 60 IBU

APPEARANCE: poured a hazy burnt amber with an off white pillowy head. Lots of sticky lacing. 

AROMA: Very dank, herbal and hoppy. Bright fruits, grapefruit lots of lemon. Hints of wet grass, bready malts on the backend. 

TASTE: Lots of grapefruit on the front. Very oily like a zombie stirred this with his finger. Citrus notes pop again in the middle with the hops before finishing with Carmel and pale malts. 

MOUTHFEEL: medium body with medium carbonation. Slick and oily with snappy finish that leaves you wanting another sip. 

OVERALL: I had to keep reminding myself this is a pale ale. It drinks wonderfully and has such a good hop presence that it could be a mellow ipa. Lived up to the hype that surrounds it. The art work is amazing!

RATING: 4.5/5 Zombie Heads!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from trade. Pours orange gold with ansmall clingy white head. Very nice grapefruit, lime aroma. Taste follows nose, lots of citrus hop flavor, nice pale malt backbone, with just enough sweetness to take the edge off.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2014 bottle thanks a lot to evilcougar!! finally got to try this bad boy. poured a clear orange colour with a lasting white head. incredible smell of peach, grapefruit, mango, citrus, bit of malt, pines, wow such a complex mouthfeel. and a long lasting hop taste. not overated at all! this is close to perfection! love to drink this all day

Köszi Armando!

 Belül igen opálos, narancssárga színe van, habja fehér, igen termetes, lazább szerkezetű, buborékos, mégis igen kitartó. Illata mega fenyős, gyantás, borókás, gyümölcsös, zöld teafüves, virágos, friss szénás, élesztős. Íze is követi az illatokat, még több gyümölccsel, borókával, fenyőrüggyel, grapefruittal, sok keserűvel. Közepesen testes, elég szénsavas. Utóíze keserédesen, citrusosan jön, aztán a legvége betyárosan keserű és száraz. Bomba bébi! Hát igen, a citra az citra... ;)
Bottle. Grapefruit aroma. Really great beer. Grapefruit flavor woth a lingering bitterness.

Received this from Ed5388. Nice Golden Amber hazy pour with a slight finger head and good lacing. Citrus choppy aroma was great. I couldnt wait to taste. Citrus choppy taste just like youd imagine from the aroma. Had a pleasing sweet finish and great lingering palate. Great beer.

12oz bottle (dated 1/21) thanks to NHhophead! Pours semi-clear toasted orange with a finger of head. Nose is big juicy citrus, peach, mango, tropical fruit. Taste is more juicy tropical fruit, peach, pineapple, balanced by a nice light fruity malt presence. Finish is bitter fruit, orange, citrus, subtle touches of sweet malt. Lives up to the hype. Awesome and so easy to drink.

Want to know how to kill the extras in a trade. Throw in one of these. Thanks Treebute. Pours a slightly cloudy and dark pear. Scent is lovely citrus candy. Nice medium hop bite front leads into a perfectly sweet back end. Lively head and body. Bottle - Received in Trade

Beer pours slightly cloudy with lots of carbonation. Color is a medium orange color/reddish color. descent head with great lacing. Smells floral and spicy, with hints of hops, gum and sweetness. Absolutely amazing smell. The taste is more bitter than sweet and you can really taste the hops and spices. Although the flavor is not nearly as amazing as the aroma. There is a strong carbonated feeling on the tongue and it has a slightly waxy finish. An excellent APA but not as awesome as I had expected with all the hype. This is a must try though for all the beer.

Dont normally get too cute with anything less than a Triple IPA, but this kid seems pretty fucking Romeo. Bit too chirpy with the tropical and citrus shit, but slipped down the gullet while staring at some handsome bastard in this towering infernos bathroom mirror.
Nice fresh aroma. Very hazy pour. Poured from tap at craftsman table and tap. Not quite as tasty as PseudoSue, but still very good. I?m really liking these citra hop beers.

This is an excellent pale ale, nothing three Floyd's brews is bad! This is an awesome beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very nice pale ale. Can't ask for much more. If I was a huge pale ale guy I would rate it much higher. Alas, I am not. However, this is probably my favorite pale on the market. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Where do I start....first 3 Floyd's brew and I am ready for a road trip to Indiana! Smells so good and tastes even better!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reviewed from notes from my stop in Indiana last summer.
On tap at brewpub in Munster.
The appearance is a hazy orange/brown body, slightly clear, one finger white foamy head dies within thirty seconds, some carbonation is seen rising at a moderate pace.
The smell has a strong citrus and piney hops through sweet and bitter tones, becomes slightly floral
The taste has a super strong sense of bittersweetness combined very well all throughout the drink, bittersweet aftertaste and a dry floral finish.
On the palate, its about a light to medium, shows a nice sessionable quality to it, very smooth, well carbonated for the style and for me.
Overall, this is a very well done beer, a hoppier APA that I would welcome again if given the chance.

I was stopping in for one beer at Jeffrey prior to grocery shopping and I was about to leave when bartender is like we have a few bottles of zombie dust if u want one.... Um yes. Pours orange out of bottle with small head and some lacing. Nose is terrific of tropical fruits and light spice. Tastes of juicy grapefruit, honey dew melon, guava, pine, some peppery notes, and light molasses. Super refreshing and nice palate that coats the mouth. Pretty delicious.

Had in, bottle, draft from brewpub & cask. Pours crisp & golden with frothy white head. Slight citrus tones modest sweet & bitter taste. Solid ale that competes with the best. Drinkable through & through. Still a little overrated though and makes it annoyingly hard to get. Unfortunate because its a good one to keep in the fridge and have occasionally.

Pale Ale? IPA? However, it is categorized, it is delicious! Many brewers have showcased the Citra hop, but few, if any, do it as well as Zombie Dust. Pours a rich honey-golden, thin white head, nice retention, spotty lacing. Smells of tropical fruits abound! Sharp lemon, pineapple and mango. Some nice malt sweetness creeps in under the nose too. A nice balance of hop bitterness comes into play alongside the citrus flavors. Finishes juicy, leaving me wanting the next sip! Or gulp!

Rating # 200. 12 oz bottle. Rated side by side with Alpha King. Color is dark golden with a dense light yellow head. Aroma is a bit better than AK, lots of pineapple, citrus and elderflower. Taste is not as good as expected. Hoppy and citrusy, grapefruit and pineapple. Not as sweet as AK. To be honest I liked AK better than this.

Thanks to NHhophead for the bottle. Pours dark gold with a medium, long lasting head. Big fruity hop aromas, with taste the same big citrusy hops. Very smooth mouthfeel. Definitely the best pale ale Ive ever had.

Pours a lovely copper with a nice head that doesnt dissipate, and leaves lacing that sticks to the glass the whole way to the bottom. Aroma: An amazing abundance of Citra hop aroma comes wafting through at soon as you open it. Taste: This is all Citra hops with a hint of malt to take the edge off the bittering which doesnt linger. Leaves a dry finish on the palate. One of the few IIPAs thats actually earned its rating despite the hipsters gushing over it.

Great aroma. Lots of topical fruits just oozing out.
Nice pour - 1/2 finger of head - very nice carbonation.
Very nice taste - excellent back of the tougue after taste. 
Big fan of a citra hop used the right way, and this is an excellent example of that. Fantastic beer.

Pours a copper with a big white head. Smells wonderful, big bright hop aromas with pineapple, grapefruit, papaya, mango, and pine. Tropical fruit and bread flavors with a bitter finish that is fairly dry. Smooth mouthfeel with a medium carbonation level. Solid pale ale.
UPDATED: DEC 18, 2014 One of the better Pale Ales Ive had, but I do think there are better options considering how tough it is to buy this beer.
Absolutely love this beer along with others from FFFs by far the best APA I had nothing compares

Picked up a case today from the 3 Floyds brewery (along with some Gumballhead and Pride and Joy). Have not had this for a while. Bottled same day. Little head, nice color, hoppy, citrus aroma. Great flavor. To date probably my favorite IPA. Wish it was not so hard to find, but then again, more enjoyable as a treat from the norm. Cheers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Big bold taste with lots of hops. Taste of Citrus and hops. Great combo. 

Hard to get. Very popular beer from Three Floyds. Best place to buy it is at the brew pub.

0,355l bottle as a gift.
Opalescent golden beer with a small off white head. Aroma of grass, lemon, some malt, spicies, juniper. Fine, balanced flavor with juniper, weed. Smooth mouthfeel, not too much bitterness, well hidden alcohol. Very well made!
Out of bottle thanks to syndicate. Good pale ale, nice citra flavor. Definitely one I would drink again.

Orange hazy pour with medium sized white foamy head. Big marijuana smell, and i dont mean the smoke, but the actual plant. Citrus, large on grapefruit and pine in the aroma as well. Really smooth bitter flavor which gradually appears. The right amount of sweetness to ease the bitterness. Medium body with equal carbonation. Perfect. Pale ale as any would imagine it should be. From trade with Jimsal27, thanks Jimmy, fantastic brew again!!

Traded for this from Seth in Indiana. Thanks buddy
Poured a beautiful orange hue with a thin white head. Nose was grapefruit, and slightly grassy. Tasted heavy citra hops. Great beer

A: hazy golden color with a white head
S: pine, citrus, passion fruit
T: oranges, grapefruit lots of citrus
M: fizzy, thin, oily
O: one of the best pales made

On tap at the Three Floyds brew pub. Pours a light clear amber. Sour hops on the nose, strong. Really awesome flavor, extremely smooth. Wish there was a tad more bite but otherwise spot on

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours gold, little head. Nose is tropical, grapefruit, pineapple, lemon. Lots of lemon flavors, mild bitterness, very well balanced! Great beer!
Flaske: Et par måneder gammel, men stadig helt exceptionel god. Frisk humle i duften. Smagen sidder i skabet. Virkelig en øl man kan blive ved med at drikke. Lidt for bitter men det er småting.

Copper pour light huge frothy white head with great lacing. Great aroma sweet fruits light cereal apricots deliciously sweet. Avg palate. Flavor is mellow well blended fruits cereals a light grass bitter finish sweet oranges a light rusty grain finish away from perfect. Very good beer.

Though Ive only found one six pack in my life and have never found ZD on tap, it blew my mind all over the living room. First of all the small is ridiculously dank; like Dreadnaught x 3. The taste is just a bold and delicious. The color is also unique; its a yellow with a bit of brown with lots of haze. Taste is pungent in the best way possible; indescribably unique and great ( I will say that the darkness carries over to the taste). Probably the best experience Ive ever had simply drinking a beer by myself. Having it once only makes it more frustrating that it can basically only be found by chance, as most stores (even in Indiana) sell out the one case they are lucky to obtain in maybe an hour.
On tap at the brew pub. Pours a medium golden amber with generous head. Aroma is very floral with generous pine backing. Taste is piney and floral with good bitterness. Smooth. Delicious.

Bottle. Hazy medium dirty orange-brown body, medium off-white head. Intense floral, piny nose with tropical fruits (papaya) and also catty herbal tones. Floral, potently citrusy and catty body, with lemon, orange peal, and papaya; oily and resinous with a toasty malt badkbone. Firm bite but with very light alcohol/heat. Very good.

Hoppy up front. Citrus overtones and nose. Smooth finish of malt and orange. Most notable is the hops up front. All around wonderful ale!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark orange with a decent tan head, nice lacing. Aroma is very citrusy, tons of grapefruit and orange, sweet caramel undertones. Taste is awesomely hoppy , but isnt overly bitter, it actually is very tame on the bitterness in my opinon, nice citrus flavors, a bit of lime in the finish, clean finish. Glad i got ahold of some of this finally. Great APA.
Pours clear golden delicious. Thick poofy white head. Fruity aroma. Bitter start, hop forward, sweet finish. Lime aftertaste. Tingy mouthfeel. Overall great APA. although I would push it more AIPA
Backlog bottle thanks to so many good ratebeerians. The look is clear with a thin white head. The smell is dirty, spicy, dry hops. The taste is medium bitterness, hops, and grassy.

Poured from bottle to glass. Straw orange hue with fizzy white head that dissipated to lingering small bubbles. Aroma is strong hops, citrus, pine, melon, straw, yeast. Mouthfeel is nice with a moderate light body and good carbonation. Taste is sweet with a really nice hop bitterness following and a CO2 sharpness in the finish. Overall, this is a fantastic IPA.

An aroma of caramel chai and citra hops with bubblegum. Appearance is clear gold with thin white foam and almost no lace. Taste is of mild grapefruit bitterness with a balancing caramel bubblegum sweetness. The palate/texture is perfect, a foamy mouthfeel without being syrupy, wow. Overall, this is a great beer! I am so very happy I was able to experience this beer!

Finally got this bad boy. Bottle. Clear amber-orange. Very floral nose. Good full mouthfeel. Very dry-hopped, very floral. I didnt think an IPA could beat Two Hearted for "solidly the king of IPAs" until this beer.
Bottle. All around very good assertive pale ale. Hop explosion without excessive bitterness. Lots of floral arms, yellow, cloudy.

Bottle shared at Daves gathering. Pours gold with a white head. Very pleasant aroma that is filled with citrus along with a bit of caramel. The flavor is very similar with caramel and ample fruity citrus. Medium bodied. Very nice ale.

A golden ale with a off white head. In aroma, very nice biscuit malt with floral and piney hops, citrus pulp, citrusy goodness, very nice. In mouth,, a nice citrusy biscuit malt with floral and resinous hops, light funky side, very nice, alcohol warmth. On tap at End of Everything beer fest Dec 22 2013.
Color a little light, and flavor after is pretty bitter quick.Very hoppy. Good lacing, very drinkable, Not my favorite from 3 Floyds but still a great beer from a great brewery.
Pours a copper color with a small lacy off white head. Tight bubble mouthfeel and long sweet finish. Notes of brown sugar, tangerine, Downey, pith, and grain alcohol.

Intens citrus floral yellow fruity notes. Crisp dry dusty taste. Light bitter mouthfell. Wonderfull brew.
Classy piwo starting off with hops and citrus. Vanilla snd coriander hitting in the back. Superb, well balanced and high aromatic.

Bottle from Santa ;-) - many thanks, Blafa! The beer pours out in a light cloudy amber colour with steady head and medium body. Wonderful aroma of hops and vanilla. Taste of fresh, ripe hops, citrus, spruce, coriander, pink pepper and malt. Medium dry, light bitter finish - great beer. Easy and nice to drink, delicious, refreshing AND quaffable.

Bottle. Poured pale amber with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma and flavor are well-balanced between the lovely Citra hops (tropical fruits and citrus) and a deep caramel. Medium body. Extremely drinkable. Extraordinary beer.

I wanted to try this beer because of all the hype. Got one in a trade with evil cougar (thanks Jeff). Pours a golden honey color with small white head. Leaves lacing on glass. Beautiful citrus aroma. Sweet malty taste upfront followed by bitter citrus finish. Creamy mouthfeel with excellent carbonation. If I was a pale ale fan this would be my favorite beer. Well made excellent beer.

This is a 65kg wrestler kicking asses of 50-55kg wrestlers. Definitely one of the best if not the best "APA", but closer to Pliny than to Sierra Nevada pale ale. After drinking a few Three Floyds bitter american ales from APA to IIPA you can definitely taste a house flavor. Yeast seems English and similar to Firestone Walker. Tropical fruit and citrus on the nose with the standard grapefruit bitterness from Citra. A great beer.

I feel like this beer is truly one of a kind. I was lucky enough to score a few of these bad boys and enjoyed them 100%. Pours perfectly with bright orange color and a large head. Smells like grapefruit and marijuana. I can not explain this. I get lemongrass, spice and a perfect malt to balance the hops out. I like that this sits in under 7% because I often find that I want to continue drinking beers like Rampant by New Belgium or Hop Juice by Left Coast, but I cant handle more than 3 beers in a quick sitting. If I want IPA, I want this. Always. Just sucks its so limited. Hands down the best Pale Ale Ive had in a very, very long time.

A hazed honey amber body sits beneath a tall, slightly delicate yet smooth head leaving spots and dots of lace all around

At cooler temps, crisp citrus rind and hints of grass are balanced by sweet caramelly malts, a lightly resonating, strikingly dry medium-light palate offers a bit of tact after a few quaffs, fresh leafy hop notes, a juicy grapefruit character comes into play with some warmth, followed by peach accents, each bringing an added layer of vitality to this very fittingly named bone dry brew

12oz bottle code 1183-1186 11/26/13 at 45º into 18oz Spiegelau Authentis Casual Beer glass

It's color is a murky golden, nice level of carbonation. Smells sweet and citrusy. Very nice bitter taste, citrus explosion. Delicious 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle.dark golden colour with medium White head.Aroma is nice fruity of mango,oranges peel and fresh hops,long fruity taste with smooth well balanced flavor and long taste,of hops and caramel.

Hazy gold/orange our good. Sized head. Aroma is all citrus fruit, grapefruit the. Most obvious. Citrus hops, pine, resin balanced with caramel sweetness. Medium body. Hyped and rightfully so. Im going to stop here and drink another.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2015 Ive heard a lot of hype about this beer and was really eager to try it. Definitely lives up to the hype! Tasted from bottle that my wife was able to acquire...thanks Susan. Pours a hazy orange with a great fluffy white head. Lot of lacing. Big time citrus aroma! Robust grapefruit and mango notes. Taste is similar to the nose with citrus bitterness but its incredibly balanced with caramel sweetness. Dont Get me wrong its a hoppy beer but its a nice constant bitter taste mixed with the sweetness. Has a nice crisp mouthfeel medium bodied overall. Just a phenomenal beer. Drink and enjoy! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Fruit hops upfront, mango and pineapple. Lots of Citra with a good malty character as well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft: Thank you Jungle Jims! There was a lot of hype around this beer... And it lived up to it. Wonderful example of what hops can be like... Its a nice hazy golden orange with a healthy white head. Aroma is citrus and caramel. Flavor is a perfect balance of the grapefruit and citrus played against the bready caramel... This is delicious.

This pours a semi-cloudy, golden amber color with a slight head. The aroma is rich with bitter hops. The taste is smooth, clean, and crisp. There is a decent amount of hops for a pale ale. Well made, perhaps a little over-hyped but an all around well made pale ale.

12 oz. bottle in trade with Fletche00. Hazy caramel color, with a medium, creamy head. Grapefruit, orange rinds, good herbal hops, cut grass, and coriander. Sweet and grainy up front, with a nice, mild bitterness through the finish. Medium body, very astringent, and sticky. Overall, this is a very nice pale ale. Very good aroma, and a pleasant flavor and mouthfeel.
Caramel, floral, citrus notes, and with a nice crisp slightly bitter finish.one of my favorite 3 Floyds beers

Great pale ale. Poured into the glass a dark golden color. Smells of overwhelming citrus hops and fruit notes. Taste is more of the same. A lot of citrus and bitterness. Probably the hoppiest pale ale I have had. I would think of this as an IPA. Really good beer though.

Bottle, pours bright orange/amber with slight haze. Good white head retention. Bitter citrus peel, a little pine, a little lemon. Astringent mouthfeel; orange peel, some grapefruit. Nice dry finish. A great pale ale, but < hype.

I'm not sure what can be said about this beer that has not already been said..
 Other than:

YES.... IT IS AS GOOD AS EVERYONE SAYS

It is a liquid poem to the hop

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle thanks to Omar, color is pale amber, thick foamy head, aromas of tropical fruit and dried apricot, flavors of honey, yeast, mango, grapefruit, hay, light pine, with a crisp, dry finish... tastey!

Great color beer, has a golden color with light head pour. aroma of intense hops. Taste is light with a hoppy citrus flavor. Not bitter, overall smooth amazing taste of hoppy citrus, with a bite. Very happy I was able to snag 2 bottles today.
Big nose from the citra hops, beautiful deep golden orange color. Bright taste and not at all bitter, glad I finally got to try this one!

Hazy orange color, good white head. Hayish, gooseberry leaves in the nose. Medium-bodied. Grapefruit, grass ... some fruity notes. I am not impressed, maybe not the best keg.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, caramel, hops, resin, pine and mango. Bitter finish with hops, citrus and caramel. Exquisite american pale ale.
Fantastisk IPA. Mange noter af friske frugter og smager virkelig dejligt. Også en flot duft og står flot i glasset.

Bottle shared with Mathieu87.
Special THX to Thijs!
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, citrus, florar, grains.
TASTE: hoppy, decent, bitter, very nice and refreshing.
UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 Very nice beer. Great smell, herby and rich. Good carbonation. Taste is nice as well. Complex and with lots of hop. Great beer.
Almost perfect, pours a light golden color, nice citrus aroma, lighter body and very drinkable, nice hop flavor with a citrus finish. Very good

Had it on tap. Good color, great grapefruit aroma, but the flavors a little more subtle than I found myself expecting. Tough to live up to the expectations. It was good but I wont go crazy trying to track it down again.

Well... Not worth the ratings... Unfortunately I think people rate this high just because what they're told or what they see. Not rate on what they taste smell and experience. It's an ok pale ale. The aroma is sound but definitely not a crisp hop smell or taste. Very muted flavors and aromas.
