You can't tell me honestly that this American pale is a better all around pale as compared to say a new glarus no coast pale ale or a Half Acre Daisy cutter or even the classic sierra pale or mirror pond. No way. Repeatable? Sure...top rated pale? Not in my book. But overall 3 Floyd does not make over rated beer... That are very very sound.. This one just missed...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2014 For my 500th rating I chose Zombie Dust. Bottle pour at the Three Floyds pint night at Jungle Jims. Pours hazy gold. Nose lots pine, mango, resin. Taste grapefruit bite, some evergreen and then sweet malt. Smooth mouth. Bitter finish. Great beer.
For the re rate, I believe a little fresher sample.   Unbelievable nose. Mango and resin.  Taste more tropical fruit than the last example.   Awesome big flavors.

Light copper with a dense white head. Lovely clean, hoppy aroma with the usual tropical suspects, citrus, grapefruit on top of a light malt background. Flavor is chewy, fruity and intense yet clean, sharp and perfectly balanced bitter. Solid as usual when it comes to FFFs hop-forward stuff and an overall lovely US-pale ale.

Bottle straight from the brewpub, thanks to joshmcg000. Slightly hazy, dark gold to amber pour with a 1-2 finger, soapy and creamy head that has great retention and leaves decent lacing. Aroma is crazy, just huge juicy citra hop presence, tons of mango heavy tropical fruit, citrus, fruity floral, a touch of spruce and spice, theres some caramel and biscuit and a little doughy touch, but the hops are what this is all about. Flavor is nearly as awesome with tons of juicy citrus, metric tons of tropical fruit, nice, fruity floral notes, a little spruce, a little cat box, and a sweet strawberry-like fruity note. The malts are a little more pronounced in the flavor than the aroma with some toast, caramel, bread and a little sweet cereal. The palate is also awesome, medium body with a creamy, juicy, almost chewy entry, velvety blanketing light, but slightly sharp carbonation and still juicy, mineral off dry finish. Fantastic beer all around, easily one of my new favorites.

(bottle - 12 oz) Hazy gold pour with a fluffy white head. Sweet and citrus hop aroma with a good amount of tropical fruit notes. Flavor starts off bitter but quickly goes to a very juicy and sweet citrus middle. Slightly dry finish but very sweet and citrusy all around. Smooth and very easy to drink.

Pours Hazy copper with small amount of white head. Aroma is citrus and tropical fruit, very nice. Crisp light to medium body, very easy to drink. Hoppy bitterness up front, a little bit of grass some pine and lots of citrus and tropical fruit flavors. Caramel malt backbone. Pretty great APA.

UPDATED: APR 12, 2014 One of my favorite beers, served in the comfort of my home in a pint glass. Has a strong citrusy aroma with a hint of orange. The appearance of this beer is down right sexy, the fluffy head lets out an amazing aroma and you can see the carbonation bubbling through the golden pale haze. This is a Live beer that sticks in your palate for some time. Suggestion, try it with some parmesan cheese.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Served from the tap at Hopleaf in Chicago, this came amber with a white head and huge citrus aroma. Lacing all the way up the glass. The flavor is out of this world, and while I suspect the IBUs are high, there is no bitterness. Mild sweetness and a long pleasant finish. Rating revised based on three different batches on tap and three more in bottles. None of them in the bottles measure up to the experience on draught. 3.2 to 3.4 in bottles. Amazing experience on tap.

Great beer; lives up to the reputation. This and Alpha King are great pale ales...almost perfect. Just wish both were easier to get ahold of, which is odd because I live in Indiana.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fabulous beer. Perfectly crisped IPA that is both tempting and addictive. Don't pass this one up.

Pours a golden wheat color, quick head that doesn't linger. Taste is very hop forward, softening in bitterness as it crosses the palate. Aftertaste is very pleasant and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clean and crisp aroma, malt sweetness on both palate and aroma. Good beer overall

A second choice which shows the depth of choices at Hopleaf in Chicago. Pours a light orange. Big zesty citrus aroma. Good medium bitterness. Lively and easy to drink. I would have this every week if it came to LA.

Bottle. Not much I can say that hasnt been said. If citrusy hop juice is your thing this is your beer. Ive been drinking micros since 1995 and honestly Ive never had a better beer. If I could only have one beer the rest of my life, this would be it.
Fresh and flavorful. Citrus fruits tending toward tangerine. Pour from 12oz bottle.

Bright gold color with large fluffy creamy-white head and nice lacing. Aroma is humungous and mouthwatering. The citrusy hops are unbelievable. Flavor is nicely balanced with sharp citrus notes, big bitterness, with a smooth caramel malty finish. Very similar to some others like Pliny and Head Hunter, and this ones price tag is a bit high- like most 3F beers....

bottle thanks to tom10101pours hazy and glowing light golden orange with a very nice white head, good retention and lacing. dank and spicy fruity hops, loads of mangoes, citrus, light pine, pepper, melons, candy-like notes too. nicely supported by a lightly toasted and spicy malt bill with just a hint of caramel. moderate carbonation - could be brighter, light body - oily, very nice dry juicy-fruity-spicy-citrusy finish. incredibly balanced. very good brew!

A - pours light orangy amberish yellow. Nice color. Low white head that doesn't last. S - this is a nice clean pale. Simple but bold and really nice. Fruity nose, citrus and a hint of tropical fruits, pine and light dank hops to a nice biscuity vegetal malts. M - smooth drinkable with a hint of bitterness and a nice malty end, neither of which is heavy handed. Really well composed. T - taste follows the nose well with the fleshy citrus leading into pine and a light grassy note. Palate is a nice biscuit and vegetal malts with some caramel malts as well. O - a nice pale. The best? Maybe not but damn. Good none the less. 4.2

Bottle poured into a tulip. Pours lighter yellow with medium white head. Great nose. Clean citrus and a little bit of pine. Taste is also very clean. Light citrus and simple hop bitterness. Probably the best pale ale out there.

A: Golden Straw/Mild Amber Hue, Passes Through Some Light, White Ring Head, Some Lacing

S: Citra Hops, Mildly Sweet Malts

T: Grapefruit, Mildly Piney, Crackers

M: Great Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Sticks to your Tongue, Dry, Crisp

Overall, a really solid APA with a great citrusy taste. The reviews dont lie, it is that good.

Strong danky and fruity hops in the nose. Medium hop bitterness, flavor is full of grassy dank. Slightly sweet. Not bad, but a touch sweet. 

---Rated via intercellular device

In a word: phenomenal. The grassy citrus organic flavor and hops dont overwhelm, but rather come together to create a slightly bitter yet extremely drinkable pale ale. Every sip you take, theres something new in here to discover, its an endlessly enjoyable ale that shouldnt be so hard to find.

One of the best beers I have ever had the pleasure of spending a night out with. Great bitter/citrus finish that stimulates all those hedonistic synaptic connections in my GM. I would battle a city of Zombies for one more bottle. Must extend a thank you to those boys at FFF!

Pours a hazy bright orange with a thick creamy white foam head.

Smells of grapefruit and lots of tropical fruits along with a nice malty sweetness.

Tastes is similar to the nose. I fall in love with this beer every time I have it. Loads of tropical fruits and grapefruit. Taste starts off a bit sweet rounding into a nice clean bitterness on the finish. Very well balanced beer as some malt presence is there, but the citrusy hops are the star of the palate.

Fairly light beer with a good carbonation level, but still a slight bit of stickiness.

One of the best pale ales Ive ever had. I cant wait until they start bottling this. We got a growler to go and ended up finishing it in the hotel room. I could drink this beer all day.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2015 Huge thanks to tectactoe on this one. My exact go to style. A citrusy pale ale. And that is what you get here. An all out fantastic beer. Great beer by a cool brewery. Go get this now.

12 oz bottle from a trade with BrewJay. The pour is lightly hazed orange copper with a well formed 2 inch egg white head. The aroma is resin citrus peel hop, bright cracker malt, and a pleasant mineral earthiness. The taste is a spicy resin, some citrus peel bitterness, touch of grapefruit, the cracker malt, and more of the resin mineral in the finish. Bright flavors. The palate is light to medium bodied, spritzy carbonation, and the dryish mineral earth finish. Nice one, thanks Jay.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear deep golden copper color, with a billowing egg shell head, that falls slowly to a cap and leaves heavy rocky lacing. Big Citra hop aroma with, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, mango and lemon rind along with some light pine and floral notes. The taste mirrors the aroma, with a fresh and biting grapefruit character that controls this with a zesty bitterness that spreads all over. Balanced through the middle by a sticky sweet blend of tropical fruitiness and sweet malts. Which then finishes with lingering dry notes of pine and bitter pith. Smooth, dry, and sticky mouthfeel, with a medium body and moderat prickly carbonation.

The Aroma is just wonderful. Not only is it wonderful but it lasts. Most beers of this nature doesnt hold the aroma till the end. Slighly mirky appearance but still looks good.

thick texture. very drinkable. This beer is near perfect. This is the benchmark of a Pale Ale/IPA should be like. I cant wait until this is available in Michigan

Bottle. Golden Orange with small head and lace. Grapefruit rind and bready aroma. Mild crackery mango fruity malt with extremely dry medium assertive grapefruit rind finish and a hint of astringency from fairly sharp carbonation. Excellent, but not as good as hyped and not nearly as good as psuedoSue, but I did have that one on tap.
Bottle shared during the Foothills BA Sexual Chocolate release. Pours a clear gold with standard white head. Juicy and slightly spicy. Plenty of malt backbone. Delicious!

Amazing citrus aromas. A perfect pale ale. Proud to say it's brewed in Indiana. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From 12oz bottle. 

Pours an opaque amber with slight white head. Aroma is a pleasing mild citrus. Slightly tart citrus hop flavor, leading to a somewhat bitter aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle with a couple knuckleheads at work. Pours a hazy orange amber with thin but frothy off-white head and nice lace. Nose of grapefruit, apricot, pine, mango, pineapple. Medium body, a slightly sticky mouthfeel. Nice citrus and fruit hop flavors with nice bitterness. Well balanced APA. Havent had one in a couple years and it was almost as good as I remembered.

Bottle - Fantastic color with a small head that has nice lacing. The smell invites you to drink it. Very carbonated. You don't taste much of the alcohol. Best Pale Ale I've had

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

WOW! There is no doubt...This is the best Pale Ale on the Planet and Probably in the underworld too! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Pours a nice hazy darker orange color with a small white head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is heavy of orange/grapefruit, citrus, hops, grass and some pine and malt. Flavor is moderate sweetness with fruit, citrus, pine notes and medium hoppiness that strengthens as it warms up. There is a medium bitter/hop finish with not much else. Mouthfeel is overall dry and carbonation is average. This is a solid beer.
I would eat your face to get this beer! If your a lady we can negotiate lol

12 oz bottle pour a few months back. APAs are quickly becoming one of my favorites styles of craft. Zombie Dust is a near perfect beer. Its complexity of hop, malt and smoothness makes you want to keep on sucking these down. If you get your hands on ZD, savor the moment! Great job 3Floyds!

Had to have this at Franks tasting because an unnamed individual who had promised to save me a bottle was unable to control himself and drank up all he had very speedily, altho after having some, I can sympathize with that. Nice color. Aroma of honeysuckle, orange, and lemon. The flavor is wonderfully balanced, with orange cranberry muffin, lemon oil, apricot, and pine. It is super flavorful for a brew with a modest ABV, & very drinkable too! I can see why people are hustling to get their hands on it. The best beer Ive had in quite some time.  Another triumph from 3F!

Awesome brew. The brewery often sells out of cases of this beer and for good reason. As much as I love 3F Gumball Head, this beer is notch up. An ueber hoppy APA with mostly late addition Citra hops. A bit cloudy in appearance. Big citrus-y grapefruit flavor with a solid malt backbone. This beer never disappoints. If you can get your hands on one...do it.

Top 5 beer had many times on tap at 3F brew pub and in bottles. Terrific nose and strong citrus flavor with a nice bitter bite finish.. Unique in that it has spawned many copycat brews. Will continue to drive down to Munster on a regular basis.
Amber pour with a white head. Aromas of pine and citrus hops. Flavor is very similar with a nice malt backbone. Finish is slightly bitter hop bite but not too much. Very drinkable, good session beer.

Bottle courtesy of agl108.  A hazy rust/amber pour with a thick beige head.  Pine, grass, zesty citrus rinds, grapefruits, caramel, spice, and a hearty breadiness comprise the aroma.  Goes down medium to full-bodied.  Caramel, butterscotch, and sugar cookies dominate the initial taste.  Zesty citrus rinds and grapefruits finish things off.  Spicy with some anise cookies here and there.  Slightly bitter at the end.  Definitely a unique taste.

A totally unexpected bonus in a trade from shrubber85, cheers Roger!
Pours a very hazy deep amber with sizable amber tinged fine cream head. Initial aroma is fantastic with freshly crushed pineneedles and sweet mangoes, though this subsides somewhat on standing for a while. Initial mouthful is a pithy fizz bomb but as it warms out comes some lovely rounded seville marmelade, pinenes and a warming base of orange shortcake all in all working fairly well. Full bodied and sweetyet pithy finish. I can see why this rates so highly.

Gift bottle. Pours dark orange with a light white head. A bit of pine on the nose. Nice malt backbone. Theres some hop bite on the finish. Its solid. Its quaffable. I dont know if its one of the best of the style.
Light golden pour with white lacing. Citrus and grassy herbal hop aromas. Flavor is super fresh herbal and citrus hop tones.

Had it on tap at FFF brewery. Tasted like a flat alpha king.


Zombie dust is an alpha king lite in my professional opinion.

Too much hype associated with the name.

It didn't live up to my expectations.

Availability should be better.

 I think the kids with gaged earrings and tattoos just drink this beer because of the art work on the label and the name.







---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is wood grainy, appearance is golden taste citrus bitter palate is grapefruit, over good pa

Pours a slightly hazy amber with billowy off-white head that dissipates quickly. Good lacing. It looks like a world class ale in the glass. The nose is all hops. Intense tropical fruit aromas with a whiff of grass and lemon. Bitterness at the front of the palate gives way to a malty middle that finishes with a floral, lemony hoppiness. Light bodied with great carbonation make this a very refreshing pale. Overall this a well crafted pale, complexity to rival the best DIPAs on BA with an ABV low enough to make it just about sessionable, a most impressive achievement. Perfection in a glass!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is a wonder to drink. Ive had it on tap at Three Floyds as well as various locations in the Milwaukee area. The golden body with a white head just looks like what a beer should be. The citra hops are very pleasant on the nose and palate. Very hop forward, but not bitter. Just a super easy drinking hoppy beer.
Bottled, thanks to Omar. Smell hops and citrus. Pour hazy amber with white head. Taste hops, citrus, floral, and did I say hops. Such a great beer!
Nice beer. Very smooth, not too much bite. Great flavor, good aroma. I can definitely see why people like this one.

On tap at the Village Idiot in Lexington. 
Pour is clear, orange-ambe in color, and topped by a small head that hs decent retention and rather limited lacing. 
Hoppy aroma aloows only a hint of malt to show through. 
This is a weedy tasting IPA, with enough sweet hops to give a momentary sweet taste at the start and to limit the overall bitterness to a moderate level.

12 aug 2013, bottle. Yellow, clear, some steady bubbles. Nose is amazing: grapefruit rind, peaches, moderate alcohol. Med/thin body and mildly fizzy. Taste is nowhere near as nice as the nose. Mildly bitter field grass, faint grapefruit, some caramel malt. I'm kind if disappointed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow this is really good. Worth the hype. Massive aromas of fresh pine needles, ripe tropical fruit, and a bit of dank. Dank grapefruit flavours. Very smooth and easy to drink. A benchmark for apas.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass. Pours a gorgeous golden color with a thin head. Aromas of spruce, grapefruit, pear and fresh-cut grass. This thing has a TON going on. Sweet flavors of pear are very well-balanced with a punch of resiny hops. This is a pretty incredible pale ale.
One of my favorites. Citris aromas prepares you for a nice balance of citris and mango flavor. This beer is sooooo smooth!!
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2013 On draft at FFF brewpub poured into nonic pint. Coppery with a finger of white head. Smells like ripe mango and pine resin. Crisp carbonation. Outstanding!

Snifter pour a nice amber color with a yellow tinged head that lingers. Amazing hoppy aroma, and a nice hoppy taste. Surprisingly smooth mouthfeel. Almost feels thick. Nice lacing down the glass. Lives up to hype

It's rare that a beer that is this hyped lives up to it, but ZD does! The floral aroma and hoppy bite are perfect. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great colour and head. Citra hops give it a fantastic hoppy flowery aroma. Taste is very smooth with a medium bitter.

bottle

Aroma: Fruity/citrusy hops

Appearance: Dark amber with slight white head

Taste: Fairly bitter to start, the citrus element is really subdued

Palate: Average carbonation, slightly bitter finish. Medium body

Overall: Not bad, but no intense citrus/hops as I would have expected.
Hazy orange color pour with small head, grapefruit aroma perfectly hoppy with Citra hops!! smooth finish! Overall a Great Beer!

Bottle [12oz] c/o Glouglouburp. Pours a cloudy orange-copper with an average size lasting foamy off-white head. Minimal lacing. Awesome aroma of citrus hops, citrus fruit, tropical fruit and some resiny & piney notes. Flavour follows, nice and hoppy and fruity, plenty of citrus, with a dry, moderate bitter finish. Average bodied. Pale Ales dont get much better then this, I could drink tons of this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Poured a clear amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of grapefruit and citrus hoppy notes is quite sublime with some very limited bitterness notes. Taste is also totally dominated by the best fresh grapefruit hoppy notes I have ever taste. Some citrus notes are also present with bitterness being at a low level for that kind of hops attack. Body is average with good carbonation. I was sceptical about how good this beer could be but was I ever wrong.

Bottle, thnx to Summer Santa. I was looking forward to try this, finally got the chance. This pours a slightly hazy, darker blonde beer with a nice, small amount of white head that stays on during drinking. Little lacing or carbonization in the glass. Aroma is terrific, loads of Citra with a slight amount of a yeasty, fruity backbone in it. Great in balance. Flavour is medium bitter with a great, citrussy dryness in it. Nice, full flavors and the hops shine trough during the entire taste. Well crafted, another succes by Three Floyds.

From bottle. Orange pour with thick white head. Strong floral/citrus aroma. Taste is slightly bitter, with the floral/citrus flavor. No real malt balance, but still great without it. Good mouthfeel. 6% abv is well hidden
One of the best pale ales Ive had: on par with the Moa PA... Similar complexity and depth of flavors.
Had this on tap at 3Floyds. Solid IPA that I would put up there with Ranger, Two Hearted, Alaskan, IPA, etc. Will add more details on it later.
Rated in April 2012 (Backlog) - Gold in color with a small white head. Aroma is of dank dark woods, grass and pine. Taste is of spicy hops, herbal, pine, resin, dankness and grass.
Very nice. Hoppy. Crisp. Very nice. Could drink multiple bottles of this stuff.

Bottle(fresh): pours a medium golden color with a nice white head. Smells of pine and citrus that is also in taste, along with hints of grapefruit and pineapple--love the citra hops! Great hop forward taste but not overly bitter with a nice light, bready body and mouth feel. Very nice balance and very smooth. Easily one of my favorite pale ales!

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2013 Looks good, not much head, good lacing. Grapefruit aroma, a bit hop forward, smooth finish. For me it doesnt quite live up to the hype, still a solid pale ale...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is obviously a great beer, but to call this a Pale Ale is a misnomer; this is easily an IPA. Creamy, hoppy, delicious. An almost DIPA richness. Great dry hop aroma.

Probably my favorite pale ale. Pours a clear orange yellow with a thin white head. Mellow aroma of pine and grapefruit and sweetness. Taste is awesome, mellow citrus notes with a medium body. This is an all day drinker for me. Great stuff.

Have I ever said "balance is key"? Enjoying at Smallbar in Chi, and in this moment officially miss the Midwest. Citra hopped goodness. Grapefruit, sweet finish. Not overdone - not a hop bomb - just about perfect. Wow... 

---Rated via Beer Buddy App

A delicious APA that actually stands out from the tons of others out there. Aroma was delicious. From the moment the cap popped off, there was grassy and earthy hop aromas in the air. Pour was a nice cloudy light gold with a two finger pillowy head. Taste was nice and hoppy. The grass and earthy notes were front and center with just a hint of citrus. Quick wet finish with mild carbonation. Courtesy my Secret Santa. Thanks man!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Not a contender for the best beer ever, but certainly a very good beer, from its bright golden start, through to the sweet citrus (loving Citra as the hops), and a good, reasonably well balanced finish. No complaints. Tap at The Publican, Chicago.

Fresh bottle from trade with FullObs. Pours a hazy gold color with a small frothy head that fades normally and leaves nice lacing. Fresh hoppy aroma of tropical fruit, citrus, and flowers. Awesome taste, wow! Everything is how I like it in an APA or IPA. Slight sweetness up front with a moderate bitterness later. Super fresh tropical, citrus and floral hop taste. Finish is so smooth with a long lingering citrus flavor. Medium body, perfect soft carbonation and just the right amount of oiliness in the mouthfeel. Overall, I actually thought this beer wasnt going to live up to the hype for me like Pliny but I was wrong. All the little things are perfect in this beer like the appearance, carbonation, mouthfeel, and finish. And it helps that its a showcase for my favorite hop.
Hazy orange pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruit, some slight garlic, resinous. Flavor is bright, citrusy, slight caramel. Nicely balanced beer. Tasty.

Excellent hoppy citrus aroma. Delicious hop flavors with citrus. Bitter aftertaste. Crisp & refreshing!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Had at 3 flloyds brewery on tap Appearance. Golden with a slight white head. Aroma citrus. Taste strong citrus flavor long on the palate
On draft at the brew pub. Pours a clear deep gold with an off white head. Intense floral and citrus hop and flavor. Some biscuit notes. Smooth, luscious mouthfeel. Um, um.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Pour nicely golden with a thick white head. Lots of citrus hop aroma. I dont get too much overpowering hops or malt. The finish is hoppy, but nothing spectacular. Good IPA, but there are others I prefer.

Rich, Pale Ale with an IPA-ish flavor. Everyone in ChiTown raves about this brew. It's really good, but I've had better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 The most deliciously drinkable "pale ale" in the world. One of my favorite beers, all things considered. Citrus & tropical bomb on the nose; pineapple, mango, grapefruit, pines, oily resins. Translates perfectly in the flavor with substantial bitterness. Crisp body, wet finish. If only this stuff made its way to Michigan... Id be in heaven. Could crush this stuff, all day.

Color a little light, and flavor after is pretty bitter quick. I like a hoppy IPA but maybe not quite the right hop for me. Good lacing, very drinkable, doesnt get heavy too fast. 2.5 to 3 bottles and I am done. I would rate it better but I cant give it what I would give TG Goldent Nugget.
Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Citrus hoppy aroma with lots of peach and tropical fruit. Sweetish fruity flavour with a touch of toffee malt character. Bitter and hoppy finish

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2014 24oz poured from tap at 3 Floyds brewery in munster Indiana.   While I could have enjoyed the service more, I could not have loved the beer anymore.   Amy words I use will do it injustice.   I guess some may consider it a little too bitter.   So there I said something negative, but simply put, you wont find a better APA anywhere in the USA.   Aroma is so pleasant its ridiculous, taste makes you wonder how its possible it could even exist.  Read below of you need someone to say something about its floral aroma, its awesome lacing left on the glass or how its alcohol content couldnt agree with the taste better if it tried.
Bottle. This stuff is awesome. Murky amber color. Awesome grapefruit and pear aroma.  Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruit, little pine, little hop. Just the right amount of bite in the finish.

At the Savor beer fest.  Easily one of the best pale ales made.  The aroma is beautiful citrus, light tropical fruits.  The appearance is clear amber, white head.  The flavor is just like the aroma.  Very drinkable.  The finish is citrus.  Medium in body.  Excellent.

Deliciously pungent Citra hops tickle my senses. Pineapple, juicy tropical fruits, floral; ends with a hint of pine on the back end. 

A marvelous concoction of hops, malt, and juicy fruits sails across my palate. There really isn't a better beer in this style: Zombie Dust trumps all (and has no peers). Wish I could drink this all day, every day.

Tap at Savor. Clean amber pour with eggshell head that lasts even in a 2oz pour. Beautifully refined hop aromas. Lots of velvety citrus (how can a smell be velvety? I dunno but this shit is) with a lightly candied note and the faintest of malt profiles. Falls a little flat on the palate if you ask me. Still full of citric character but not as robust as the nose. Solid stuff but disappointed compared to hype.

Bottle from my buddy Elliot.  Thanks. Pours a hazy burnt orange with a half finger of off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, pineapple and grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter. Loads of citrus and pineapple. Full bodied with a somewhat thicker texture. Lively carbonation and a super long finish. Overall, pretty darn awesome. I know people like to give three floyds static, but this is really good.
Delicious!  Found this being served in bottles in a suburban Chicago Indian restaurant.  For real.  What a surprise, and a great accompaniment to spicy food.
gift from a friend since cannot find it in wisconsin. amazing beer. lives up the the reputation. Great pale ale. Great representation of the Citra hop! One of the best pales you will find!

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Re-rate because of bad rating earlier. No problem since this is an absolutely amazing beer.

Bottle at home. Pours clear golden with a lacy, frothy white head. Aroma if citrus, pine, grass, some caramel and malts. A bit creamy. Quite bitter, light sweet. Very well balanced, maybe the most balanced Ive seen so far. Very drinkable. If I had to choose one beer I could have for the rest of my life, this would be it. Medium body with average carbonation.
very nice beer.  Reminds me of the Plineys.  Clean, crisp, good flavor.  Very happy to try.
On tap @CBC13. Aroma is very hoppy; graprefruit, citrus, and faint tropical fruit. Taste the same hop notes, malt and sweetness. Bitter and clean finish.

Bottle. 5/17/13. Pours pale gold with a thin, bubbly white head. Aroma is nice, simple, very aromatic; tropical fruits, sweetness, spice, citrus. Taste is similar; tropical fruits, a good amount of citrus and some spiciness. Medium bodied. Medium carbonation. Some light lacing. Crisp, refreshing; full-flavored. This was excellent, no questions asked. However, it is absolutely not worth the hype that surrounds it.
Soft finish on a stellar beer. Took me a while to hunt it down but well worth the wait.

Pour is a gorgeous clear golden orange, with a fluffy white head that leaves a ton of lacing. Lots of bright fruity notes on the nose, very citrusy, some white grape, nice hoppy smell and theres a hint of a grassy floral character there. Wow, amazing taste. More floral hops than I would have expected, but still its very much a citrus dominated taste with lots of orange and mango, slightly sweet with a dry finish, maybe some pineapple on the finish too. Easily the best and most well balanced pale ale Ive had.

Copenhagen Beer Celebration.
Tap, 040513.
Amber with white head. Aroma of citrus, flora and malt. Flavour with caramel, fruit and spices.

A gift from my friend Mike. Classic glowing orange color. Really nice toasty hop aroma. Call me crazy but it reminds me of a toasted English muffin with butter and honey. With a hop salad on top. A little thin in the middle but it adds to its drink ability. Awesome beer.

Draft at Hopleaf. Pours clear light amber with a foamy, slightly off-white head. Aroma is huge amounts of  graprefruit; just incredible.  Aroma also has notes of other fruits (citrus and tropical) and a touch of pine. Taste has a lovely balanced bitterness, with notes of grapefruit pith and rind, tropical fruits, hops and some light sweetness. Finish is clean and bright with a nice bitter bite. Really great stuff.

Beautiful pour the aroma hits you immediately full of piney hops. Chewy nice on the front not the best on the finish. Still another good choice from 3F. A little cellar time is probably a good call..Recommended !
Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma is caramel, peach, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is caramel, citrus and grapefruit. Well balanced.
Pour from a 12oz bottle. Medium brown brew with off white head. Aroma of citrus and floral hops. Great bitter blast on a thin malt backbone. Nice cirtus finish. Well done brew.

An ultra tropical aroma with fresh yellow grapefruit dominating the nostrils.  Very yellow with a golden head.  The flavor is more astrigent than expected, with plenty of CO2, but as crisply hoppy as a balanced beer can get.  Easy drinking with very present hops.  An easy win, but I did find it to pale in comparison to gumballhead... and to anyone who says they favor this over two hearted, just dont whack anybody while youre waving your three handed flag.  This beer really, really rocks... but I do think its pretty hyped.  Ill blind taste it when I get the chance and check back in.

At CBC 2013 on tap of FFF booth.
Probably after a dozen of other beers.
Sorry for the pour description: cereals, grapefruit, herbs.
Light body, oily texture, average duration. Mainly bitter profile.
Easy to drink Pale Ale.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Bottle at home, from an IP trade with Michael C, 11/05/13.
Hazed golden amber with a good finger or mores frothy white head.
Nose is juicy tropical fruits, bitter grapefruit, orange pith, pine, hops, citrus notes.
Taste is bitter grapefruit, bitter orange, good dose of hops, pine, grass, light mango, sugars.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation pitched expertly, hop bitterness in the finish.
This beer delivered !
------- 21/11/13 from an IP trade in town.
Clear golden amber with a moderate off white covering. 
Nose is caramel malt forward, mango, mandarin, dank hops, bitter orange, light floral notes.
Taste comprises sticky mango, caramel malt, sweet grapefruit, orange pith, pine, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, perfect palateability, dry finish with semi aggressive hop bitterness.
4-8-8-5-16.
Excellent stuff but drops to 4.1 overall. 
Was 8-4-9-5-17.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
UPDATED: AUG 24, 2014 Rerate bottle (1 month old) thx to knä (not RB)cons 2014-08-23 Göteborg
New rating 3,4 - new average: 3,5

Draught at CBC 2013, cons 2013-05-04 Copenhagen 3,6 points
AR: tropical fruits
AP: dark amber, frothy white head
F: heavy grape fruit bitternees, apricot jam, pine, salty feeling

Bottle @ ZeeBra Extreme Beer Festival 2013. Clear golden pour. Aroma of super fresh and huge hops, floral, fruity, very clean and full. Flavor is slightly bitter, very fruity. Lovely smooth. Great brew.
On tap at CBC. Golden-amber colour with white head. Herbal and citric hoppy aromas. Herbal and resinous hoppy taste, with caramel hints. Bitter ending.

Thanks to John for the bottle!  Hop aroma is hard to discern in the bottle. Hop flavor is full of mango. A very well rounded beer.  Bitterness is just right.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Extra from Richmondrob! Poured into FFF Teku, nice dark golden with nice head. Aroma is nice pine and woodsy resin, taste is bitter with plenty of malt balance, great pale!

Bottle to pint, pours a clear orange copper color with a thick white head that sticks around for the duration.  The aroma is hoppy and floral.  Taste is hoppy with citrus and a little bit of grass, light bitterness.  Tasty brew.

12er from the brewery. Nice gold pour with a medium sized white head. Pretty bright aroma, lots of tropical fruit, some pine, a bit of lemon zest, some kiwi and a touch of caramel. Flavor follows, a bit more subdued than the aroma suggest. Bitter finish distracts from this one a bit, slightly dirty, great carbonation, light mouthfeel, a touch more sweetness than I prefer in a pale. Great beer, would love to have it on draft at some point.

Zeebra Extreme Beer Festival - Hazy yellow colour. Has a very fresh, zesty, hoppy aroma. . Flavour has initial sharp edge becoming nicely bitter in the finish. A soft, well refined feel is there throughout.
What can I say, it lives up to the hype in my opinion. On tap at CBC13, orange, great citra aroma, clean, crisp, delicious. Was also the first beer I drank at the Celebration.
Orange with a massive head. Huge fruit aroma, a bit piney with some fresh exotic fruit touch. Extremely good. Draft at CBC

Huge hop aroma, citrus mango, grapefruit. Smells like an imperial ipa. Body is not as strong as the nose but instead very smooth and medium bodied. Not overly bitter. Very fresh tasting. Qualities of a big beer but in the frame of an a pale ale. Reminds me of two hearted in its big citrus flavors. Up there with the best.
Bottle @ ZeeBra. Aroma is huge piney, citric, herbal hop juicde. AWESOME. Flavour is dry, intensely hoppy, light bitter, long lasting hop juice. Great stuff.

Slight hazy yellow. Nose is an enormous explosion of tropical fruits, mostly mango, grapefruit, apricot. Also notes of grass, pine, resin. Mouth is similar with tropical fruits, grass, hay, pine and resin. Fantastic!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy amber with medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel and pale ale malt, resin, pine, some toffee. Taste is a resin explosion, yet very balanced with both sweet and bitter. Body is light light yet creamy with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautifully crafted beer from 3 Floyds. Light to moderate hop. Hard to believe this not an IPA. Well done. Ive had Dreadnaught, and this trumps that.

Pours a clear light golden with 3 finger head that lingersand leaves moderate lacing. Aroma of bright toasted hops, maybe a little biscuit and a huge dose of grapefruit hops. Heavy bitter throughout with long bitter finish. Full body, chewy, slightly oily mouthfeel. This is a great one!

Bottle.  Thanks Kevin!  Pours hazy amber with a medium white head.  Great floral and citrus hop aroma with hints of caramel and tropical fruits. Nice hop flavor of florals, citrus, light tropical fruit and light pine without being overwhelming.  Similar finish with more pine coming through.  An awesome APA.

12 oz bottle, thanks Ryan.  Almost unnoticeably hazy amber; very large white, frothy, rocky head dissipates into a sparse covering and a medium to large ring; heavy lacing.  Aroma is warm and toasty with sweet malt, grapefruit, pine sap, and barely a hint of caramel.  First taste makes me think this is going to be another unbalanced hop bomb, but over time this thing really smooths out; more pine and citrus here but it gets more drinkable after sitting a bit; very lengthy orange/pine finish with light caramel.  Really impressed with the body; heavy carbonation but its full and smooth and almost creamy; light stickiness; does thin out a bit after sitting out once the carbonation bleeds out.  The 100/100 score on this one suggests a great number of raters are on drugs, but this is outstanding and probably really does deserve 99th-100th percentile in the APA category. (But 100 overall?  Come on...)  Shame this is so hard to get; guess Ill have to live with Alpha King...

Bottle pours light orange with two finger head and nice lacing. Aroma mainly of citrus/pine hops.  Taste sweet malts with citrus/hop bitterness coming in.  Prolonged hoppy finish but not overbearing.  Im not a big hop head but this is pretty good and very refreshing.

Bottled. Pale amber colour, lacy and creamy head. Citrusy, sligly piney and juicy fruity hop nose with blackberry and currant notes. Taste starts with light caramel flavor but it is soon eaten out by bitterness. Lingering,  very smoothly bitter finsh. Medium body, super fresh and smooth palte. Dangerously well balanced APA.

Bottle. Hazy rusty orange, with a big fluffy sticky head that laces all the way down. Aroma is well citra hops - citrusy, lemon, peach. Body is node medium malty, slightly sweet but really well balanced. There a lot of single hop citra beer out there but the malt bill here is really really nice. Great APA, but Im not sure about so e of these crazy numbers this beer is receiving.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2015 -Bursts out of bottle/glass with distinct citrus aroma -Pours a perfect orange -Taste is follows the aromaâs lead but slightly toned down (still very intense for a pale ale!). Surprisingly drinkable despite its intensity.
Amazing nose of citrus fruits and pineapples. Cloudy orange pour with a Nicky white head. Taste is of much the same as the nose. Very good with a nice bitter finish.

Bottle. Not sure how fresh but still great. Pleasant citrus aroma. Nice looks, head and lacing. Not too grapefruity. Leaves you craving more. Long crisp bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Slightly hazy golden orange pour, nice white head and some solid lacing as I consume mass quantities of this brew. Lovely citrus nose, really fun hops here in the taste as well. Floral, citrus (orange, lemon, grapefruit) and just enough bitterness to balance. Awesome pale ale.

Pours hazy golden with a lingering white head. Nose is crisp grapefruit hops. Tastes exactly as the nose would suggest, with strong grapefruit hop flavors. Medium bodied, crisp and refreshing. Hoppier than I usually expect out of a pale ale, more into IPA territory.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2013 Pours dark orange white low white head
Wonderfull hoppy aromas of citrus, grapefruit, peaches. 
Crispy hoppy explosion! Hot damn! Great APA. 
Lovely balance btw maltyness, hoppyness and bitterness to make an absolutely great Pale Ale
Poured a yellowish amber with a strong white head and resilient lacing. The scent was of citrus, grapefruit, and a tinge of pine. The taste was mildly bitter with  a citrus taste. Its pretty good.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2015 Bottled. Pours slightly hazy, pale amber with a large off-white head, that leaaves a good lacing. Aroma of citrus fruits, peach, pine and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and pleasant bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A great, clean and crisp APA. ★★★★

Bottle, 355ml - Semi hazy golden orange beer with a large frothy white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of pine, citrus, spices and mango. Flavor is fruity with notes of citrus, pine, spices and again mango. On the verge to being an IPA, but still a smack in the face of how a single hop Citra is meant to be presented.

Chopp. Clear nice amber colour, small white head. Very pleasant fruity sweet piney citrus hoppy arom. Good filling mouthfeel. Sweet fruity citrüs piney exotic fruity hoppy great flavour with a good well alsting bitterness, dry. Well lasting sweet fruity piney hoppy citrus finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Pale deep golden/copper pour with a thin creamy off white head and sticky striped lacing ... aroma of citra hops for sure, pineapples, citrusy grapefruit rinds, tropical fruits lovely aroma with a light caramel malt character .... taste is bitter and has loads of pineapple, grapefruity (the whole tropical/citrusy) hop punch ... has a bit of biscuity and caramel malt with a nice rindy bitter lingering bite ... finish is dry and just has a bitter hop that stays with you and doesnt quit .... abv hidden well ... another pale ale from these guys that blows away most ipas
Very good beer but feel like it was over hyped which caused it not to quite live up to expectations.  Definitely would drink again.
Draft & Bottle.  Tastes great no matter what.  Incredible mix of sweet and hops.  Wish I could drink this beer every day.

Bottled. 

A huge grapefruit nose overpowers any other aroma, which isn't a bad thing really. 

Clear honey colored pour with a fine, robust off-white head. Nice lacing left on the glass. 

Flavor is sweet malt balanced by floral and citrus hops. 

Mouthfeel is nicely carbonated, medium body. 

Overall, this is one of my favorite IPAs. Hoppy without becoming off balanced. If it were easier to find it would be even better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy from my iPad.

Hazy golden pour. Big citra aromas. Medium body, clean straightforward bitterness with the CItra shining all the way, but not too much catpissy. Im not a fan of single CItra hop, but this one was really easy to drink. For Citra lovers.

Bottle pour into a pint glass.  Awesome beer.  Second one of 3F Ive had and colored me impressed.  Theyre almost as good as Surly... :)  Good lacing on this beer.  Citrus on the nose and taste.  Bitter and golden colored.  Bring on the zombie apocalypse!

Pours from the bottle a nice coppery color with a nice tan head on top.  Has a sweet aroma and a rich malt flavor hinted by some citrusy notes.  Picks up some great notes from the citra hops.  A great pale ale to try!

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2014 If you had to pick one American Pale Ale to try before you die, try Zombie Dust. Not only does it have amazing artwork, you are literally left in the dust from this beer and chasing to try more. Upon taking in the aroma, you smell apricot, grapefruit, and other tropical fruits. The alcohol is not very noticeable.
The taste is grapefruit mixed with mouth watering hops. Little did I know that there is only one hop used: Citra hops. The palate is warmed but not overwhelmed. tropical fruits come through once again. The best thing about this beer is the after taste which begs you to drink more, and more. It is satisfying to a crisp. For IPA fans, this is not a bitter beer. It is strong enough for you to enjoy though and should be tried if you live in Indiana. Having been to the brewpub in Munster many times, Try it straight from the cask and you will not be disappointed. Tap is good as well as bottles, but the cask seemed absolutely the best. The fruit flavors are at their freshest and shine though. Do not try if the bottles are more than a week old, as you will not have the same tasting experience. This one particular hop used tastes best fresh in this beer! Hope this helped. Try if you can, and remember this: if will leave you in the dust begging for more.

From Johns stash. Pours reddish copper with a uniform beige head that gradually melts away. The aroma is slightly sweet biscuit and citrus. There is a rich pale malt flavor with a sticky citrus finish. Slightly unbalanced toward citra hop, as it should be. I could drink a lot of this.
Bottle shared by John. Pours orange copper. Aroma is grapefruit and citrus. Taste is bitter and dry with lots of grape fruits and pine.

Wow, it may be impossible to put words together to describe this beer. Hoppy with massive citrus flavors, but superbly drinkable. It pours yellow with a great white head. The palate is assaulted by the flavors of "C" hops with very slight malts. Overall this is the Pale Ale to judge all others against. I think I have a challenger in a local Pale Ale but this is seriously good.

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 Unclear Deep orange amber. Large fluffy white head, good lace. Aroma is loaded with hops, citrus, super aromatic. Medium body, sweet, pleasant bitterness. Lasting bitter hops finish with quite a bit of drying. Flavor is loaded with hops - citrus.

Drank before Walking Dead season finale!
super aromatic, I could smell it a foot away.  Lots of hops and citrus.  Larger than life white head.
Taste is very smooth.  Citrus and hops.  Medium body.  Starts very light and citrus.  Moves to a hoppy, deeper taste.  Dries off a little at the end, but not too much.
On tap at Hopleaf, Chicago. Sweet and very resinous, well balanced, abv well masked, a touch of honey, bitter of course. Very good APA.

Pours a clear, deep golden color with no head. Head never developed as a consequence of the care taken in the pour by the attendant. Incidentally, it was nice to see that the 3 Floyds staff were just as cheerful as ever *sarcasm*. Even as guests of Firestone-Walker after having been invited to their beer festival, the 3 Floyds staff were lifeless, provided no information about their beers, and couldnt even muster a smile or spare a "youre welcome." Anyway, back to Zombie Dust. The beer has a glorious floral bouquet with just a hint of peat. The mouthfeel, which enjoys a decent balance of carbonation, is good for the style. The flavor is grapefruit forward with notes of peat. A good effort.

Pours a clear golden orange from the bottle with thin off-white film of head and light lacing. Aroma is all kinds of fresh citra hops, citrus and tropical fruits. Taste follows, a quick bitter finish that makes it one of the easiest drinking beers. Very flavorful for the abv, great stuff.

Bottle. Hazy orange liquid with medium tan head. Aroma of fresh hops, pineapple, weed, biscuit, mango, pine, spruce, grape fruit and floral hops. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of pineapple, marmalade, biscuit, light caramel and mango. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very balanced and complex, also very hoppy.

Location/Date:Draft on March 27th, 2013 at Churchkey.
Appearance: Pours a clear orange. 
Aroma: Aroma of light citrus, pine
Taste: Medium high bitterness for the style, but not so much that its not enjoyable. Light orange.
Palate:Medium light body, lingering hop aftertaste.
Summary: A really good APA that Ive been wanting to try for awhile. This one is always on the front of RB and well deserved, although I dont think its THAT different than Alpha King which is always available.

12-oz. Once you pop, you cant stop. Pours a murky dark amber with bright golden brown edges and a loose and creamy tan head. Huge fragrant orange notes all over the nose, very intensely aromatic. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Roasty caramel, bright citrus notes, and some resin on the mid palate. Long orange and pine resin finish. Very appetizing. Wonderful beer. Would happily drink this all the time.
Citrus rocks the aroma and the palate. Everything an APA should be. Nectar of the Gods.

Shared a bottle of this with a friend the other night and man do I wish this was available in Arizona! Great flavor and definitely something unique about it. I got a slight sour note on the back of the hops, definitely a good thing in my opinion!

Starts with a nice nose full of grapefruit scent. Cloudy and turbid appearance, likely due to wheat malt, I taste a little bit. Flavor is an instant big hit of grapefruit and other distinct citrusy notes. Wonderful hoppy flavor, real citrus, almost to the point of overpowering any malt flavor. A must for any true IPA fan.

12oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy copper/orange color with a small light white head. Aroma is very juicy and tropical. In particular, grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is mango, citrus, caramel malt, and a nice bitter hoppiness on the finish.
Wow the aroma is a huge blast of citra hops. The flavor is grapefruit, apple, pineapple, and a really nice citrus flavor, super balanced beer. Wow I need to get a sixer next time!!
Härligt frisk doft. Mycket citra toner. Smakar torrt medelfyllig. Lite väl mycket kolsyrad dock. En bra sommar öl.
Bottle. Darker amber color with moderate lacing. Ultra pine aroma. Surprisingly mild hoppyness. Smooth taste. Great beer.

Tap. Hazy light orange with a large frothy off white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is super fresh citrus and peach with some light caramel malt beneath. Taste is light/medium bitter and medium sweet. Medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Light bitter citrus finish. Very poundable.

I have loved this beer ever since I encountered its predecessor, Cenotaph. Zombie Dust has a wonderful citrus aroma imparted by the Citra hops which provide notes of grapefruit, lime and gooseberry. Hazy Golden-Amber in appearance, this beer has a flavor that is perfectly balanced. The powerful aromas are supported by a subtle yet substantial malt character and a pleasantly bitter finish. This effort by Three Floyds results in a highly flavorful yet remarkably drinkable ale.

At long last! Finally, Ive had the legendary Zombie Dust.

Appearance: Pours a typical APA color -- light orange. Theres a slight haze, and a nice, creamy-like head on it. Lacings patchy and not all that great, but it looks nice as a whole.

Smell: Think Hopslam. It smells a lot like that. Zombie Dust is tied with Hopslam as the best beer that I have ever smelled ... absolutely outstanding. A huge burst of guava/peach/citrus along with some sweet hoppiness. Glorious.

Taste/feel: Slightly letdown, though its still an insanely tasty beer. The aroma is stronger than the taste, but thats not necessarily a terrible thing. Like many have said, this drinks more like an IPA than an APA... super tropical fruit flavors along with non-descript fruit and spice on this one. The aftertaste is slightly bitter, and the alcohol comes through a bit at times as well to dry the mouth, but me gusta. A proper amount of malt and spice on the finish to balance it all out pretty nicely. A great, GREAT beer, but a tinge overrated in my opinion, and I wouldnt consider this a very sessionable beer (besides the 6.40%) due to the dryness.

For the price, an unbelievable beer, and one of the best... $1.50 a bottle, fresh from the brewery? Doesnt get better than that. Overall though, just an extremely good beer. Best beer ever? No, but close to it. Honestly, I feel like this would score slightly lower on a blind taste test. I think a good reason this beer is so acclaimed is because of its label, and especially, its name... Americas become obsessed with zombies the past few years.

bottle from Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours an amber/golden colour with a small white head. Fresh and fruity citrus, pine and malty flavour and aroma,  grapefruit very prominent here, has a lovely palate/mouthfeel - very easy drinking for the abv. Beautiful drop this.

Bottle split with Taylor from Mexican Food Factory.  Many thanks!  Aroma was apricot, grapefruit, and mango.  Pours a hazy shade of orange with a great visible carbonation.  Taste was full and fruity with grapefruit, peaches and a slight bitter grass.  Mouthful was juicy and satisfying with a pretty clean finish.  Very well crafted.  Would love to have a fresher glass than the one I had.
Bottle.  Taste is Florida grapefruit infused with booze, orange zest, grass and hay.  Complex and excellent.

Pours slightly hazy orange with a large white head. Smells of citrus with piney undertones and a hint of grass and spruce. Taste is big citrus notes, sweet oranges and hints of tangerines with hints of caramel that emerge after a moment. Medium-bodied with a wet texture and soft mouth-carbonation, Three Floyds Zombie Dust finishes almost clean with a hint of sweetness.

Deep gold/light copper, clear, off-white head.  Aroma of big orange-tangerine citrusy hops with just enough underlying malt to support the big hop aroma.  Flavor features dry, crackerlike malt with just a touch of caramel, big citrusy hop flavor followed by a little herbal spicy hop note as well.  Finishes with a clean zing.  Very drinkable.

Let there be little doubt...the aroma alone will make your mouth water.  Im a bit spoiled living close to 3 Floyds and having access to the Dust regularly.  This is nothing short of amazing.  The taste is hoppy and has lots of citrus on the front end.  Medium head and pours burnt orange.  I love this beer.  12 oz of gold.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a HF taster. Pours a nice opaque orange with a one finger white head. Good lacing as it goes down. Smells of grapefruit, mango... Great floral scents. Taste is again with the grapefruit and slight bitter citrus. Great body and nice dry finish.

Boom citra bitchslap on the nose. Love it large!  Pours with a foamy fine head that turns into a white line quickly.  The hops are a bit underwhelming in the body and finish.  I like it a lot, I don't love it.

12oz. Bottle. Pours a beautiful hazy, golden color with a half finger of head that dissipates quickly. Decent amount of carbonation. Aroma is INCREDIBLE. Very hoppy and citrusy. Grapefruit, pineapple, orange and much more Im sure. A slight floral/piney aroma is present. Taste is rediculous. Hoppy, citrusy floral. The same hints of grapefruit, pineapple and orange are prevalent. A perfect balance between hops and fruit with a lasting pine like flavor. Absolutely, hands down, the best pale ale on the market. I may regret this later on, but this one is getting a 5.
Bottle. Golden brown with a medium frothy head. Big citrus and hop aromas.  Pine, resin, juicy citrus and a little malt. Very smooth.
amber color, aroma of citrus/tropical fruits, caramel, bread, same flavors, very fruity, not to bitter, well balanced, wish i could get this one more offten

Burnt orange, off-white head. Nose is citrus hops, pale malts, biscuit. Taste is fresh cold cuts from the malts, citrus fruits, pine. Oily mouthfeel. Clean dry bitter finish Everything blended together perfectly.
very good, but not the best pale ale in the world.  moderate aroma, the bottle kills it, so drink it fresh!  Flavors of citra hops.  Medium mouth swish.

I love the stranger and this beer is even better than that awesome flavor and the smoothness is amazing I would give it a higher rating on appearance if I seem the bottle but it was a draft so didn't get to see it 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured light amber at Hunahpus with a medium white head. Aroma is tropical fruits & pine. Taste is tropical fruits, mellow pine resin, and earthy mellow malts. A very agreeable IPA and easy to drink. Too bad its not readily available here in FL.
On tap at ccb hunahpu day. Pour is dark orange with light head. Nose may be the best ive had. Sweet hops. Tastes like liquid hops. Pure gold

Draft. Truly great pane ale. The hop flavor (citra) really comes out. Very good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is luscious, citra hops give it that citrus orange like lemony punch along with a citrusy orange aroma. Body has a nice dry aftertaste which lingers with almost an earthy tone. Its hard to believe this is single hopped! Bitterness is here but flavor hops are more dominant.

Draft at Hopleaf. Served in a shaker pint.   Pours a deep golden color with a white head that quickly dissipates.  Aromas of grapefruit and hints of grass.  Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel.  Upfront flavor of grapefruit and some bitterness on the finish, but not one that overwhelmingly lingers.  Theres a malt presence here that prevents such a hoppy beer from lacking complexity.  An outstanding IPAone of my favorites.
My favorite beer. Obsessed. Hard to find even here in Chicago. They dont always sell it at the brewery itself. A dank taste I cant find anywhere else. Ill drink it all night long.
Draught in a flight. Pours a clear light amber color with a thick white head. Nose has some reasonably hoppy elements, but not overly so. Taste is just a bit bitter. Smooth drink. Good brew.

Bottle was a bonus from Stfun.. Thanks man.. Nice amber pour with moderate lacing with a tropical nose. The taste was light citrus, with lots of lemon, apricot, and grapefruit, some tropical notes, lots of hop flavor, but a very silky mouthfeel and a very dry, pleasant ending with only a trace of bitterness. Overall a really nice IPA.

On tap at Burnhearts.  Amber with a creamy off0white head and plenty of lace.  Aroma is a bit dank with pale malts, bready notes, pine and floral hops.  Taste is dank and earthy with citrus, resinous hops, malt and some floral notes.  Bitterness to the point of abrasion.  Okay but seriously over-rated.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2013 #400 - Iâve been waiting for this for some time. I love the label art. Bottles from jbickus. Pours into my tulip with a huge head and a hoppy aroma. The hops are citrusy with a hint of pine. Pours a pale orange color. Unlike any American pale ale I have had (but close to Alpha King). Tons of lacing. Awesome balance. Such a treat to enjoy. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Yellow Brick Pizza in Columbus OH.  Incredible beer!  Shows that you dont have to be 10% alcohol and crazy hopped to be a great beer, balance is great, and this beer is delicious.  The hop flavor of this beer is so good.  Ill drink this beer anytime I see it.

22 oz bottle served in a stem glass at a tasting at Dans. Pours clear golden with a small, off-white head that fades to a thin cover and leaves a minimal amount of lace. On the nose is a huge amount of grapefruit peel that literally wafts across the room; this is paired up with pine, flowers, caramel and bready malts. The flavour is medium sweet caramel malts with bready notes balanced with resinous citric hops. A hoppy bitterness grows towards the finish, which is long and lingering resinious hops. On the palate, it is light-medium in body with a dryish texture and soft carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice pale ale; it is quite bitter but not overpowering. It would make for an amazing summer barbecue beer. 2012-08-11
This is my favorite beer. I compare other to this now. This is my bench mark. So far none has been better.

22nd April 2012Cloudy amber beer with a decent off white head. Crispy palate turning softer. Creamy pale malt, very airy. Leads to fresh tangerine and a little pith. Finishes smooth and semi dry and with mellow bitter linger. A creamy tangerine treat!
Extremely citrusy. Smells like a fresh cut grapefruit. Tastes almost as grapefruity as it snells.
Trade from Queenholly....Pours a deep gold with a thin white head...smells of many fruits and hops...taste is sweet hops, fruits like grapefruit and hint of peach....very smooth great beer A+
Angenehm hopfiger Antrunk, blumig. Geringe Herbe, würzig, hell malzig. Fein hopfiger Mittelteil und Ausklang, blumig, im Nachgeschmack deutlich bitterer werdend. Nett! 10/12/12/12/14/12

Bottle from trade with skycracksopen, cheers!
Amber with an off-white head.
Aroma: lots of grapefruit,  peach and ripe tropical fruits, some grass.
Taste: peach and pineapple, pine, grapefruit, some kind of berries, light caramel, balanced bitterness.
Medium bodied.
Great stuff, very refreshing and drinkable!

One of my favs. A supercharged pale ale with a citrusy piney hop flavor. Golden color with a slight haze. Not easy to get your hands on, but worth fighting for. Three Floyds never cease to impress me.

12 oz. bottle thanks to Queenholly. Thanks so much! Pours golden amber with some suspended particles floating around in the liquid. Vibrant nose of citrus hops and some pine. Intense flavors of juicy grapefruit, pineapple upfront followed by grassy hops and then it finally round out with light caramel malt backbone. Balance is exceptional. Very light bitterness with lingering citrus after the sip. Anything else I could type about this brew would just be rambling. Truly try this fresh.
One of the best India pale ales Ive ever had so happy smooth and taste like drinking the champagne of life

Bottle Pour: Fresh Release

 Had this at a tasting that was skewed more towards impy stouts, and boy was this a nice change of pace. Very sessionable APA that is well deserved of the hype its been getting lately. A lot of citrus zest in the nose with great lacing and a frothy white head. A refreshing break from the pallet pounders that I should have taken more seriously when originally tasting. Could easily become my go-to session beer if not for the rather slim availability in here.

Bottle from RobertDale in trade, pours hazy light orange white head but dismisses fast, nice clean hoppy aroma slight citrus, light and smooth with a lingering of bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A solid pale ale. This beer is really hyped up a lot but it really is a good example of what a balanced, but hoppy pale ale should be.
12 ounce bottle from the broker, thin lasting head, effervescent, punch at the end.
Golden pour with white head. Nose is citrus, mainly grapefruit and sweet hops. Flavor is perfect balance of sweet start and bitter finish. Love it.
Golden pour with a thick, persistent head. Fresh pine resin, citrus zest, peach, mango, bread malt and honey. Initially sweet, lightly bitter in the finish. Also, the right amount of carbonation.
Bottle as part of trade; hazy orange pour, soapy quickly disappearing white head, tropical hop aroma, taste has mango slight citrus right amount of bitterness, some sweet malt, awesome APA.

Incredibly balanced taste with a hoppy aroma, active brown pour and growing mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 15, 2013 Opposite from the Dreadnaught, the aroma is this beer is really weak.  It looks like a deep golden cloudy ale with white head.  Once again, compared to the Dreadnaught it delivers great flavor.  The hops flavor starts of a little savory, earthy, and oniony but gives way to a tropical fruit flavor, like mango, or star fruit.  Its really good!

Bottle @ Home, courtesy of Jeff, Thanks! Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, rich fruity hops, peach, grapefruit. Flavor of malt, loads of nice fruity hops, peach, grapefruit, light pine. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, lasting bitter finish. Pure awesomeness. 300113
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich grapefruit, peach, hops, flowers and malt. Full bodied and very nice.

Thanks to Aaron for sharing this fantastic beer. Pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Nice lacing on the sides of my 3 Floyds teku glass. Aromas are all citra. Mango, grapefruit, orange, and some subtle grassy notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Very drinkable. Awesome brew!

Huge thanks to Josh up at Sweet Grass Dairy. Gold pour with a creamy white head that laces. Huge citrus, pineapple, mangos and peaches with a hint of malt backing on the nose. Flavor is clean, crisp and bright tropical hoppiness throughout with a long bitter end. Having had this side by side with Pliny the Elder it essentially exhibits the same hop profile and flavor only with not as much body. Fantastic Beer.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 12oz bottle poured into a snifter glass. Pours a hazy copper color with a small white head. Aroma is amazing! Hops, citrus, pineapple, grapefruit, and malts. Very earthy and mouth watering. Taste is fresh hops, grapefruit, citrus, slightly malty. Full body with a creamy texture and moderate carbonation. This is on a whole different level than any other pale ale out there, its almost unfair. Above and beyond all the hype. Now I understand why beer stores cant keep this in stock. If you can find this, BUY IT!!!

Pours a clear golden color with a white, finger sized head and is slightly lively.  Grapefruit, pineapple, and mango on the nose, just awesome.  Very bitter, and enough maltiness to somewhat balance it.  That sentence may have sounded somewhat like I wasnt saying it is satisfying, but dont get that impression.  This beer is slightly sticky, and the bitterness is what gets left behind.  This beer is awesome, but FFF should stop keeping this beer so limited.

Got this in a trade with a co-worker. This beer is very well done. Beautiful amber sunset color with a head that laces nicely. The hop florals are forward, but balanced well by malty stickiness. A fantastic pale ale and beer overall. Cheers to 3Floyds!

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2013 This one is a pale yellow orange if you actually pour it outside the kickass bottle. Its got a rough underlying bitterness, I guess if it was smooth and crisp they wouldnt call it something like Zombie Dust. Overall very good and even good value at $9.50 for 6.

Also I guess if you see it on the shelves, better grab it. The two places Ive bought it, the cashiers mentioned "I cant keep this stuff on the shelves" and "people go ape-shit over this stuff, man", and then sure enough it was not there the next time.

Bottle, bought @ Mikkeller Bar, Cph. Pours hazy deep orange with a medium, staying, creamy, white head. Aroma has fresh flowers, peach, orange peel, grapefruit, resin. Very fresh. Lowish carbonation, fine dry and creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is splendidly balanced, peach, oranges, fat and resiny. Medium bitterness, but still firm. A true session beer. Wonderful.

Thanks Matt for the extra

Light straw color, bright grapfruit and mango flavor.  Very easy to drink with a suttle hoppiness.  Wish I could have drank this a little fresher

Light amber with good head and lacing.  Smell mango, grapefruit and grass with some sweetness.  Citrus and grapefruit with mango taste and some bitter up front.   Nice cracker malt in mid palate that carries thru.  Soft mouthfeel that finishes dry.  Excellent.  Best APA I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piney citrus smell with a hint of carrot.  Pours golden amber with small white head.  Taste is 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle from khoffman... many, many thanks. Pours golden amber with a cream colored head with good retention. Intracate lacing rings my glass. Nose and taste are strong with pine, citrus, and light caramel. The bittterness is bold and out to make a point. Body is solid, and makes for an easy drinker.
Pours hazy orange with lots of citrus in the aroma. Tart citrus flavor particularly grapefruit with a hoppy bite. Great use of the citra hops.

Pours hazy orange into my tulip with a nice big frothy head. The smell is amazing, as expected. Floral citrus hops that waft up at you like candy. Piney grapefruit flavor, hits right on. Not as bitter as I had expected. Less carbonation than I was hoping for, and the finish comes off slightly syrupy. I guess I was expecting all hops. Strong malt profile here. That's a nitpick though, as the taste is all there and I love the citra hop aroma. All in all, a great pale ale. But given the (unfair) excitement over this one, it is a disappointment without a 5 rating. Very yummy stuff.
Thanks to bobbyberbiglia. Poured from bottle a nice golden orange with an off white head. Smells of tons of citrus. Tastes similar to smell but with a tad bit of bitter. Amazing.

Had this new years eve, pours a golden orange with a thick frothy head, Ton of grapefruit aromas along with other citrus fruits, the taste is grapefruit juice very very bitter tons of citrus fruits just overall outstanding, hands down best pale ale ive ever had and I will be getting more and more of this!
pale, hazy, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, bitter.  By far the best APA I have ever had, and quite possibly my favorite beer.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2015 Have had this on tap a few times now since my original rating. People go crazy over this stuff here in Columbus and its good, but not "wait in a huge line and pay a premium for a pint/bottle" good. If it were six pack cans for < $10 it would be in my rotation. All relative I guess. ORIGINAL RATING 12/31/2012:  12oz bottle from Andersons in Sylvania.  Yellow-gold pour with a huge frothy white head and lots of stick.  Aroma is grassy, ganja and citrus.  Tastes are caramel, orange zest, other tropical fruit, pine.  Perfectly balanced.  I have 2 bottles of this, but could go for a case.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a typically carbonated transparent yellow orange colored body. The mild aroma was Cascade hops. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start mediumly tingly at the finish. The flavor contained notes of mild hops and malt. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.

Golden body and white stable frothy head. Super rich, fresh hop aroma. Grass, citrus fruits, amazing. Hope juice, smooth yet apparent bitterness. Drinks way to nicely. Brilliantly executed. I could drink this all the time (bit am certain I wont ever have that opportunity). (33cl bottle from Chris, thanks!)

12 ounce bottle, this just came to the store yesterday afternoon so Im hoping its a fresh batch.  Served in a pint glass, the beer pours a slightly hazy golden/orange color with about an inch frothy off-white head that stays around for a very long time.  Theres also a lot of lacing.  Aroma is nice and hoppy, it smells mostly like citrusy hops (grapefruit, mango, tropical fruits), along with pine hops, orange peel, and some light bready malt.  Taste is similar to the aroma, but theres also some floral/earthy hops noticeable, and a nice lingering bittersweet finish.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit sticky, but also very smooth with moderate carbonation.  I think this is a pretty good brew, I know Id buy this again if I came across it.  $10.99 a six pack and worth every penny!

Pours golden orange with sudsy white head. Aroma is all citra dry hop overwhelming.  Taste is again pure citra hops, sweet with the perfect amount of bitter in the finish. Crisp and clean, smooth. An almost perfect ipa.

Wow!  Pours golden brown with white head and great lacing.  A shot of citrus hops on the nose.  Taste is outstanding.  Tones of hops that builds in intensity on the tongue to a point where it even numbs my tastebuds.  More like an IPA, but Im not complaining.

Thanks to Bobby Berbiglia for sharing the wealth. Aroma is just crazy citrus. Just amazing, if act perfect. Glowing orange with winter ring slight lacing. Really tasty bitter citrus. Citrus dominated pale ale.
As soon as you open this beer you can smell the hops! Its a hop bomb! Very balanced beer! Best American Pale Ale every!!!!
In my view, the best IPA in the country.  Very hoppy with a nice mix of citrus.  The way ipa should be brewed, hoppy, never bitter, easy to drink!

Reviewed 11/12/2012. HUGE thanks to Momar42 for the bottle! Unfortunately, its 6 months old, but beggars cant be choosers...

12 oz bottle poured into a beer mug.

A: Pours an intensely cloudy orange-copper color. The head is a one finger white color with some fantastic retention - its been about a minute and the head is still there

S: Theres no doubt this zombie is but a shadow of its former self, though it has held up well enough to be pretty good. This has a lot of papaya, mango, and honeydew melon, along with a piny brightness. I also detect a very subtle sweetness to it.

T: Extremely good for a six month old pale ale. Most of the bitterness is midpalate; the opening flavors are melony and sweet, while the finish is wonderfully neutral and bready. Nonetheless, this offers a decent melange of tropical fruits. If only it were fresh *sigh*...

M: This feels a LOT lighter than it looks, and goes down with amazing ease. Carbonation is perfect for what this beer is, perhaps a hair too light. The finish is surprisingly wet, likely due to the (un)dead hops.

O: I really like it - but it pains me to review it in this state, given the circumstances. On the plus side, I could really see this being one of my favorite beers EVER fresh, so needless to say, Ill be on the hunt for fresh bottles of this!

12oz Bottle A - Pours orange amber with a one finger peach head gives away to soap suds. Mild lacing  ok carbonation S - Floral tropical fruit T - Citra is an amazing hop. Orange peel, zesty, crisp, and a nice malt structure M - medium bodied, clean, easy drinking O - I prefer this slightly more than Alpha King. Outstanding Beer!
Wow super flavorful brew. Hoppy little sweetness and just delicious. Finest apa Ive ever tried.

Poured from 12oz bottle into a tulip.  Pours a light yellow color with a medium-sized head.  Aroma is floral and hops.  Taste is hops and citrus.  Mildly bitter finish.  I think this ones a bit over-rated here on ratebeer.
This is one of the best apas around. Fresh juicy citrus note on the nose. The flavor is like dank, fruity hop pillow. Amazing
Best aroma of any beer Ive tried and the taste to back it up. What can I say, Its my favorite beer!

Draft. Pours a clear golden orange color with a nice white head. Really nice lacing. Strong hippy aroma with both fruit and floral notes. Nice fruit forward hop note that has a building bitterness. Very balanced. Can see why this is the #1 APA. Fantastic.
Clear amber coloured with a small white head. Fruity aroma of hops, citrus peel, pine needles and petroleum. Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel, petroleum and pine needles. Dry hoppy finish.
Pours a clear golden body with a one finger, white head. Pineapple and grapefruit with a long, dry finish. Very good.
World class beer.  Citrus and pine smell with a hoppy, citrus flavor.  Great balance.

12oz bottle, clean amber color, with a frothy bubbly white head, nice floral tropical fruity, lychee, rambutan, pear, lime peel, pineapple, earthy leafy, grassy, piney cedary hoppy nose, with a light green grapefruit rind, faint, lemongrass spiciness, green tea leaf note, with a sublte, toasted, pale, malt accent in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good flowery fruity, zesty citrusy, lemon, lime, green grapefruit peel, piney, resiny, leafy, minty hop, spicy peppery, lemongrass character, with some tropical light lychee, rambutan, lime rind, pineapple fruity flavours, with a faint toasty, caramel, pale malt undertone, leading towards a spicy lemongrass, citrus lime, green grapefruit, rind, piney, cedary, minty, leafy hop bitterness finish.

Bottle, courtesy of Savvy1982. To be honest, I had tried this beer once before at my wifes fancy birthday dinner, but it would have been in poor taste to take notes so I never rated it. Bright orange-gold with a medium frothy white head that leaves light lace. Aroma is bracingly hoppy, with a bouquet of tropical fruit and tropical flowers. Juicy fresh fruity hop flavours charge onto the tongue, bright guava and mango, and a slightly piney quality that is more mango-skin than conifer. Despite the flavour intensity, the palate retains a lightness and relatively low bitterness that encourages drinkability. The supporting malt base is just enough to provide the right structure and sweetness to allow the elegance of the hop profile to truly shine. Truly outstanding.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle... Orangey Brown color with citrus taste/smell. Holy hops! Excellent beer!

Bottle.  Slight haze to this and a small white.  Orange, grapefruit, nectarine, and caramel all present in the aroma.  A bit malt ire than I remember.  Taste is well balanced between sweet caramel and bread malts, and plenty of orange and nectarine fruitiness.  Slight resinous hop character, but not as big and brash as some apas have become.  Nice medium body.  Really enjoyable stuff.

Aroma is definitely one dimensionally Citra. Lots of tropical citrus notes and sweet oranges, but also the Juicy Fruit character that comes through when Citra finds itself without company. Light resin notes, but not much malt to balance. 
Pours a fairly clear golden copper. second pour is much cloudier. 
Flavor is pretty sweet with some malt notes, but is dominated by Citra. Bitterness is medium to medium high. The caramel notes from the malt do help balance the hop flavors in the front of the taste. The hip resin is more noticeable in the flavor, especially the finish. Mid taste is when the Citra shines - not too Juicy Fruit, not too much resin; just clean bright citrus. A bit sweet for my palate. 
Overall this is a really nice beer, but it proves why I don't think Citra works by itself. It needs a touch of some other hop to balance it. I also feel that if a beer is dominated by Citra it should finish drier to counteract the perception of sweetness that the Citra adds. 

Thanks ekoerper!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 Best floral, citrus aroma in a beer ! The taste is an excellent citrus and hop blend, I love those cascade hops. Nice amber hues. Had it out f a bottle and on tap.
Bottle thanks to kaggie97. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Huge floral piney nose.  Taste is overwhelming floral hops. Fluffy body. Good stuff.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Orange brown pour with a small white head that sticks around rim. Smells of carrots, and grassy pine. Very smooth with a yeast in the middle and a subtle sweet with a clean bitter finish. Very drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The beer has a light head and a very flowery aroma. It's moderately hoppy with a mild hoppy aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
