Bottle to Nonic. Pours a dark yellow to light red with inch of white head. Big citrus aroma. Taste is smooth bitterness, malt background, huge citra grapefruit burst with solid bitter end. Best beer on planet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz bottle to FFF pint.  Slightly cloudy.  Very citrus in flavors.  Mildly sweet.  Bitter hops.

Aroma- massive citrus, including tangerines, peaches, guava, and passion fruit
Appearance- light yellow with a pillowy white head
Taste- tropical fruit juices, nice bite of hops, more light fruits intertwined with a smoothness from the hops
Palate- perfect for the style
Overall- A one or two trick pony for sure.  Very simple yet divinely tasty.  3F knows how to do IPAS and APAS.

trade with a generous person @CCB Black Friday-12oz bottle-tight offwhite head with trailing lace-gold.  A-citrus-tangerine&lemon/floral, sweet lt malt.  T-herbal/dank hops with some bite, musty lt/med malt.  Seems to clash at first, after 4 oz becomes more enjoyable.
Very bright with a taste grapefruit. Smooth and best cold. Went very well with the thanksgiving turkey.

tap - the aroma and nose is world class - maybe the best Ive encountered.  Killer hops - smooth finish.  Surprised its only 6.4%, seemed much higher.

Awesome beer - Im sure the more I try it the fonder Ill become of it

Taken from my BA account, reviewed 3/5/12

Live tasting 12 oz. bottle into Delirium tulip, bottle thanks to Peacehammer (see ya Thursday!)

Appearance; pours a lovely slightly hazy light orange/amber color with a finger of slightly bubbly pale straw colored head. Retention is good, and the head falls after a few minutes. Lacing is great with a ton of lace clinging in sheets to the sides of the glass.

Smell; holy grapefruit Batman!!! Zombie Dust features grapefruit by the ton, notes of pineapple and hints of resinous pine weave in and out. 

Taste; wave upon wave of grapefruit upon grapefruit washes over my tongue. As with the smell, pineapple and resins are beautifully interwoven with the grapefruit. Slight notes of orange and lemon rinds also appear.

Mouthfeel; a medium bodied beer, with just enough carbonation to compliment the feel of the brew. Might be a tad on the lighter side for this style but Im sure not gonna complain about that.

Overall; WOW. An outstanding pale (PALE?!?!) ale that I would definitely stack up against any standard IPA, and quite a few DIPAs. There really isnt anything pale about this brew. Bravo FFF, this beer is incredible, drinkable every day without getting boring, but awesome enough to be a special occasion brew. I will absolutely seek this beer out again, and highly recommend that you do as well.

An Incredible IPA! A nice resinous pine and loads of citrus, prolly due to the citra hops. Really tasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Love at first taste! This is my all-time favorite, just wish it was easier to find. Can get at Trion Tavern in New Haven, IN, but its pricey (worth it!). Wonderful citrus pop both in smell and taste, and the grapefruit notes prevail. Bag this stuff, and poke a IV in my arm. Im hooked!

This is one of my all time favorite beers.  Its probably the best smelling pale ale out there.  It smells like a citrus flower garden.  It tastes the same. There isnt a lot of malt in this one, so you get mainly hop bitterness in the flavor, but it is not out of balance.  Its a very tasty, refreshing beer.  FFF at their best.

What an amazing Pale Ale!  Aroma of citrus and hops hops hops!  Very well balanced but for those looking for a "traditional" Pale Ale, look elsewhere....this borders more to IPA. I happen to love it though!

----Hophaze out

Received a bottle in trade from DaBubs and one from dwbrews, thanks guys! Bright orange color, a little lace. This had a, not bad a very hoppy smell like fruit, smelled good. Flavor was more hops, fuzzy peaches actually. This was a good beer and I wouldnt say it was an IPA but I would say it was very one dimensional and so I probably wouldnt revisit it. Still, I was very glad to have had the opportunity to drink this.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-26-2012 06:18:36

Really nice in the glass - creamy, sticky foam. The nose is pure Citra. Strong, very fresh without being too sharp. Sweet. Flavor-wise, its like Citra bubblegum in a glass. Smooth. Fruity. Far too easy to drink. In my honest opinion, this is not the best american pale ale, but it is probably the most enjoyable for beer nerds. There is something really special about a single-hop pale, and citra was a great choice.

Huge fruity-hop nose on this, brings to mind fresh blood oranges, candy orange wedges, and dark honey. Hazy reddish-orange color and grayish-white head. Fairly bitter, lightly sweet, with that bitter hop-resin sticking and getting a bit more intense in the aftertaste. Juicy citrus girding that bitter structure, but not as much as the aroma promised. Medium-bodied, not as dry as some, but that resinous bitterness makes it seem drier. When did IPAs of 6.4% become APAs exactly? There is alcohol and IBU inflation at work, and those numbers are not worth what they once were. Well-made citrus bomb that is not as drinkable as it might have been.
Bottle. Pours amber with an off white head. Citric hops, light pine, and lighter floral notes. Clean pale malty profile. Very drinkable.

Bottled. A dark amber beer with a huge lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, malt, and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, peaches, hay, citrusy hops, and malt, leading to a bitter finish.

cloudy orange, smooth small white head.
quite hoppy aroma, bot oldish hops, malts, intense, but not fresh. flavor is flowery and candy like hops, great malty balance,  thick palate, nice hoppy brew.

Bottled. Orange coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma: Sweetness, pine, flowers, spice, herbs. Flavour: Herbs, flowers, spice, pine. caramel, grape. Quite full bodied. Ends dry and citric bitter. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle, 33 cl. Hazy orange golden with a small but creamy white head. Very fruity and hoppy aroma with some caramel accents. Taste is (grape)fruity sweet, hoppy, very well balanced, with a perfectly tuned  medium bitter finish

Bottle 35,5 cl. Courtesy of thome50. Pours a cloudy golden with a creamy white head. Very fresh and citrusy hop aroma. Medium body, a little sweet fruitiness but its really a showcase for the fresh and crisp hops. Bitter but never astringent and always with an appealing light underlying sweetness. Very enjoyable. 131112

12oz bottle.  Lightly hazed amber body, small off-white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, some orange.  Taste is moderately sweet, orange/grapefruit, light bread.  Light-medium body, light effervescence.  Nice beer, but with all the hype and my general love of FFF, I have to admit I was expecting more.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2013 Pours a dark orange color with a finger length white head. Dissipates quickly and leaves a nice lacing. Smells of intense, juicy, sweet fruits like pineapple, mango, grapefruit, some peach, tiny bit of floral notes, lots of tropical fruit, sweet carmel. Almost like a bubblegum smell. Taste starts a hefty dose of citrus, sweet, savory fruits like pineapple, mango, and peach, get some floral qualities as well. Very classic floyds taste. Then gets even sweeter with the carmel malts and more fruits. Then finishes with more citrus fruits, even more tropical fruits, more carmel. Nice dry finish. During the entire taste profile, a good amount of hop bitterness lingers. Somewhat bitter, but just so darn smooth, fruity, and refreshing and definitely not as intense as the aroma suggests. Mouthfeel is creamy. Medium body with a good amount of carbonation, which adds to the refreshing quality of the beer. Have had it many times, and never ceases to amaze me. Best session beer on the market.

Bottle. Nice cappuccino foamy slightly off white head that has nice retention and spotty lacing; lightly hazy light rust orange. Lots of nice citrus, mango, barely sweet creamsicle, and just lovely aroma overall. Flavor isn't as aggressive as the aroma indicates but still very fresh and hop forward, citrus zest, mango, light fruity hoppiness and a slightly fatty finish. Lighter softer body with nice tingly carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar.
Clear amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus peel, pine needles and petroleum.
Fruity flavour of hops, citrus peel, petroleum and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

12oz bottle via trade with Jriggz7---> tulip.  Pours golden orange with a thin white head and good lacing.  Nice aroma of mango and pineapple.  Taste is pretty much the same with light hop bitter and light bready malt.  Light to medium palate with adequate carbonation.  Best way I can describe it is Heady Topper Lite.  Very solid, but not mind blowing.

Golden color with a crisp white head. Strong grapefruit hop aroma with some sweet pineapple juice. Heavy bitterness balanced just enough with some sweet fruit flavor. Medium body with a clean hop bite. Wish I had regular access to this stuff.
UPDATED: SEP 3, 2013 Finally able to purchase it from the brewery after 3 attempts. Pours light gold with a white head. Lemon citrus aroma. Taste is the same big grapefruit citrus.
(tap at Local Option in Chicago) gold with nice white head. Fruity hops aroma with grapefruit and a hint of pine. Flavor is a lot of resiny citrus/pine hops.

Pours a deep orange golden color with a couple fingers of foam. Aromas are very tropical... mango, pineapple and citrus rind mingle with nice earth malts.  On the palate its more of the same... huge fruity bouquet of flavors come across juicy and refreshing with more tropical notes playing nicely off the mid palate touch of sweetness... nice bitterness on the finish. Amazing mouthfeel. Yum

High Grapefruit/Citrusy aroma, bit of pine as well. Amber orange, hazy with minimal head. Medium/light, medium to heavy bitter. Light bodied, thin texture with nice crabination. Medium bitter finish. Another nice beer from one of the best!

Bottle bought at the brewery.  Pours a dark gold with a thin layer of white head and medium lacing.  Smells of big citrus with some pine and grass/hay.  Tastes of grapefruit, pine, and resin.  Medium body, with good bitterness.  Fantastic APA.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 had to re-rate this one after drinking a ton more beers since.  this one has the nice citrus flavor but lacks in depth.  very light in flavor, but has that distinctive three floyds flavor.  pours light orange with a thin white head.  it is a good beer, but not a 5 rating.

12 oz bottle. Theres really no denying that is an exceptional apa. Its got 3Fs flair for sure, and nearly on par with Alpha King. Aroma is an A+. Tons of big, juicy, tropical citrus fruits, subtle pine, and vibrant florals. More tropical fruit here than usual 3Fs. Its so hop fruity, but balanced with sweeter melon fruit, caramel, and cereal grains. The pour is decent, semi-translucent with a golden body, and fluffy creamy, starch white head. The body is light-medium (for a 3Fs product), big on flavor, though not quite perfectly balanced. Less of the great tropical fruit compared to the nose, but more lemon grass, strawberry, and melon starburst candy. Also, caramel and malted cereal with some light soapy qualities. Finish lingers very well with more florals and citrus. I definitely liked alot, but maybe not quite on par with Alpha King, though that is definitely debatable.

12 oz bottle pours a slightly hazy golden amber color with decent white head and good lacing.  I could smell the citrus and piney hops from a foot away.  This is a bitter hop bomb without the caramel malt backbone found in IIPAs.  Body is medium with at most average carbonation and a very long bitter, clkean and dry finish.  Three Floyds cant produce enough of this.  I was able to get a case tonight for the first time in the last 6 visits there.  This is as good as Alpha King but harder to find.
Bottle, hazy, orange amber, good foam and lacing. Faint hop aroma, having a hard time picking anything distinct. Taste is citrus and resin bitterness on top of caramel malt body.

I keep trying this beer wanting to be one of its victims, but hops and bitterness are just too much for my palate.  Ive put down lots of IPAs and APAs, but this is just not for me.  Lots of grapefruit taste that will stick around well after its finish.

Had on-tap at Tribes Alehouse in Mokena, IL. Served in a tulip.

A: Pours a vibrant light amber with yellow hues intertwined. Nice pure white lace that subsides in a great frothy film. Wonderful webbed lacing followed me down the whole glass.

S: The brew popped. Big citrus notes with nice tropical fruits peaking though. Pineapple and mango give an idea of what these hops are giving off. Just a pleasant smelling in every way.

T: The first thing that hits my tongue is that nice fruity citrus blast. The makes way for some light grassy hops and then it finally settles on nice light caramel malt backbone. Amazingly balanced.

M: This is how a beer is supposed to feel. Light crispiness with a wonderfully balanced body. Medium carbonation. Leaves a a nice palate coating twinge of fruity goodness.

O: I waited a while to try this and Im so happy it didnt let me down. Not only that, it completely blew me away and exceeded all expectations. A perfectly balanced beer and I cant wait until the bottling rumors become true.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 08-07-2011

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 Bottle - thanks to HomelessDrew in trade. Pours hazy amber with a medium off-white head and great lacing. Aroma is dominated with grapefruit and pine - classic ipa aroma but muted and with notes of caramel peaking through. Flavor is lightly sweet with bready notes as well as grapefruit and pine notes and lightly bitter. Finish is light bitter. Medium body, oily texture. Very nice beer, and I love that its only 6.4%.
Clear light amber color with ivory foam. Green tea, dry herbal, citrusy aromas. Medium body. Floral, citrus hoppy flavors with a lightly sweet pale malt base brew--good
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: An absolutely fantastic IPA.  The nose is bursting with citrus and grapefruit and back with floral notes.  Balanced with notes of caramel.  Deep golden bordering on amber with a white foamy cap.  Bitter but with character.  Strong flavors of citrus and flowers with just enough balancing sweetness.  Smooth medium full bodied with a nice bitter finish.
Had this on draft and it is just as good as expected. Not disappointed at all, hopefully I can find some in bottles too. Light bodied and hoppy citrus flavors, etc...

Bottle from St Fun.  Thanks Josh!Pours a lively amber(glassy) with a nose of attic body odor, grapefruit, pine sap, and light sugar.  Flavor is an intense rush of grapefruit and musty body odor and pine tar served in a strawberry shell.  Thick and lingering on the tongue.  Awesome beer.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Amber with off white head . Aroma is meaty hop leaf with light caramel and zesty grapefruit.  Creamy mouthfeel is lovely.  Flavor is orange juice, citrus zest, leafy hops, caramel sweetness.  Perfect balance.  Delicious.
UPDATED: FEB 8, 2013 Great everything! Enjoy the flavor, palate and everything... wish I had more access to 3 Floyds! Doesnt linger long but I wish It did !
Citrus aroma with hint of grapefruit. Mild bitterness with great orange appearance. Great overall beer.
On tape at the Beer Sellar in Indianapolis. Very bright notes, yet smooth and drinkable. Worth the trip!!

rating #1600 Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet citrus, pine, grapefruit, and fruity hoppiness. Flavor was hoppy and moderatly bitter with citrusy fruity hops, piney resin, grapefruit, and some light caramel with a long and bitter finish.

Had the chance to have this beer on draft and on cask at the same time.  both versions run very close as would be expected, but the floral hop aroma and the balanced malts are so much brighter in the cask version.  Overall one the best and most drinkable IPAs around.

Bottle from trade with HomelessDrew.
Pours a nice medium gold with some lasting head and good tracing. Very good beer. Starts out with some very nice floral and citrus hops and finishes well. Nice, balanced and light but with enough hops to keep you satisfied. A very good beer.

This is probably the best beer that will ever cross your wastoid, human lips. Perfect citrus ale, single origin hops, premium pour balanced impeccably with the most perfect zest. Tastes like summer, like the best day of summer.

Easily the best beer I have ever had.  I had 3 on tap at Kumas Corner in Chicago.  Just an all around perfect beer.  I have nothing bad to say.  It is the most versatile of beers.  It is enough bitterness to satisfy the hopheads and enough citrus/grapefruit finish to please the casual beer drinker.  My girl hates hops and she loved this one.  The bottle and label are top notch too.  Only down side is that its damn near impossible to find at the store.

Ive had this beer on tap at 3 Floyds and in bottle.  It doesnt disappoint in either format.  Pours off golden color with off white head.  Aroma is fantastic.  Dank resinous hops dominate the nose.  Medium mouthfeel.  Flavor is intensely bitter, with some citrus and some dank taste.  Just awesome.

Uploading from Beer Buddy App. Notes from memory. Very nice IPA but I don't quite get the hype. Bottled, I find Alpha King more flavorful. Would still recommend this bottled over on tap because the carbonation in the bottle adds a lot to the flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Finally found this lovely beer at Fichermans, a lovely bottle shop in Chicago. 

It poured a nice hazy orange color with a small head that disapated rather quickly. Great citrus aroma and taste. Gotta love how FFF uses their hops! 

It was well worth the struggle to find it locally

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2013 rerating17/VI/13 - 12 Fl. Oz. @ home - BB: n/a, but it was max 2 months old (2013-xxx)Thanks to BelvidereIPA for the trade!
Clear deep orange beer (well, maybe a bit of a chill haze in it), big creamy irregular yellowish head, stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of citrus, ripe sweet exotic fruits, pineapple. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very fruity start, lots of peaches, citrus, mango, passion fruits, some honey, slightly sweet, piny bitterness, yet very soft. Aftertaste: lots of ripe fruits, peaches, exotic fruits, soft gentle bitterness. Wow. Freshness is indeed everything...
original rating
30/VIII/2012 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ 3 Fonteinen restaurant (Beersel) - BB: n/a (2012-986) Thanks to Armand sharing the beer!
Ar: 1, Ap: 4, T: 7, P: 4, O: 14, Total: 3
Clear yellow to golden beer, big creamy dense yellow head, very stable, pretty adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, grapefruit, lychee, some pineapple, passion fruit, bit soapy, little piny. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: pretty fruity start, lychee, some pineapple, grapefruit, bit soapy. Aftertaste: grapefruit, pretty bitter, bit piny, little soapy, sweet touch. Its definitely past its best, but hard to tell how old it is, as there is, surprise surprise, no date on the bottle.

This beer is just ok to me. I dont care for the citrus/grapefruit taste it carries. When its chilled, I can tolerate it. Overall, not my fave, but if I have nothing else in the house, Ill drink it.

Appearance: Pours a nice hazy orange color with about 1 finger of off-white colored head. Theres some decent retention and lacing, but nothing crazy.

Aroma: Orange zest, Grapefruit, Pine, Peach Skin, Apricots, White Grapes, and a hint of toasted malt.

Taste: Nice BIG citrus bitterness up front, with a good dose of resinous pine sap following close behind. Theres actually a decent malt-backbone towards the middle to back end. The finish is just loaded with lingering citrus, pine, and overall bitterness. Fantastic.

Mouthfeel: Medium body with just below moderate carbonation. Works perfectly with this beer.

Moreys Bottom Line: This was sent to me in a trade. He said that he picked it up 15 minutes after it was bottled! Its about a week old now, so this is obviously a fresh sample. It ranks up there with Pliny & Heady IMO. The lingering bitterness is a very welcome attribute. Hope to have this one again. Cheers!
Huge on the tropical fruit. Some bitterness. A real nice sweetness in the back of the mouth and the finish. Zingy gooseberry brightness. Fresh and pretty delicious.

By far, my favorite beer that I have ever tasetd.  Im big on bitter, but this bitter isnt so overpowering that it wrecks your evening with a bad aftertaste, great aroma, slightly hoppy with a hint of peaches, , oragnish  tangelo?, pours with a nice amber color with a white head that lasts.  THe taste is as good as a beer-gasm that your mouth will ever experience. The taste is as close to the elixir of the Gods as you are going to get, by my opinion anyways.

A-- Poured a hazy orange mustard color. Good looking bright white head, two finger height. Good staying power to the head. Lots of spotty lacing as drank through this and great head retention. 

S-- Just the nose of this was unreal. One of the best noses I have come across. Very IPA like nose. Candied pineapple, passion fruit, candied lemon and lime. Lots of fruit and a very good malt backbone. 

T-- Excellent taste. Lots of grass, pineapple, pine, passion fruit and lemon and lime. Far more complex than other APAs around. 

M-- Long lasting flavor and good touches of bitterness and backbone. Spot on carbonation for the style. Medium carbonation and feel. Very well balanced. 

O-- I consider myself lucky to have some good APAs in this part of the world with LC and Stone and Wood Pacific Ale, but this beer blows the heck out of anything I have had in a long time. My bar has been Daisy Cutter and LC but this was mind numbing. Well balanced and put together. More taunting was the logo just staring at me and taunting me with those eyes. All this from a single hop APA?? Sick, just sick.

Bottle thanks to pantanap.  Hazy amber beer with a medium slightly off-white head.  Aroma is very hoppy, lots of grapefruit and resin.  Some bready malt.  Taste is medium to heavy bitter, mild sweet, with a bitter finish.   Light-medium body, good carbonation.  Very good APA.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2012 Intense sugared grapefruit, pine, and herbal. Tastes very bitter and of malt sweetness and grapefruit and slight mango sweetness along with the heavy bitter grapefruit character. Medium bodied mouthfeel - slight chewiness. Incredible bitter drinking experience. There is nothing left to be desired.

Holy cow this is a fruity APA. Mango, passion fruit, banana, orange, lemon. Nice clean finish. Super fresh hop taste. Honestly, might almost be too fruity. Never had such robust, tropical flavor in an APA.

Tap. Soft citrus, pine and tropical fruit punch bowl - mango, pineapple and banana -  on the nose. Light, ultra clean and lean body. Hops sit playfully on top. Lots of citrus freshly peeled rind, pith, some grass and to my imagination, dandelions. Medium length finish, though some nice hop action on the tail. Not unique, but an A class example of the extra pale style.
Light golden appearance, thin head.  Super floral and citrus aroma.  Grapefruit Grapefruit Grapefruit! Medium body, well balanced, with smooth palate.

I got several bottles of this in a trade with LEMONHEAD.  Thanks Bry!  This pours a hazy orange color with a lasting thin off-white head on top.  The aroma is a wonderful hop scent; floral, herbal, and very citrusy; mango, pineapple, and grapefruit.  A slight note of toffee enters as well.  The flavor and overall enjoyment of the beer doesnt disappoint as well.  Theres a crisp hoppy punch to this thats loaded with tropical fruity hops; kinda getting a bit of lemongrass here to go with the grapefruit and other tropical fruit noted in the aroma.  I love Citra hops!  The body is slick, showing just a light sweet malty backing.  The finish is crisp, bitter, and dry.  This packs a punch but goes down so easily.  Ill have to compare but I definitely think I like this more than Alpha King (a good beer as well).  Probably my second favorite Pale Ale behind Hill Farmsteads Edward.  Of course, this has more hops than some other IPAs.

An old Notebook surfaces, as does the realization that I never entered these notes. Praise must be given to Lushawn, a gentleman who out of the kindness of his heart sent me this and many other bottles of beer. Thanks homie. 

The beer pours a hazy orange color with a medium head and good lacing on the glass.

The aroma is grapey, catty, and grapefruity. Pretty pungent and does the whole "smellin a bag o hops" thing pretty well. 

The flavor has a good big grapefruit bitterness, with a mild sweetness up front but a dry finish. The beer has perhaps the most defined "grapey" flavor Ive tasted in a beer. Quite delicious, I could drink about 19 of them.

Half pour on tap at FFF. Pours a very light clear straw with some fizzy head and lacing. Crisp hoppy aroma. More of a light bitter hop nose. Mouthfeel was light and way over carbonated. Most of the beers at FFF I tried that night were way over carbonated, QA issue?  Taste is light and lemony. Grass, citrus and mild skunky hops are present but a malt backbone was not. Meh, didn't really do anything for me. Solid but Alpha King is way better, as are most APAs. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2012 
Date: June 03, 2012
Mode: Bottle
Source: Tasting, First Sunday
Appearance: clear yellow, frothy off white head, sudsy lace
Aroma: sweet pale malt aroma, lots of hops, citrus and floral
Flavor: dry pale malt flavor, lots of hops, citrus, floral, light spicyness, just a touch of balancing sweetness, fair amount of bitterness

Date: December 14, 2012
Mode: bottle
Score: 3.3 to 3.8
Appearance: clear copper, wispy white head, streaka of lace
Aroma: huge tropical fruit aroma, sweet crystal malt, citrus, grapefruit
Flavor: sweet fruity flavor, tropical fruits, citrus, balancing bitterness
Overall: same beer or the difference in having a super fresh sample

Aroma: 8/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.8/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: *** /4

12 oz bottle courtesy of grachdar. Thanks!

A: Yellowish orange. A pretty decent pour only yields a slight amount of head. 

N: Pretty glorious. Lots of hops. Pineapple, grapefruit, some caramel and toffee, a little bit of pine. Theres a really nice balance of sweetness and tropical fruit here, so this ones going to be right up my alley. 

T: The taste lets me down after the promise of the nose. Very dry and earthy, with plenty of pine forest floor. Certainly nothing to complain about, but the dry hopping on the nose really makes my mouth water, and what I get is pretty dry and scraping without the abundance of the fruit.

M: Spot on for the style. Theres enough palate coating, but the beer itself remains fairly light. 

O: A pretty brilliant success, and a truly good APA. I received a 6 pack, and Ill be happy to share it with multiple friends. Theres some excellent hop characteristics throughout on this, but my oh my, if only the taste was as good as the nose.

thnx to dennoman, enjoyed this at our tasting together with gEUS  in a 33 cl bottle. the beer ive searched the longest for so far :)

this is a very good IPA, it drinks very light, fruity , but in a good way ( cause i dont like fruits at all ) its refreshing ! i liked this one
Fresh and straightforward, with subtle caramel malt above a piney dry hop presence that is balanced and refreshing.

cen·o·taph
   /ˈsɛnəˌtæf, -ˌtɑf/
-noun
a sepulchral monument erected in memory of a deceased person whose body is buried elsewhere.

Use cenotaph in a Sentence:

I sure do enjoy sharing this growler of Three Floyds Cenotaph!

Growler shared by Thorpe429 and Amyliz4. Thanks Mike and Amy! Served alongside Hill Farmstead Citra IPA.

A: Cenotaph appears a slightly hazy shade of light orange, with an inch of white head that generates some great lacing upon the pint glass.

S: Citrus and hops. Very fresh and wonderfully inviting.

T: Fabulous taste, with a healthy dose of citrus, à la Citra hops. Extremely delicious and hop forward.

M: The feel was nice, with a decent showing of hop bitterness in the finish.

D: Very solid IPA. I would be happy to drink this again.

Edit: February 2012
Recently made my way through a case of this with the help of some friends. Absolutely phenomenal beer. Right up there with the best hoppy beers in the world.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 01-06-2011

Pour clear light dark golden, with a small white head.
This thing sure smells great... Aroma is kinda crisp, of slight apricot, slight pine... Hops and hops. Nothing crazy, just pretty darn tasty..
Long and delicious bitter aftertaste. Medium bodied, with a slight fizzy carbonation.
... As said, pretty darn tasty. Thanks to Sean for sending me this.

Bottle on the RBSG 2012 bus. Clear sudsy orange. Piney aroma, grapefruit, pineapple and nectarine. Flavor tends a little more toward herbal with sap and resin, snappy citrus fruit framed by subtle malt. Crisp, flavorful, dry. Good stuff.

Tap at Durty Nellies served in a shaker glass. Honey colored pour with a white head that laces well and reduces to a thin, but lasting film on top of the brew. Very Earthy hop aroma. Taste is full of hops. A perfect blend of Earth, citrus, and pine. Big time Amarillo flavor. Way out of balance toward the hop side of the spectrum but I know that's the appeal of this beer. Thin body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice dark straw color slightly amber. Incredible nose to this beer when its fresh, beautiful citrus, fruit and floral notes with some sweetness, kind of like a nice mountain breeze, I could almost just sit here all day and smell the nose, had I not then tasted how ridiculously good this beer is next. The taste is so well balanced with the hops it makes this by far the most drinkable beer Ive ever had. Sweet but not too sweet, bitter but not to bitter. The malts are a slight caramel mixed wonderfully with citrus notes of the hops. Just an incredible example of the pale ale category.

bottles shared 12/18/11. 

gold-ish yellow color with a white head.

holy hop aroma!....intense gf, orange, pine, florals, grass, pineapple and lemon.

the flavor is the same but more floral and spicy  than bitter...gf, slight bitterness and dryness galore on the finish. it smells better than it tastes but not by much and not a bad thing.

crisp and insanely sessionable.9/3/8/4/17

Thanks to my Secret Santa for that one. Bottle looks good. Beer in the glass also, zippy, huge head. Wunderbar hoppy-sweet aroma. Starts mild, hoppy-grasy, modest sweet. Some fruity hints of grapefruit. More and more dry, bitter background. Well balanced finish, quite drinkable. Great beer!
light amber color. Dry, unbeliavkbly balanced with agressively citrus notes, dry lemon peel, grapefruits. Moderate bitter finish
Nice cloudy golden appearance and addicting citrus aroma.  Incredibly smooth and drinkable.  Very solid beer

12 oz into Duvel tulip.  Once again Tewaris is the man for sharing this with me. 
Light amber, hearty pour leads to generous white head.  Aroma is really floral, fruity.  Sweet, and smooth, quite malty body, bitter from start to finish, pretty nice beer.

Bottle.  Poured into a snifter.  Citra hop aroma of guava, passion fruit, apricot and honeydew melon.  Its resinous with some biscuit, toasted malts and pine needles in there too.  Medium bodied and chewy.  There is bitterness in the flavour before avocado, grapefruit, biscuit, cookie dough and black tea.  The finish is long and bitter with tropical fruit, especially guava and mango.  Thank you Brandon for the bottle!

12oz bottle, no date, poured into a Surly pint glass. 

Pours a dark honey-gold, with a frothy white head on top. Great sticky lace holds on for dear life. "The nose, the nose, my kingdom for the nose." All things holy, this is an amazing aroma. Fresh hops, pine needles, citrus zest, and a dry hay-like aroma. Other beers have bits and pieces of this aroma, but this is so potent and so fresh. Frick. I want to "cologne-up" with this stuff.

The body is well-balanced and carbed up well. Crisp and clean, not too heavy. Holds its own with the ABV. Hops, hops, hops. Yes, please. Fresh green hops, grapefruit, melon, orange slices, honey - all melded perfectly to make this splendid beer. This beer is bitter, no doubt, but I love that it doesnt linger in any harsh manner. The finish is short, which I like and dont like at the same time. I like that it keeps me sipping (or gulping) more and more, but I dont like that my glass is soon empty, unable to be filled with this blessed brew again. More ZD, please!!!
Nice piney aroma. A very unique flavor with a nice hops balance and a subtle aftertaste.

Pours a lightly cloudy orange with about half a finger of stark white slowly dissipating head.  Odor is of sweet hops with a hint of orange.  Taste is surprisingly sweet, with a strong caramel flavor that fades into a mild hop bitterness.  Not as hoppy as Id expect, but its very tasty.

Bottle-huge thanks to Daknole for sharing this lovely pale ale while passing through Phoenix-June 2012-pours lite orange with a small soapy white head.  huge floral hoppy nose lite lemons and other bright citrus.  flavors are very fruity, candy like almost in a sense.  i smell a touch, and i mean a touch of diacytl here.  Hmm, this is a very good pale ale however, there are better out there.  this beer is a wallop of citrus!  however, if the diacytl wasnt in the nose, i would be all about this.  Probably the best beer i have had from FFF in many years however, still falls a bit short and somewhat over-hyped.  I was expecting a home run here.

Received in a pint glass from cask. Clear orange amber with a 1/2 inch on foam. No visible carbonation. It this is a cask pour.

Smell is nice grapefruit and hops.

Taste is nice balanced hops up front. A little sweetness then malt with a bitter finish.

Mouthfeel is not overly light, nice. Cask pour has minimal carbonation.

Overall an excellent beer. Hops are very aromatic but not overwhelming in the taste. Very well balanced and easy to drink.

bottle, from Dave at Tylers Apex. good aroma, sweet, fruity, orange, apricot, peach. toffee, cereal malt. orangy gold color, good head and lace. sweet bitter flavor. medium body, creamy mouthfeel, bitter dry finish. Good beer. Nice fruity aroma, good sweet bitter mix on the flavor, flavor took on more of a grapefruit than orange that I found in aroma. solid APA and another reason to like Citra....
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text:
Amazing...Three Floyds with another gem.  I still cannot believe the lacing on this beer...Awesome.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
El citra en estado puro, Quizá de los aromas más intensos a lúpulo con los que me he topado, mantiene el IBU de una pale ale con ligeras notas a malta en sabor. Mango, Melocotón, Cítricos. Increible
UPDATED: JUL 17, 2012 Goes down great. A wonderful hop smell. Very fresh. This is a must try for any hop lover. I will forever crave having a Zombie Dust when I try a disappointing IPA.

On tap. Nice clear golden - amber color. Impressive foamy off-white head. Great lace. Delicious buttered bread malt aroma, with the perfect amount of delicious floral citrus hops, with a little spice. Awesome, crisp smooth carbonation, with a moderately dry finish. Mild bitter, light savory taste. Very easy to drink. Awesome that I finally got a chance to try this, and it totally lives up to the hype. Fantastic pale ale.

Hoppy, smooth, refreshing. One of the best beers I have ever had. Had it fresh at the brewery. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At the brewpub, nice hoppy and vegetal aromas and flavours. Slight, resin and grass aftertaste

Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a Three Floyds imperial pint glass.

Pours a darker golden color with orange hues with a two finger bright white head, great retention and abundant lacing as the head recedes. Extremely fragant with the smell of citrus rind, freshly cut grass, and orange blossoms on the nose. Opens with pleasant citrus, tangy to slighly bitter, a very light touch of sweet malt, and finishes dry, crisp and clean with citrus rind and a touch of pine and the perfect amount of bitterness. An very refreshing APA, which shows a surprising amount of complexity for a brew that uses only Citra hops.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2013 As soon as you get this beer near your nose youll be hit by the amazing, lemony aroma of citra.  The taste is really where this beer shines though, tons of lemony, citrus hop flavor with a bit of bitterness.  Grain backbone is restrained, but balanced, as it should be.

12 oz. bottle. Poured hazy gold with thick, fluffy white head.  Tons of citrus fruits dominate; peach, orange, and light grapefruit notes present.  Phenomenal beer. Id session the shit out of this on the reg if I could get it readily.

pours orange with a slight haze, a lasting white head and good lacing.  aroma is a warm, potent, and  rich blend of orange peel, grapefruit, caramel and subdued alpha acid.  taste is pale malt, caramel, oranges, pine and grapefruit.  the body is medium but very juicy.  finish bitter but with lingering citrus and sugar notes.  a very satisfying and complex beer.
Poured a nice orange/amber color with a short white head. Had some nice citrus hop scents. Taste is a light pine bitterness with a little bit of fruit. Super smooth beer, was worth the price on eBay.

On tap at Timothy O Tooles in Gurnee, Illinois.  Poured a dark golden.  Fantastic grapefruit aroma.  Citrus flavor.  Nice lacing.   Incredibly drinkable.  Based on aroma I really though this was an IPA.  Suprised at how delicate it was.  Overall great beer.

Golden color, ample head, absolutely fantastic floral, citrus hop aroma that smells like the real thing right in the glass. Taste is moderately bitter with a light, grainy malt background. Fairly dry, lingering bitter finish, but not overdone. Decent but not living up to the reputation for me.
strong grapefruit aroma and flavor. extremely well hopped and drinkable. delightful aftertaste. I actually found myself reminiscing about this beer the next day.

Aroma is a sweet piny grapefruit grassy scent. Pours a orange copper color with medium carbonation creamy head that last leaving some really nice lacing. Taste is a citrus orange piny grassy with some sweet pineapple. The Burp was amazingly tasty. Leaves a very nice taste. This beer did not disappoint. I wish a had 5 more. Thank You Danny.

This pour is from a bottle, as pictured, purchased from the brewery, though I did have it on tap as well.  Tap was, frankly, one of the best beers Ive ever had.  So simple and balanced, yet so well-done.  Pours a clear golden orange.  Smells of in-your-face citrus, some pineapple, orange.  Taste is similar, but the hops are not in the forefront.  Not blistering on the tongue, extremely well-balanced.  Awesome beer.

Pours golden with a white head.  Giant aroma of citrus hops, grapefruit, orange, lemon, pine, and grass.  Excellent dry and hoppy kick in the taste.  Includes pine, grapefruit, and lemon.  Heavy pine aftertaste that stays with you.  Lots here to remind me of an IPA, but much more smooth and refreshing to drink.  A little on the sticky side when drinking, but very crisp with lively carbonation.  This is really one to remember.

A pale huh?  Killer.  Sticky, resinous and beautifully hopped.  Had on draft at the brewery.  They are bottling this tomorrow, so..... I will return on my way back home to pick some up.  I love FFFs beers of course, but when they are able to hop up a session pale ale to this extent and make it taste this floral and good, I am just overwhelmed.

Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a creamy off-white head and good lacing. Citrus and hops with notes of grapefruit. Good flavor with the slightest hint of malt in the finish. Medium bodied. I actually like Alpha King better, but this is a fine beer.

On-tap at the Brewpub into imperial nonic. 

A - Pours a hazy golden yellow, white head, lots of sticky lacing, thin filmy cap and a thin ring around the glass. 

S - Huge citrus hops, slight floral note, solid bitterness, slight dank character. 

T - Lots of delicious hops, not overly bitter, just right. An assault of citrus notes, orange peel, floral notes. 

M - Light, crisp and refreshing, good carbonation. 

O - An excellent beer, to say the least. Very refreshing and the hop character is wonderful. I love me some citra! A must-try at the Brewpub.

Poured from 12oz bottle to dimple mug:

Pours a nice, clear pear gold with a swelling finger of dense-ish white head. Consistent, slow lacing and average lacing.

The nose is truly divine... lush tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, heavy sweet syrup, nectarine, all sorts of citrus, bits of dank herb. Massive smelling beer.

The taste hosts a whole slew of similar notes, but not quite the same density that is achieved in the aroma. Certainly a whollop of citric hops. Tasty stuff.

The feel is a tad thin. Still immensely drinkable, especially given the insane level of hop dosage.

Great beer that I am very grateful to have had the opportunity to try.
Found on tap at Firkin. Light golden color with a very citrusy aroma, slight hint of grapefruit. Heavy on hops, light on citrus flavor with a bit of bitter.
From the tap poured a straw color with a fair amount of head.  Refreshing citrusy hoppy flavor with a quick finish.

Bottle, courtesy of a friend in Holland. A lovely beer, a real experience to be able to taste. A cheesy malty aroma. Slightly cloudy pour with a little lacing. Fruity palate with that hint of Citra pushing through An excellent beer. Can't wait for the next one and wish it was more widely available.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle shared at Android ipa tasting.
thin white head.  Hazy golden blond pour.  Grapefruit bitterness.  Very nice ipa.

Bottle - courtesy of a very generous GandGKevin. Thanks Kevin! Hazed amber with a tall, fluffy white head. Juicy, luscious, hoppy aroma. Hops are dominant with of soft caramel and malt notes underneath. Big floral and citrus hops up front that overwhelm the palate but get a touch tamer as the bottle is consumed. Then tropical fruit notes, sweet malt, soft caramel, and light pine resins come through. Body is medium with a chewy overall feel and creamy carbonation. Lingering, but moderate, hop bitterness and oiliness. Ends with more floral hops, pine needles, citrus oils, tropical fruit notes, light caramel and malt. Damn tasty!
12 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy orange and has pine and citrusy nose.  Flavor has a little bit of lemon citrus, pine and some minor floral notes.  This is an awesome pale ale, one of the best.

12oz bottle. Poured a slightly hazy amber color with an averaged sized off white head. Aromas of floral, pine, citrus, grassy, and toasty. Tastes of grass, pine, floral citrus, with a touch of caramel. I could drink this one all day long and glad I have  few bottles!

Refrigerated 12 oz. bottle from queenholly poured into a snifter.  Pours clear light orange with small slighty off-white head that dissapates quickly.  Little lacing, medium body, low carbonation, and nice strong citrus hop aroma (hint of pine in the aroma).  Taste is some citrus, some herbal,  bone dry pine, and finishes a nice slightly dry bitter.  Pretty good pale ale, but less pine is required to be one of my favorites.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2012 Rich Citrus Hops, Grapefruit, Yeast, and Malty Flavors. Heavy Bodied with a slight carbonated feel. Crisp and refreshing on the palate; Overall a great tasting beer and I cant wait to try more offerings from 3 Floyds
Several samples at Firestone Fest. Nose is pine and grapefruit. Hazy orange with a yellow tinged head. Flavor is bitter with pine and lemon.

Huge thanks to mikem409 for this.  Man what a smell.  It filled the area with its pine and citrus.  Taste is very hoppy with tones of citrus and oine flavor.  Nice color with a thick white head.  There is a simular pine taste that most FFF have in their beers.  But this is really nice beer.  Awesome on a summer evening
12 oz bottle courtesy of MC. Pours a slightly  cloudy honey gold with a medium sized white head. Aroma of citra hops, light honey, mild citrus and grassy notes. Taste is much the same as the aroma.

Good looking beer, plenty of big white head ad good lacing tops a somewhat hazy, light brown beer.

Smell and taste are intense, and amazing!  This is perhaps the best pale ale Ive had.  Intense grapefruit and earthy pine on the smell.  Taste is a bold, crisp, deliciously piney and citrus hopped blast of flavor, with fruity notes.  The malts offer body but mostly Im tasting hops.  

Given that this is a citra showcase beer, it makes me want to brew an all citra pale ale soon!  

The body is light yet almost tingly with hops and fruity aftertastes.  

Overall this beer rocks and Im leaving it on my wants list!

Bottle at home. Poured a hazy golden orange with a two finger off-white head and great lacing. Smell is big pine, citrus,grapefruit, grass, and light caramel. Taste is big pine, grapefruit, pineapple, tropical fruits, with a light caramel backbone that leaves it tasting very well-balanced. Nice mouthfeel with high carbonation. A very well crafted APA, with a nice bitter finish. Has to be the best pale ale I have ever tasted. How is this not an IPA?
Just delicious and so nicely hopped with a good balance on the malt end. Definitely get the hops but not a serious mouth pucker like some of their other IPAs. This is more session-able, so to speak.

5/8/12- Pours a golden orange with a thin bright head that laces well. Aromas include grapefruit, mango, and sweet malt. Starts light and creamy with a touch of carbonation followed by smooth sweet biscuit malt that coats the tongue. Leaves behind mango and bitter citrus as it departs slowly. A fantastic APA that lives up to the hype. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at the Central OH BA Tasting at From The Vine on 06/02/2012: Pours a clear bright orange-gold color with a medium white head that dissipates steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, citrus and malt. Light to medium body with a crisp and zesty hops character that has floral and citrus notes, as well as some sweet malt. The finish is fruity with a lingering fresh hops aftertaste. Solid Pale Ale all around.

I love growlers and side by sides and this was an awesome thing to do, served out of a growler side by side with Citra IPA from Hillfarmstead. Citra FIGHT!

Beer is hazy and dark yellow with a nice head of medium and large bubbles that leaves some lacing on the glass. Carbonation is moderate to low.

Aroma is a little weaker than I had hoped but I can totally smell the tropical fruit bomb that awaits me.

Beer is relatively light in body with a very mild sweetness lead off and an explosion of hop character in the midpalate. The finish of the beer is mildly bitter but it is a wonderfully rounded beer with so much hop flavor. Its lighter than I expected and not quite as bitter but I suppose this is an APA and not an IPA, I would have more of this anytime.

Bottle purchased at the source. Ive tried this a fare amount of times now. Picked up a case to take home from Dark Lord Day. Pours a hazy orange/ copper colour, with a fluffy white head. Lacing is spiderweb like. Aroma is absolutely amazing, mango, piles of citrus hops. Tastes is a complete balance between bitter and sweet. Obviously hops. True perfection in beer form. The best.

12 oz bottle from a trade with zach. Thanks. Pours a hazy brass color with a medium white head that has fair retention. The aroma is strong with mixed citrus, mostly oranges, but also some lemons and limes. The flavor mirrors the aroma, with a big blast of oranges, grapefruit, lemons and limes. The malt base was just a tad bit sweet and worked well with the hops. The palate was full and silky smooth with lively carbonation. The finish is long and dry with lingering oranges. Overall: A first rate pale ale. I loved it.
Be aware that everyones palate is different. Overall great beer. Hoppy with a good citrus taste and finish. I have had draught and bottle and both are great. PROST!

From tap @Mikkeller. A bright orangey body, under a dense low blond cap of foam.  Crisp and inviting fruity hop aroma. Tropical fruits and superfresh citrus hit the nose. Also a catty note, and hint of resiny hop oils. Appropriate light-bodied. Clean in the mouth. The flavor emphasizes the qualities of Citra hops really well. Fresh ripe citrus fruit flavor with tones of gooseberries and passion fruit.  Dry pale malts in the backbone. Tight and fresh fruity bitterness in lasting finish. Simple and inviting, and easy drinking. I just love this one.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a frothy off-white head. Aroma of sweet citrus, pine, grapefruit, and fruity hoppiness. Flavor was hoppy and moderatly bitter with citrusy fruity hops, piney resin, grapefruit, and some light caramel with a long and bitter finish.

Bottle via trade through PUBR,, the Pennsylvania Underground Beer Railroad, and while we were trading this we pissed on a PLCB emblem and shoved some pins in a Wendell Young voodoo doll.  The pour is turbid, thick, dark straw, and has a 3-finger off-white head that laces well.  Nose is like Dreadnaught; and in fact in a blind test I trust I could not detect the difference.  Huge piney hops with tons of honeydew, tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, and black pepper all over the place.  Definite 10 for nose.  Tastes rich, complex, with huge pineapple, tangerine, honeydew, grapefruit, black pepper, and the full profile of my favorite hop, Citra.  If I ever remarry, it will be to a Citra hop cone.  This one just juices all over the place, all over your taste buds with the aroma filling the olfactory glands, and the taste continuing down the esophageal membranes.  even the hop burps on this one smell great.  If you can get this one, it is certainly worth your time.  I just hope we can keep the eBay scumbags away, and I sincerely hope this review does not spark a wave of trading online, although to be honest I am starting to think that not only does Nick  Floyd tolerate the inflated trading of his beers; but he clandestinely encourages it, as with Hollywood, "all publicity is good publicity".
Golden tan pour into an imperial pint glass, inch or so of thick white head. Sweet hoppy aroma that is a bit subdued. Aromatic hoppy flavor, it goes down too smoothly. Fruity hoppy aftertaste.

12oz bottle I had while visiting friends in Chicago- This is beer packs the most citrusy, passionfruity hop aroma/flavor that has ever graced my mouth. I was completely blown away by this one, a truly world-class brew!

Traded for a six-pack while down in Asheville, NC. This pale ale is a rockstar, from the iridescent label to its shine in the glass to the way it lights up all your taste buds on the way down. Stellar in every way. So glad we've got five more of these superstars!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Viktoriagade 8BC, kld., DK-1655 Copenhagen, Denmark.Light unclear medium to dark orange colour with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, light heavy hoppy, pine, orange - citrus, grapefruit. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity, citrus, tropical fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120509]

On tap at Hopleaf in Chicago. A bit dark in there, but looked like a bright orange pour with a half-finger white head. Massive citrus and tropical fruits on the nose, perfect sweetness (meaning not too much). Slick palate. Tasty and massively drinkable.

Pours a clear gold color with a 1 finger white head consisting of tight bubbles.  Aroma is very citrusy, floral.  Very impressive aroma.  First sip lands me gentley in a field of flowers in bloom, poppys, iris, lillies, and then suddenly an orange falls off the tree and hits me in the head.  More and more citrus fruit keeps falling, until I look like Carmen Miranda.  Beautiful.  A strong malt backbone holds this all together until the bitter end.  Very well executed beer, and deserving of its high ratings.

One of the best beers Ive ever had regardless of style. Im unsure if Ive been so taken aback by any beers quite this much lately. Worth the accolades it gets, and then some. If this was available near me, Id have a case tomorrow

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2012 Holy sh**!! Now, this is what I call a nose. Fresh fruits, citrus peel, trident gum, trolli gummi peach rings, pepper and other spices, floral undertones, caramelized sugar, and a faint whisper of eucalyptus. The body is almost thick for an undead pale ale, very good. On the tongue, the flavors are endless, sharper than those of the Alpha King, but just as good. The parade of bitter and sweet ends with slight funk and leaves a fresh, sugary, citrusy aftertaste under the palate. Speaking of the AK, I would say this beer just edges it out on account of its fuller body. A sensational beer, which goes to show what a fantastic brewery 3floyds is. Id love to sit back and go to town on a bunch of these f*ckers all day. Which is why its a bummer that merely procuring them is an ordeal.

Bottle 355ml.
Pours dark golden with low offwhite head. Nice lacing. Aroma is of malt, extreme citrus, tropical fruits, mango, peach. Very intense. Taste is of malt, citrus, fruit explosion, mango. Full bodied, perfect balance. The bitterness tickles the tongue. Alchool well-hidden.Incredibly good, I raise my hat.

bottle.....Hazy medium copper pour,thin wispy head,some lacing. Fresh citrus hop aroma,peach notes .Smooth citrus hop bitterness. Grapefruit with a touch of resin. Medium bodied,finish is dry with a lingering bitterness.Easy  drinking pale,pretty tame, especially coming from these guys. Good beer.

Bottle picked up through Chucks by way of DLD. Pours hazy, pale golden, fair amount of carbonation. Dense, bright white head. Nose- wow, first 10 spot. Grapefruit, white pepper, orange zest, mango, herbal notes. On the palate, medium to heavy bodied, bready malts, white grapefruit, touch of honey, fresh green, pineapple hops. Subtle bitterness and dryness on the finish. Just impeccably put together and balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle. Finally got a 6 pack of this at Dark Lord Day 2012! Pours a very nice dark golden color with a small off-white head. Smells of citrus, hops, citrus, malt, and citrus; absolutely phenomenal smell that you just want to keep smelling; literally on the first sniff, I said "Holy Shit!". Very good taste too, lots of citrus (especially on the aftertaste), though the hops arent as profound as in the aroma. Decent body to it. Overall an outstanding APA/IPA, and the only disappointing thing is that I cant get this as often as I wish.

12 oz bottle given to me as a gift from my friendly beer store manager.  Pours a hazy orange with slight amber hue, thick white head, decent lacing.  Aroma is wonderful of citrus hops, a slight malt backbone, pine, resin, peaches, and pears.  Flavor matches well and makes for a great drink.  Pale ale would be a stretch though.  It is a very good IPA.

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2012 330 ml bottle with gold wax - pours golden with a foamy, lasting eggshel white head. Subtle aromas of peach, lytchee, orange zest, citrusy, hint of vanilla, peach. Medium body with subtle bitterness, touch of sweetness and a loong fresh finish. Taste is very fruity in the front and the mid with coffee and chocolate towards the finish, keeping the bitter notes of the latter two in the end. Nice beer indeed.
12 ounce bottle with aromas of pine, grapefruit, bread.  Flavors are the same, really cant add anything else that hasnt been mentioned.  Really nice beer that I can drink a lot of.
En botella.Dorada con buena espuma.Aromas un poco menos que de tirador.Muy bien balanceada dulce y lupulosa.

Have had this a couple of times to John C. Absolutely amazingly tasty beer. Not crazy but crazy good. Hope it manages to become a 3F mainstay. Great balance. Wonderful hops. It was so fresh and delicious.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle thanks to Ed. This is a fantastic beer. It defiantly shows off the Citra hop. The malts are noticeable as well,  I feared the hops would overwhelm them, a nice bready malt profile. A very well made beer.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2012 Grapefruit, bread, resin...just indescribably fantastic. I hope this becomes a staple in Three Floyds roster.

Pours a clear gold with frothy tan tinged head. Aroma is grapefruit and pine wood. Flavor is delicious bitter citrus, white grapefruit and an undertone of brown sugar. Body is medium with a lot of carbonation.

Bottle. Light caramel and 3Fs signature pine/grapefruit/pineapple/floral hops aroma.  Hazy orange with a moderate off-white head. Sweet caramel, and again that 3Fs signature hops flavor, pine / grapefruit / pineapple / floral.  Medium body, slight dryness in the finish. I first had this beer a couple of years ago on tap at 3Fs, when it was called Cenotaph. Ive had it several time since, and Its definitely a good beer, but my opinion is that its yet another over-hyped brew.

This one is simply amazing! Pours golden orange with a little white head. Aroma is overwhelming with fruits (mainly peaches, mango, and other tropical fruits), citrus, and hops. Simply incredible! First time I give a 10 on aroma! Taste is the same as the aroma, tough more subtle. Nice bitterness. Full bodied beer with a creamy texture. Once again, a really amazing one!
Une de mes meilleures bières à vie! Robe oragne dorée avec un léger collet blanc. Arôme riche et envahissant comprenant principalement des fruits (pêches, mangue et autres fruits tropicaux), mais également des agrumes et du houblon. Le gout est semblable à larôme, mais en moins explosif. Bonne amertume. Ronde en bouche, texture crémeuse. Une bâtèche de bonne biere!

Trade via Honkybra - Thanks! Man, this is almost perfect, as far as I am concerned. I absolutely love medium to light bodied pales, with a crapload of fresh hops, which is exactly what youve got here. Lots f grapefruit, a wee bit of caramel. I would drink this all the time if I could get it here...
Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.  Clear golden beer with a offwhite lacy head. Hoppy, fruity, berry aroma. Lovley flavour explosion i the mouth; fruity, hoppy and very fresch. Wounderful balance.

Bottle 355 ml. Thanks to dountcounttoday! Pours hazy golden/light amber with a small white head and some lacing. Color is beautiful. Aroma is impressive! Strong notes of tropical fruits, peach(!), mango, hops, floral and herbal. Very complex, probably the best aroma ive seen in a beer so far! Taste is like aroma, but lighter. Tropical fruits. Slight bitterness, but not overwhelming. Mouthfeel is creamy. Medium to full body. This one is a great beer. High drinkability, refreshing, great complexity, nice balance, nose is perfect...wow!

bottle, honey color, mild lacing, crisp APA, with a hoppy bite. 

A sip is worth a thousand words, Crisp clean Citra hops put  the smack down. Get some.

Got in a trade from FullObs...thanks, Brett!  This is awesome.  Worth the hype.  Grass and sweet orange rind leap out of the bottle at arms length when I opened this.  Mild, fading head and almost no lacing.  Pretty light amber.  Nose is distinct and clean, turning out some honey as it warms.  Super clean, crisp finish with lingering mouthwatering bitterness.  Medium body-normally would want a bit more, but it works great here.

tap.  Slightly hazy amber, small head..
Scent is strong grapefruit, hops..
Taste is grapefruit, pine...nicely fruity...some sweetness amongst the citrus hops.
Wonderfully smooth, yet bitingly hoppy.
Excellent.

200ml from tap at Mikkeller Bar. Almost clear amber coloured body. Patchy surface. Fragile lacing. Inviting aroma of fresh fruity hops. Fresh oranges entwined with pineapples in flavour and supplemented by a mild touch of malty sweetness. Rounded and smooth bitter ending. Exquisite drinkability and very refreshing (Copenhagen, 09.05.2012).

Thanks to Jason for sharing this bottle! Pours a slightly hazy dull gold color. Small off white head that goes to thin topping with a larger ring. Smell is pineapple, tropical fruit - it smells pretty inviting. Taste is more subtle then nose, nice tropical, finishes very dry with a very mild hop bite. Light + body, nice carbonation level - pretty smooth. Overall a delightful pale ale.

This beer is as awesome as youve heard.  

Being in Chicago, I am able to keep a small supply , and I regularly give people their first taste-- I have yet to have anyone say its anything less than incredibly tasty.  

Doesnt matter if theyre into hoppy beers or not, which is how I see it as well-- I dont view this as a particularly "hoppy" beer, although it does use some unique hop flavors as centerpiece.

My favorite thing about it, and many others have said the same thing, is the carbonation.  Absolutely amazing tiny, champagney bubbles that are still somehow as delicate as some of the flavors.

Awesome, awesome beer.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2012 Pours a hazy golden orange with a two finger head, nice lacing, good looking beer. Aroma of citra hops, citrus fruits especially grapefruit. Taste follows nose malts present to back up hop bitterness but still allow the hops to shine. Smooth and easy to drink with little alcohol presence.
Three Floyds best beer to date. I would recommend it to anyone who likes a pale ale with a strong flavor of hops.

On keg @ Mikkeller Bar during CBC week. The pours deep hazy orange with a tiny eggshell white head. The nose is light mango, sea grass, pineapple, solero ice cream, cut grass and flowers. The taste is lightly salty sea grass and lightly caramelized pineapple. Theres nice, buoyant fruity malts with a light, grassy hop finish. The mouthfeel is prickly carbonation, but smooth and easy to drink, slick. Overall, a pretty excellent pale ale. I would drink this often if it was available!

Draft @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity fresh hoppy citrus aroma. Fresh citrus hoppy flavor with hints of grapefruit. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2012 [5/9/12] Draught at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Clear amber color with a medium white head. Lovely tropical citra aroma. Flavor full of fruity hops with a nice fresh bitter finish. Great stuff, incredibly quaffable.

12 oz. bottles. Pours a clear light copper color, with a nice fluffy, medium sized white head. Aroma is strong on the citrus, wit just a touch of resin and a mild sweet malt biscuit note. Flavor has notes of bitterness, citrus hops. Very session-able. One of my favorites.

Bottle @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear golden with a small creamy white head that slowly dissipates leaving lots of trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and hoppy with caramel, mango, pineapple, passionfruit, hay, gunpowder, orange peal, lemon zest and dusty dry soil. Taste is sweet and bitter with white bread, pineapple, mango, passionfruit, lemon zest, caramel and resinous wood. Mouthfeel is smooth, balanced and light to medium bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with pine, lemon zest, pineapple, passionfruit and caramel. Extremely drinkable. Could have this all day every day.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Always wanted to try a 3F brew and nows my chance! Vibrant orange with almost zero head. My nose has been taken to Club Tropicana. Yep, tropical fruits with plenty of orange and tangerine zest. Great stuff. Much more body than I expected and feels nicely balanced on the tongue. Excellent.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. It pours golden yellow, with a thick white head. The nose is pine, resin, sweet orange, mango, tangerine, sweaty sock and grass. The taste is pine, grass, floral, resinous hops, mango, sweet tangerine, orange and leaf, with a long refreshing bitter finish. Very well hidden alcohol. Medium body, moderate carbonation and velvety mouth-feel. Superb balance and massive drinkability, one of the best APAs I have ever had.

12oz Bottle on Trade. Pours a light gold, head retention okay, aromas of floral citrus and mango, tropical fruits, nice, light body for an APA, on the hoppier side of the style.  Will have to consider doing an all Citra hop IPA. Dryish finish, all around good, would love to have this fresh at the Three Floyds Pub. Nice job!

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar.
Pours orange amber with a white head.
Fruity hops and a kind smooth maltyness. Highly drinkable!

Bottle from Mikkeller Bar. Looks are to die for: Pours clear radiant orange. White foam. Smells of light citrus, freshly cut apples and a summers day. Taste is fresh and clean, with notes of lime, melon and grapefruit. Lovely.

Orange/amber colored pour. A light, thin white head with minimal lacing. Danky, citrus aroma. Onions, garlic, grass. Bitter, soft hop flavor and a hint of malt. Dry finish with a slight sweetness. Very good.

Tap @ MikkellerBar. Slightly hazy amber/deep golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine and bitter.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2014 Pours cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma is screaming westcoast with some fresh hop forward citra hops along with tropical notes like pineapple, mango, orange, citrus, peach, also some pine and just a tiny hint of sweeter malts. Very clean, almost white winish. Taste of raw citra hops with all those tropical notes from the aroma along with some resin, pine, westcoasty awesomeness, a tiny grassy note and very bitter/raw. Just clean and awesome IPA ! A session of only this would be dangerous!
Bottle. Sweet aroma with notes of tropical fruits and caramel cookies. Notes of lychee, melon caramel and pine needles in taste. Grape in the aftertaste. Big and complex without being too bitter.

Draft. Deep gold body with orange highlights, slightly hazy. Frothy, off-white head. Big citrus aroma with notes of grapefruit, peach, pineapple, toasted grain, leafy hops. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly sweet and moderately bitter bordering on heavily bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Chewy raw hop flavors are nicely balanced with bright citrus. Crisp and juicy with long, lingering bitterness.
ON TAP. Pours a medium golden orange, slight head, aroma is hops and ripened fruit. Taste is citrus, with a nice spice note, maybe coriander. This is a very good APA!

(20 cl on tap @ Mikkeller Bar) Pours clear golden with medium, white head. Good retention and rich lacing. Aroma of peach and tropical fruits. Medium bodied, oily texture with medium carbonation and a sweet and bitter finish. Very well balanced - almost no harshness from the bitterness in the finish - just enough to balance out the initial fruity sweetness. Very clean and refreshing taste. Extremely addictive, fruity hop juice.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2012 (Bottle) Pours dark orange to amber with a creamy off white head. The aroma holds sweet citrus and flowers up front with mild piny, soft herbal and light tropical notes. Toast, honey and light caramel. Bright and clean on the nose. The flavour is light sweet, medium bitter and light acidic with bright citrus, flowers, tart tropical fruits, grass, herbs, light pine and clean toast. The mouthfeel is clean, bright and smooth with soft carbonation. Balanced,  juicy and toasted finish. Near medium bodied.

Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. Golden beer with an off-white head. Pineapple aroma, apples, grapes, peach, hoppy metallic notes, milky, hay, perfume notes, some pear. Hoppy flavor, milky, pineapples, grass, hay, metal notes, grapes, milky, some spicy notes. Long bitter finish with pleasant notes of pineapple and peach. Wonderful beer, I can understand the hype...

Numerous bottles and first served in my GI IPA tulip: Pours a deep honey amber with a slight nod to some coppery highlights, frothy head and good lace. The aroma has notes of lemon, tangerine, dank, resin, biscuit, caramel, and slight flowery yeast esters. The taste is nicely fruity and moderately hopped with a more pronounced malt character than I was expecting. There is a catty and leafy quality that I do not care much for. The mouth feel is sprite and aggressive but the dirty and slight metallic finish knocked the score down, I wanted this beer to finish cleaner and more refreshing. I warned people that do not want to see my rating of this beer...  it is a bad beer, heck no but is it all that, heck no. After a few bottles I think my opinion for now has been cemented.

Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Light hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and rather bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 100512

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 2014-01-22, bottle from Mikkeller Shop, Stefansgade, Copenhagen, 8-5-8-4-15=40Golden color, medium sized head. The aroma is not explosive, but its nice, citrusy and harmonious. The mouthfeel is quite dry, not weak; good flavor of malt with a cereals accent; strong bitterness, some hop resins and fruitiness; again, good but not explosive; and crispy malts would be preferred than cereal-malts.Very good. Too expensive.2012-05-10, draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 8-4-8-4-16=40Hazy golden to light amber color. Strong hop aroma, initially fruity, then resiny, finally showing some manure; later it has a very strong cheesy character (soft french cheese); overall not the top of elegance.Malt and caramel flavor are very clean, therefore the drinkability is higher; very strong hopping, resiny before fruity; the final is bitter almost abrasive, strong but unbalanced, not allowing to the fruity or delicate notes of the hop to appear.Bomb, very good, but a bit less than expected.Sold at 40Kr (7$) for 20cl, this is a dishonest deal.

Tap, pours clear golden. Aroma: loads of citra, citrussy, fruity sweet, sweet orange, a lovely mix of citrus, some pineapple, mango, some sweet caramel, almost vanilla like notes, the fruityness reminds me somewhat of disco beer, some sweet grassy notes! Light spruce, damn this smells good, real clean! Taste:  taste follows through, though a bit muted compared to the aroma, some orange peel, nice and dry, medium bitterness, beautiful!

Mycket trevlig och fruktig doft och smak. Fin humlebalans. Lång fin eftersmak. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

this beer is world class!!  I dont think that anyone could find anything bad to say about this beer.  It might not be your favorite, but you will definitely agree with EVERYONE else that it is a perfectly balanced and smooth as it can be.

Pours a deep golden amber with a near non-existant head. Nose is sweet, fruity hops - some resin notes. Beer is carbonated well. Sweet for an IPA - which mostly means it has a solid malt backbone. Good hop bitterness on the finish, but the hop presence certainly doesnt hit you in the face - which is a nice change of pace. Really I cant find anything wrong with this beer!

Draft at Mikkeller bar.  Clear amber pour with as mall white head.  Aroma of fresh grassy hops, pine and citrus.  Flavour is medium bitter balanced by sweet malt and some caramel.  Medium bodied and medium carbonation.  Really great beer!

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar
Aroma is wonderful with hops, fruits, gooseberry bush and some resin. Flavour is rather hoppy with sweetish, exotic fruits, resin and some caramel. Very refreshing and good, probably the best APA Ive had.

Draught @ Mikkellebar.
Pours pale clear amber color with medium-sized head. Aroma of very fresh and crisp fruits, pine needles, orange peel, lots of hops, caramel and floral notes. Flavour of orange, mandarin, mild caramel, lemon, hops and pine needles. An excellent brew with very appealing aroma. Top notch.
3515

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen.
Pours a slightly hazy, copper orange colour with a lacy head. Aroma of very, very intensive Citra hops and strong fruitiness. Flavour is also very intensive; strong floral hops, citrus, caramel and lovely exotic fruitiness. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a long, bitter, fruity and tangy finish. Excellent. 9-4-8-4-16 4.1, 05/2012.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours a golden orange colour with a small head. Nice lacing. Aroma of orange, earthiness, floral notes. Rich and strong flavour with a massive fruity hop kick, grapefruit and caramel just enough to balance the flavour. Beautiful.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen

Pours clear copper orange with a smooth foamy head. Nice aroma of fruity hops, citrus, lemon, caramel malts and toffee. Taste is extremely well balanced with a lot of citrusy fruity hops and caramel malts. Finish is hoppy and fruity with lemony notes and hints of malts. Great, extremely tasty APA.

 Re-rated at Three Floyds Bar, Copenhagen. Even fresher than last time. Simply an awesome APA.
Tap @ Mikkeller bar. Pours clear Golden with a small White head. Lovely fresh citra Nose. Crisp and hoppy. Clean and dry. Some light caramel malts. Dope.

On tap at mikkeller. Pours a clear orange with a tiny off-white head and hints of lacings. Bitter with some sweetness. Lots of hoppy aromas of citrus, lime and flowers. Also hoppy hints of grapefruit, nutmeg and spruce. Medium bodied with hints of that fullness known from Sorachi Ace hops. Medium to soft carbonation. Long bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2012 Tap @ Mikkeller Bar. Pours clear golden with a small head. Aroma is full of fresh and zesty Citra hops, loads of citrus, mango, pineapple, lovely bright and fruity hoppiness, very bright and clean. A small hint of biscuity malt im te nose as well. Taste is just as good - lots of Citra hop notes, a very good showcase of this hop - pineapple, mango, citrus and a small grassy note as you burp. A good amount og malt in the body, which makes it very balanced. Lovey stuff, I could session this for hours.


In retrospect I had to bump this baby up because it was a better pale ale than Alpha King, which I had again a couple of days after having Zombie Dust,  Alpha King still being worth the 4.1 I gave it when I originally rated it. Using logical deduction, you can easily figure out that this beer is worth at least 4.1, and not the 4.0 that I originally rated it. As it was also better than Alpha King, thus its current rating of 4.2

From tap at MikkellerBar. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and smooth grapefruity. Smooth fruity, pine and smooth grapefruity. Bitter, smooth fruity and crisp citrusy hoppy. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy finish.

12 oz. bottle (from De Bierkoning) @ home. Light amber/copper color, clear. Off white, bit sticky head with good retention. Strong aromas of citrus & resin, retronasal almost acidic and some fruit. Flavor is mildly bitter, with some acidity. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and medium bitter.

Pale orange color large white head. Juicy fruit nose, oranges and apricot,wonderful. Light body starts off slightly sweet and fruity then goes into a nice dry grassy finish. Doesnt really seem like a pale but great.

Orange/gold pour with dense whitish head that lasts longer than the beer will!  Aroma is very nice...good combination of citrus fruit and piney hops.  Flavor is, well, incredibly hoppy...citrus and piney hops are both there for the party - if youre into hops, this beer has an incredible flavor - bolder than Alpha King without a doubt.  Palate is slightly oily and medium in body.  This was an excellent brew that Im happy someone brought to a party yesterday!

12 oz bottle, fresh from the brewery. hazy orange in the glass with a nice white head. good retention and some good looking lacing throughout the beer! citrus hop aroma along with some lemon zest and hint of orange peel. very clean tasting beer with a great hop profile! bitter finish, but no overpowering.

amber with decent head. wonderfully hoppy aroma, and taste is even better. absolutely fantastic flavor -- borders on an ipa, but very extremely smooth and drinkable. one of the best beers i have ever had the pleasure of drinking.

12oz bottle, super fresh from DLD 12, courtesy of alexsdad. thanks, Brad! pours a beautiful, clear, honey-gold with a creamy, bright white head that leaves sticky rings of lace. aroma is wonderful, very crisp and clean, with notes of apricot, pineapple, mango, and lime rind backed by fresh cut pine needles, wet grass, and sweet honey with a touch of biscuity malts. flavor is excellent as well with sweet, juicy, tropical fruit notes of mango, pinapple, starfruit, and apricot backed by dry, bitter grass, pine esters, and lemon zest with dry, crackery malts bringing up the back end. palate is medium bodied with smooth carbonation and a lightly bitter, hoppy finish. overall, this is a great pale ale, but i may actually prefer alpha king from FFF.

Sent to me as an extra in a trade along with 12 other Three Floyds beers. Poured into an Ommegang glass.

A - 2-Finger head mix of big and small bubbles. SRM of 18. Honey amber appearance. Minor haziness.

S - Not a huge nose on this beer. Dominated citra hops, minor lemon zest and some orange juice scent.

T - Great tasting beer. Delicious hop presences of Citra and Columbus, nice overall citrus taste with some roasted barley and bits of lemons.

M - 80/20 carbonation on the mouth swish, medium bodied.

O - Terrific beer. Its no Heady Topper but still a great IPA.

12oz bottle, no date but is supposed to be very fresh.  Served at around 40F.  Big thanks to Ryan for this one!

Pours lightly hazy orange/amber with a two finger off-white head that leaves a lot of clingy lacing and holds a small cap.

Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, a lot of pineapple and tropical fruits, some apricot, pine and floral notes, a bit of biscuity malt underneath all the hops as well.  Very good strength.

Flavor is incredibly hoppy, and not just for a Pale Ale, this hangs right there with many top-tier IPAs.  Grapefruit, pineapple, tropical fruits, melon, pine, grass, fairly dank and resinous.  Pretty much all hops but there is a bit of cracker-like malt there.  Minimal sweetness, very nice bitterness on the finish.  Minimal alcohol.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied, oily, a little sticky, good carbonation.

Boy, I thought their Alpha King was the be-all-end-all of APAs...and then I try this.  Wow.  Amazing beer, redefines the style.  Probably the hoppiest APA Ive ever had.  Fantastic.

Pours a deep golden orange with white lacing. Heavy notes of grapefruit, pine and resin. Bitter, Bitter, Bitter, but in an excelent fashion. Subtle sweetness upfront. At 6.2 this qualifies for a session beer for me and to explain this in the most eloquint fashio...Id session the shit out of this

12oz bottle thanks to ktown67.
