Bright golden pour with some white head.  Nose is crazy complex for being only one hop - tons of tropical fruit, mango, resin, dank, and caramel.  Wonderfully balanced with really no bitterness to speak of just delicious flavors of pineapple and ripe fruit.  One of the best Pale Ales out there.

12oz bottle fresh from brewery poured into a mason jar. Nice two finger, white head and golden, amber straw color. Smell is mouth watering hops including notes of tropical fruit,  grass & sweet pine.  Taste is similar with a little malt and nice body thats well carbonated. Flavorful, long lasting hops on the palate long after swallowing.  I wouldnt mention it in most reviews, but the beer has great lacing too. Highly drinkable & one of my favorite Three Floyds beers.

12oz bottle.  Got this from a regular, pours out a nice amber hue, decent carbonation and white head.  Aromas are vibrant, and not just because I havent been drinking ipas or pales for a bit, but this really ripped citrus zest.  Palate is fantastically balanced beautiful lemon pine up front with a nice dry finish.  Amazing offering.

This is an IPA disguised as a pale ale! Bright citrus aroma, very aromatic hops. Clear amber pour with thin head and excellent lacing. Strong citrus hop flavor, with a decent malt profile. Medium bodied with a lasting finish.
An excellent beer! Do these guys make a bad beer?

Pours a transcendent orange with a tiny white head that leaves some nice lacing.  It puts off an awesome hop aroma and the taste follows suit.  An enormous hop flavor up front that slowly fades into a nice crisp finish.  One of the most interesting and complex pales Ive ever tried and it took me forever to get my hands on a 3 Floyds product.  Im certainly not disappointed!  Outstanding!

Yeah.  Its good if you can get it.  This is one of those beers, like Gumball Head, that you could just pour into a glass and carry around smelling for a while before actually drinking.  The Citra hops are wonderful, but fellow-brewing friends of mine believe theyre also using Amarillo in this.  Perhaps the Citra shares some of the same qualities, but with the shortage on Citra hops, its amazing that 3F can still put this out.  Only have seen this available at the brewery.  Golden-orangeish pale ale with a clean bitterness and a nice malt backbone.

Bottle courtesy of toffsbury - thanks a million!  Pours a bright nearly-clear amber with a thin head.  Aroma is a blast of citra hops - all that tropical fruit goodness.  Taste is extremely well-balanced, some sweet caramelly malt up front, immediately followed by a citra explosion of tropical and citrus fruits, and a little pine.  Bitterness creeps up but never gets overpowering.  Great medium-full body, with perfect carbonation.  Top-of-the-line pale ale.  Wow, this is fantastic stuff!
Poured from bottle, light head, golden orange in color, light on the palate, smooth drinkability, flavor was incredible light slightly fruity almost perfect

12oz bottle thanks to kmyers8807: Pours a clear bright golden with a clingy-lacing froth of white head.  Has a bountiful fresh resinous citric hoppy nose with a touch of pale malty sweetness.  Starts with good fullness and a clean malt profile dripping with citrusy hop flavor and a crisp bitter balance before a drier bittersweet finish.  Very smooth and enjoyable.

Bottle brought from Michigan by my brother. Pours clear gold with a medium off-white head. Piney and sort of oniony hop nose with a bit of malt and citrus. Malty flavor with citrusy and piney hops before an oniony finish.

Three Floyds has never disappointed, and this exceptional American Pale Ale is no exception.

Ap: Pours a golden-orange, not quite clear but not quite hazy either. Sizeable head.

Ar: Wonderfully potent. Plenty of citrus (grapefruit, orange, lemon) with resin and pine hops as well.

T: Deliciously sweet, even tropical tasting (pineapple)? Some sweet malts (a hint of caramel) to balance the powerful citrus and floral hops.

M: Average body and carbonation.

(12oz bottle thanks to ktown67) clearing gold with lasting creamy white head. Nose is very tropical, mango, bit dank, super fresh citrus. Taste of biscuit, citrus and tropical, fresh and really nice. Oily but dry. One of the best pale ales ever.

My first beer purchase on ebay and man was it worth it. A dark gold pour with a medium sized white head. Resinious, citrus hop smell hits you immediately. Flavor is grapefruit, mango, and lemons. Very tasty brew with the enough malt to round it out. Would love to have at my disposal.

Drank at bu11zeyes 10,000th rating tasting. 

The beer pours a yellow color with a white head. The aroma is very nice. I get a lot of pineapple and apricot notes, as well as some bread and biscuit malt. The flavor is just as good if not better. I get a ton of hop characteristics, including a lot of pine, orange and resin notes. There is also a good bit of bread and biscuit malt, and the bitterness level is low to medium. The beer is extremely drinkable. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle bought at 3Floyds.  Im not going to give a detailed rating, just more of the experience.  I was in town visiting the folks and we thought, what the heck lets go to 3F.  Fat chance of getting in.  So we waited about 20 minutes to buy beer, Zombie Dust being the main attraction.  The pub was so crowded that only 2 people at a time could get in.  Many jokes in the line were along the Soup Nazi fame.  People were carted out cases of Zombie Dust!  I got my 6 pack, opened one that night, took another in my luggage back to Florida and enjoyed it on a lovely Saturday evening (the other 4 were downed by my parents).  Easily the most perfect Pale Ale made, or is it Cigar City?  Either way, Im in heaven!

Pours a beautiful dark gold with a fleeting small white head. Big hops aroma off the top (pine and citrus). Creamy mouthfeel with a big flavor of bubble gum and pineapple. Coats your mouth sits there nice, sweet and refreshing until the next sip.
Pours a brownish/orange color. Smell is of tropical fruits, hops. Taste is great, hops, fruits, a malt balance, a touch of bitterness. Overall this is a top notch beer worth seeking out.

Bottle from RobertDale - thanks.  Pours a shimmering golden/copper color with a modest white head.  Lots of sticky sheet lacing.  Nose is intese with ripe and pungent hops; citrus and piney.  Lots of grapefruit.  The taste is full of hops, as anticipated.  A very modest malty background provides no break from the rampant citrus and piney hops.  I wouldnt call it bitter either.  Just pure hop flavor.  Nicely done FFF, this beat the hype hands down.
Pours a clear dark orange with a nice white head. Aroma is tropical fruit, grass, and spice. Taste is very much the same. Smooth on the palate and has a nice bitter finish.

From a bottle shared by Ben at the Birch.  Super light colored, almost lager-like, this instantly draws you in with a simple, yet decidedly citric aroma.  We had fun trying to peg this one, with its relatively light body, yet assertive hoppiness.  Ends with a bit of a nice little peppery bite.  Freaking amazing beer!  Thanks, Ben!  (#4567, 4/12/2012)
bottle, dark orange pour dank, dense aroma, sweaty, buttery bitter with some metallic on the finish

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2015 Bottle from bu11zeyes 10K tasting.   Light pour with a white head.  Aroma is lots of tropical fruit, light caramel, and grain.  Taste is bitter, grassy, and more fruit.  Nice finish.

12 oz. bottle, pours a beautiful cloudy orange with a small white head. Very aromatic with floral hops, tropical fruits, and fresh orange peel. Flavour of loads of floral hops, piney hops and tropical fruits. Hovers between that ambiguous border of a pale ale and IPA. Finishes dry, tropical fruity, and somewhat florally. Beautiful pale ale.

On draft at Local Option in Chicago. Pours a clear amber/copper with frothy white head. Aroma is powerful citrus and resinous hops. Taste is very bitter with a bit of sweet balancing malt...but not much, its very hop forward which is the way I like it! Medium body, very crisp carbonation, finishes dry. Great pale ale, I could drink a few of these!

Draft: Poured a golden to light orange with white head. The aroma was citrus and hops. The taste was a full on piney hops taste bus attack, but left to a nice fruit finish. Glad I could enjoy a beer like this in on location.

Bottle.  Aroma has notes of tropical fruits, citrus of all kinds, catnip, grass, sweet caramel malts and flowers.  Crazy good aroma when fresh.  Best smelling American Pale Ale Ive had to date.  Medium hazy orange amber hue with an average off-white head that mostly diminished and left little lace.  Flavor is medium sweet and heavy/medium bitter.  Palate is medium bodied and oily soft with a shorter finish.  Overall a very impressive Pale ale.  Crazy good aroma and good to very good everywhere else.  Loved this one.

(22oz bottle)  Pours a clear golden body with a medium white head.  Aroma of herbs, grapefruit, and pineapple.  Flavor of grass, herbs, citrus, pineapple, grain, and grass with a dry, moderately bitter finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Sweet Christmas! As my estimable bartender Greg so aptly put it, "sometimes when I drink this I dont think I ever need to drink anything else." This stellar APA is really that good. Very handsome pale orange pour, with a gleam brought out by the carbonation and a silky head. Nose is terrific, brightly fruity and just a touch of sharpness (actually seems more complex than some Citra-forward beers). Bracing, lively mouthfeel. Taste is outrageously good, with pine, a trace of wood, all providing just enough of a bite to balance well with the citrus party. Grapefruit, melon, pineapple, but bitter hops all the way through. Absolutely terrific.

Pours a transparent dark honey, nice white head leaves great lacing. Aroma is tropical hop, pineapple, grapefruit, fleshy fruit, bright citrus and hop resin. Taste follows the tropical fruit in the nose, more citrus, very tasty. High carbonation, medium body. Awesome.
Absolutely love the aroma.  A bit hoppy, on the roof of my mouth.  golden, hazy.
12 ounce bottle.  Pours a clear copper with a large white head.  Wild aroma of citrus, tropicals, and malt.  Taste is citrus hops, caramel malt, pine, and lots of tropical fruits.  Outstanding!

Pours an amber orange with a white head and tropical aroma of citrus, pine, and hops. Taste is well balanced, of fresh hops, grapefruit, citrus, pine and malt with a nice, clean, bitter finish. Great tasting, drinkable brew and a great bottle and name to go along with it.

Pours hazy golden orange with a wispy head. Nose is all citrus including grapefruit, peaches, and orange and arguably one of the best noses for an APA. Taste is nothing but flavor, citrus bursting through with peaches, mangoes and grapefruit. Finish is sweet and somewhat long and delicious. Arguably one of the best American Pale Ales made. Quaff Score 9 /. 10

Good off white head, (almost) clear and dark gold to light amber. Strong aroma of pine and grapefruit. Soft sweet (malts?), but mostly hopbitter with pine and grapefruit again. Good body for 6,2 %. Would like to have some more of this.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2012 12oz bottle. Pours golden orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is of hops, pine, citrus, and floral notes, Definitely smells hoppy and tasty. Taste starts with a strong, but not overpowering hop taste. More sweet and juicy than bitter hops. There is also a lot of pine and citrus. Slight floral notes. The malt is buried underneath the hops flavor. Way too easty to drink. Definitely something I could drink on the regular.
Hazy, tan.  Chewyish nose with woody, citrusy notes.  Fruity, and bright up front, with herbal notes as well.  The malts are clean and balanced.  Earthy, bright, tasty APA.

A favorite of mine from Three Floyds and lets be honest, the art is killer. A hoppy beer with balanced overall flavor and a cloudy color that could trick one into thinking it may even leave a residue, a dust on the tongue.

33cl bottle @ tasting with Joes and Dutchdrebus. Courtesy of Joes. Clear golden color, full white head. Smell pine, pineapple, hops, fruityness. Taste hops, fruityness, bitter, citrus, pine. Medium body, medium carbonation. Very, very good beer!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 I originally reviewed this back on 03-31-2012 and gave it a 3.55. I believe the bottle was old as I got some oddly savory (pizza goldfish) flavors and aromas. Take two on a fresher bottle!

12 oz bottle into a 3F pint glass. This was picked up in early July. Reviewing on 7/16/2012.

A - Golden clear amber body. Splotchy one finger off-white head. Really small and tight bubbles. Great lacing and retention.

S - Very grapefruit and mango heavy with some caramel malts. There is also a savory and danky spice to the aroma. A bit of grass and earthiness in the finish. 

T - More of the grapefruit and mango hops with that dankiness. Some caramel malts and a bitter finish, although the bitterness quickly washes away. Really awesome blend of citrus and tropical flavors with a pleasant spicy earthiness. Mouth feel is medium to light with nice carbonation.

O - Probably the best pale ale Ive had, although I feel like 3F is stretching the category a bit as its pretty much an IPA. Having a fresh bottle certainly renewed my faith in the citra hop.

Nice hops aroma. Big malty backbone. Unlike a west coast ipa but pretty decent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Mike12da. Thanks. Big tropical fruit (mango) nose w/ a touch of earthiness. Dusky gold, with steady centered carbonation and thick lacing. Solid and fruity with a slight alc warmth. Tastes more like an IPA, really. Medium body. Even at a low alc level, this holds all the flavors together well. Easy and smooth. Could drink quite a few of these without tiring of it.

Bottle shared by Mike12da. Lovely nose of tropical fruit, like papaya, pine, grass. Subtle and beautiful. Pretty deep honey gold color with a low head. Sweet and fruity flavor, mango, orange, pepper, pine. Smooth, with low alcohol presence. Oily palate. Nicely bitter finish. Nose outshines the flavor a bit.

I dont usually go for pale ales but with the hype surrounding Zombie Dust, I gave it a try. This is great for this style. Its like a light and crisp IPA with a beautiful undertone of luscious fruit. I would make this a regular session beer if I had better access to it. For now Im content with the occasional 4-pack. Great brew overall.

Clear nectarine-gold pour with a thin, lacy white heady.  Citrus, mango funk, melon, pineapple, and some spicy garden roots in the nose.  I know this is all about the hops, but the malt presence is too light for my personal taste preference.  Some light crackery malt shows up mid-late, as does a twinge of alcohol.  Medium body, average carb, with a lasting grassy bitterness in the finish.  Good beer, quite drinkable, and I can definitely see why people love it.  The nose is great, but is overall just too lean in substance/flavor for me to get much more excited than a mid-three score.

Lightly sweet caramel under layers of hops stone fruits... Amazing aroma for a pale... Unmistakably a pale ale with intense aroma... Lively medium bodied dry finish... Grassy flavors mingle with fruity flavors with a light light note of the sweetness from the aroma.... An excellent pale... Clear pale amber with a lingering retentive head ... Lacing for days...
Had it on tap at berwery just amazing... If you can have it on tap def. try it........

Another great looking bottle by 3F. Pale yellow to orange colour with a big white head. Smells hoppy, fruity, very fresh, pine, orange peel, great! Tastes very bitter, refreshing, fruity, complex., hoppy. Close to perfect. Great carbo, full fresh body, long after.
Bottle thx to my bro...pours orange. Taste is smooth pine citrus gapefruit...perfect hopps. Definatly in my top 5 fav ipa,s

12oz bottle from 3F brewpub during their destruction phase. Pour is wonderful, nose is just out of this freaking world.. taste is pure bliss.. only thing preventing this from being higher is palate, a little thin.. but the drinkability and taste makes me want to bathe in this.. repeatedly

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2013 Bottle. Couldnt wait to try this pale ale from 3F. Poured a hazy, lively carbs, copper color. Massive white head, lacing had strong retention. Aromas were very impressive wit tangerine, pineapple, grapefruit, pine, and seashore coming through. Taste is fruity citra hops, tangy and resinous pine, butter oak, ocean salt. Complex and refreshing pale ale. Alpha king is great but this is more my style.

A - Pours a fairly clear golden-orange color with a finger of frothy white head. The head fades down at a normal pace leaving behind some lace.

S - Aroma is full of citrus hops with lots of grapefruit, orange peel, and some tropical fruits. There is also some sweet caramel malt and a bit of biscuit.

T - Starts off with some grapefruit and orange peel hops with some bitterness and some sweet caramel malts in the background. Through the middle some pineapple and mango comes through with some more bitterness and some biscuit malt. The finish is a mix of citrus hops, bit of pine hops resin, good bitterness, and a bit of sweet malt.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a dry and bitter finish.

D - Very drinkable. Really great hop profile for an APA. The citrus flavors are nice and strong throughout and have some good complexity.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with thin, creamy white head; decent retention and spare lacing. Aroma is floral hops, citrus fruit, cereal and caramel malt, and light spice. Flavor is balanced hops, malt, and fruit esters; sweet, hoppy finish. Medium body, carbonation, and warmth.

Bottle.  Pours clear amber with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy fragrant floral and citrus hops, orange zest, key lime, tropical fruity esters and biscuit malt.  Flavor is heavy hops, light bitterness, supporting malt, fruity esters and a dry finish.  Medium-light body, low warmth, medium carbonation.

Had this gem on draft today before dinner at firkin. I'm sure the name comes from the smell, of which I love both!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Pours out a clear, deep golden-hued body with a full-sized, foamy, near white head.

Smell: A big burst of raw citrus peelings, resins, and snappy floral hop notes atop a modest layering of unsalted crackers and untoasted bread.

Taste: Crackery, bready malt base lightly brushed with a thin coating of sweet simple syrup. Fresh-cut lemon peel, resinous resins, and fresh, inviting floral hop tastes. Plenty bitter, though not heinously bitterness. Drying at the close with some lingering resinous traces.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Overall: A winsome hop character for a very nice APA.

Bottle. Pours a golden orange color with a white head. Aroma is super fruity and not too hoppy to be in IPA territory, I get lots of the citra hops, sweet orange, mandarin, peach, tropical fruits like mango and passion fruit. The flavor follows the nose lots of fresh hop juice, I get the tropical fruit flavors of mango and passion fruit, peach, mandarin, sweet orange, grapefruit, pine and some subtle sweet malt. The body is on the lighter side of medium with a dry mouth feel. Overall an outstanding APA, probably the best I have ever had, and I like how it doesnt branch in to IPA territory.
Draught at The Publican (A lovely restaurent in Chicago). Clear amber - offwhite head. Nice super fresh hoppy. Dryness. Grassy. Citrus. Hashish. Medium malty. Nice bitterness. High high drinkability.

Bottle thanks to Shawn, thanks man!  Pour is slightly hazy deep copper with a medium white head. Aroma us loaded with citrus hops, notes of mango, passion fruit, faint resin hops, and a light sweet malt backbone. Smells awesome. Flavor is a bit more resinous than aroma but citrus is still the showpiece. Very bright and tasty. Excellent.

In short: A kick-ass, straightforward and semi-dry fruity pale ale.  Fantastically drinkable.
How: Bottle 12oz.  Consumed fresh a few days after receiving it from sarro, thanks a lot Kyle
The look: Partly cloudy golden-orange topped by a large white head with medium retention
In long: The inviting and bright nose is full of tropical fruits with citrusy and piney notes.  This beer is said to showcase Citra hops from the Yakima Valley, however this is not the type of nose Im used to get from a Citra hopped beer.  Taste has very crisp malt backbone, very crackery, solid in structure but also discreet in flavor leaving the spotlight on the hopping.  Grapefruity, tropical fruits, lemony, a bit piney.  Bitterness level is mild-medium and the finish is rather dry.  For once this highly rated APA is not an IPA in disguise, this is truly a pale ale, and this is one I would drink gallons of.  If youre looking for originality look elsewhere, this is a straightforward thirst pale ale and a pretty damn good one.  Very addictive beer named after the street name (Zombie Dust) of a cocaine base drug, I have a lot of experience with street drugs and my favorite shape is blue.

Pours a clear yellow/gold with a medium white head.  Aroma is loaded with apricot and stonefruits...just a touch of spice...pungent!  Flavor follows suit and adds some grapefruit...great bitterness.  Mouthfeel is light and lively with a bitter, hoppy finish...dry and lingering.  Wow.

I picked up a case of this fresh off the bottling line,  When fresh this might be the best IPA out there.  My rating reflects the fresh stuff.  Kknock a point off for month old stuff.  Bottle into Snifter.  Golden slightly orange color.  Huge citrius aroma, lots of pineapple, mango, orange, apricot and grapefruit.  Tast is largely the same with a nice solid piney hop finish.  Amazing fantastic beer.

Now that the beer is about a month old, most of that fantastic citrius taste has does off. there is a bit of grapefruit still in there, but now has a much stronger bitter hop taste to it.  Still pretty good but nowhere near as good as when it was fresh,

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2012 12 ounce bottle into pint glass, no bottle dating. Pours slightly hazy golden orange color with a nice 2 finger off white head with nice retention that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Some decent lacing on the glass. Aromas of huge mango, pineapple, grapefruit, tangerine, light pine, floral, herbal spiciness, and apricot. Fantastic aromas here as expected from one of my favorite hops. Taste of big pine, pineapple, mango, tangerine, grapefruit, and herbal spiciness. Nice amount of spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, pine, herbal, and tropical fruit for a bit. Great malt balance makes this extremely drinkable. Medium carbonation and body; with a nice slightly creamy and very smooth mouthfeel. No alcohol noticed at all in the taste or finish. Overall this is an mind blowing pale ale. Tons of great hop flavor and balance. You would think this was an IPA.

Bottle pour.  Pours clear yellow with white head.  Aroma is citrus hops.  Taste is citrus hops and mild malt sweetness.  I believe this would have been much better fresh, a little past its prime when I tried it.

On tap at Hunahpus Day 2012. Insane drinkability and very smooth. A great balance from a single hop that made me want to come back for more. I would love to be able to turn this into my regular go to session... but alas...

Poured from 12oz bottle.  Pours a nice straw color with loads of thick creamy head that clings to the glass.  Aroma is mild citra hops and some floral aromatic.  Taste is a bit of citra.  Decent beer.  Similar in some ways to Hoppy Birthday from ABC.

Bottle from latest Jaschais trade. This is the freshest version of this beer I've had. Aroma is stronger than the flavor of the aromatic and tropical citra hops, but only slightly. An amazingly light yet full-tasting pale ale with an amazingly clean palate. Great beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

My Bottom Line:
An explosive citrusy, tropical hop bouquet envelops this brews light sugars for a linear, but highly engaging hop quencher. 

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the misty pale amber.
-The soft mouthfeel makes this brew feel light even though its 6%.
-Even the finish is dominantly citrusy. Some delicate resins appear here and there, but
-The malt sugars taste lke simple icing at times. Malts dont contribute much else in the way of flavor
-The hop profile is overtly citrusy that it might seriously displease those who dont like fruity Pale Ales.

Bottle. Thx Eric !

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 On tap, I had 2 just to make sure the hype was real. It wasnt. A great beer and I like citra hops but not overwhelmingly amazing. Still drinks like crack juice though.

In bottle it is better, I will up the rating.

And have had this multiple times recently. It just inst spectacular.


Another bottle, dated at 2 weeks... This beer has had to gone thorugh a recipe change.
Bottle at James "Im a bro again" party.  Super hoppy and piney, citrus.. Top in style.  Surprised not ipa

Pours light orange with lots of bubbles and thin white lacing. Average citrus hoppy aroma and a great taste, subtle hops with citrus and malty, honey undertones. If you like APA/IPAs, you will definitely enjoy this one.

Style et résumé: American Pale Ale houblonnée au Citra. 
Comment: Bouteille de 330ml. Merci Patrick. Létiquette est magnifique. 
Description: Bière blonde dorée avec une mousse blanche. Le nez est agréable avec un heureux mélange dagrumes et de conifère. La texture incroyable, elle est ronde. Les houblons sont gouteux. Le caramel est absent, encore une bière qui nabuse pas des malts de spécialités. La finale offre une superbe amertume. 
Note: 8/10

Tasted on tap at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, Illinois.  Pours a dark gold.  Aroma is very citrusy.  Overall taste is excellent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells like an IPA, looks like an IPA, tastes like an IPA. Standard and nothing special. Hoppy, hoppy, and more hoppy with a malt that doesnt stand up. If it was about 30% cheaper, it MIGHT be a good buy.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thanks to Matt for the bottle!  First time having this since it was bottled.  Poured into a Portsmouth tulip.  Clear, reddish-orange body with a little over one fingers worth of foamy white head.  Good lacing.  Malty grapefruit-candy on the nose.  Orange zest.  Nice use of Citra hops.  The flavor consists of a crispy caramel malt backbone, which supports a nice mixture of dry orange wedge, orange pith and leafy hop juice.  Body is malty up front, but clean and hoppy on the finish.  Good carbonation.  Overall, this is an excellent APA and definitely deserves its top 10 ranking for the style.  I remember this being slightly better when I last had it, but that was from a super fresh growler.  Still highly recommended.

Une bière à la robe orangée et voilée.  Une tête convenable.  Une fine dentelle.  Un nez très parfumé par le houblon Citra qui semble bien vouloir développer une belle complexité.  Il y a un aspect floral (fleurs et aiguilles de pin) qui perce les narines.  Il y a des fruits tropicaux qui sinvitent et qui prennent de plus en plus de place.  Il y a une base maltée qui exhibe ses parfums mielleux.  Il y a un équilibre qui commande le respect.  Au goût, il y a un liquide qui développe des saveurs qui sont franches et expressives.  Il y a un sucré des malts qui est bien dosé.  Et surtout, il y a un houblon qui étale un profil aromatique et amérisant qui impressionne.  De bonnes notes citronnées et florales qui sétendent sur mes papilles pour y rester longuement.  Il y a une impression qui est laissée par le liquide et qui est très belle.  Il y a un corps qui est bien proportionné.  Il y a un pétillement qui reste soutenu et poli.  Il y a une texture qui est agréablement huileuse.  Et puis, comme le dernier acte de la réussite, il y a des saveurs qui sont à lavant-plan et des notes amères qui voyagent avec élégance.  Merci à Martin pour cette bouteille plus que fraîche.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2015 Bottle shared at RBWG 2012. Pours a cloudy orange with small quickly diminishing white head. The aroma is a floral hop and grass. Thin mouthfeel, juicy hop, tropical fruit, crushable, really enjoyed this.

From notes.  First reviewed 6/21/2011.  Served on tap at Northdown in a pint glass.

The pint glass is full of a slightly hazy, full colored brew. Tangerine, gold, and orange colors all make their presence known. A smooth white cap glosses the top of the beer, preserving the aromatic qualities of the Citra hop.

Sweet pale malt and a full dose of citrus - sweet juicy pineapple, lots of grapefruit, and some mango hoppiness. Fairly simple, yet a wonderful nose. Slightly pungent on the back end.

The light malt sweetness up front is pleasant and sets the stage for the hops to come through. Juicy pineapple, grapefruit, and mango emerge from the huge burst of tropical and citrus flavors. The great flavor makes me hardly notice the bitterness. The finish is fairly clean, with some residual bitterness.

This has a very balanced mouthfeel - light enough to be dangerously drinkable, but with enough body to give the hops a platform to operate. Smooth, creamy, and medium carbonated.

Citra is simply a fantastic hop, and there is not a brewery out there I trust to make a great hoppy beer with a fantastic mouthfeel. Right now I feel very fortunate that I am able to drink this on tap.


From notes.  Reviewed 11/8/2011 on cask.  Gravity pour out of a fresh cask at Fountainhead in a pint glass.

Zombie Dust arrives in a pint glass with a beautiful cask pour; a lightly hazy, mostly clear golden tangerine color with a rocky off-white rocky froth casually resting on top, an obvious reminder of the serving type. 

The aroma is a little bit muted compared to the bottle or tap versions, but it is still full of hoppy goodness. The pale malts give a soft sweet and bready back, with aromatic mango, pineapple, and grapefruit hops shining through.

Somehow, the flavor is even better than the regular tap version. Softly sweet bread and light grains cannot contain a sweet, juicy hop explosion that builds, peaks, and finishes without a single wasted IBU. The mango, pineapple, and papaya flavors work well with the sweetness, with a flash of tart and bitter grapefruit kick near the end. The most amazing thing is just how smooth this flavor is.

The carbonation is obviously on the very light side, there is just enough to excite the taste buds. A hop bitterness leaves a bit of hop residue behind my lips, and the overall sensation is creamy and smooth.

As a hophead, I love any version of this beer. It is even better on cask, and I am slowly realizing I might be a cask IPA fanatic.

Bright golden pour with a small white head.  Left some spotty lace.  Aroma was in classic FFF fashion, juicy citrus jumped out of the glass.  Dry hopped to the gills, smelled fantastic.  Flavors were also filled with citrus fruits, lightly bitter with a grapefruitiness that lingered.  Very drinkable, this thing dripped with hop oils.  I really enjoy well done single hopped IPAs, really lets you know what to expect from a hop.  This was well done.

Cant believe I havent rated this yet. Yep, its a good beer. Typical 3F: hoppy with some malt balancing out. Surprisingly easy to drink a six or more of this in a night. Smooth, a bit bubbly, clear. Worth picking up.

[4263-20120120] 12floz bottle. Sweaty orange flesh hops aroma has a touch of tangerine and grapefruit. Slightly hazy, light orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy off-white head with a bit of lacing. Bitter lemon-tangerine-grapefruit hops flavour has a nice sweaty citrus base. Medium body is pretty bitter. Tasty, can stave off dead bodies, good. (8-/4/7/4/16) 3.9
(w/ jerc, JoeMcPhee, Radek Kliber)
Overheard: "Needs more dead."

Color is light straw and hazy. The head is poured with about a quarter inch of white foam. The aroma is full of spicy hops with a dash of citrus. The taste has honeydew and cucumber, with a nice bitter piney finish. The mouthfeel is light with some nice crisp carbonation.

on draft the aroma of citrus hops is prevelant in this beer. well balanced. for a single hopped beer this is very good. a golden color with a minimal head. the flavor is ver good. but the hops dissapate very quickly on the tongue. could drink more but this is good.

Bottled on: ?? (No bottle dating WTF)

Graciously given to me by Rochefort10nh, thanks man..

The appearance shows a nearly clear deep golden color with a frothy white head. Loads of lacing cling to the glass and tight rows of bubbles flow freely to the top.

Aroma is wonderful and full of citra hops followed by caramel malt and faint biscuit. Smells like a tropical buffett.

The taste is full of pineapple, grapefruit, lemon peel and a hint of caramel. Full of citra flavor but balanced nicely with sweetness. Very tastey, I could drink this all day.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied with a soft carbonation feel. Starts out smooth and creamy but in the end the true feel of bitter/dryness takes charge and begins its assault on the tastebuds.

Overall an excellant example of the style and one Im happy to review. My first experience with this beer was with Heady topper and Abner so my tastebuds were fried and didnt give it a fair shake. If you like citra hops, than this ones for you. Definitely one of my favorite APAs to date. Nice job!

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 Massive contribution du citra dans cette bière. Tangerine, pamplemousse, ananas avec un bon support malté non caramélisé. Bonne amertume en entré de bouche derrière une buvabilité effrayante. Autre tour de force de 3F.
Delicious. Im not a fan of hopped beers but this is just perfect. Its quite refreshing.

Acquired in a via Hombrepalo, cheers!

Pour is hazy, somewhere between amber and golden. Good carbonation, but the head goes away pretty fast. 

Smell is hoppy, good citrus flavors. Maybe a bit bready. 

Taste is almost limey, good hop presence but not overpowering in the least bit. Great balance. Bit of bread. 

Crisp, dry finish. Smooth and refreshing. Almost a bit smokey. Lingering aftertaste is great. 

Very well done, and Im very glad I got to try this.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2013 Bottle to pint. Looks good; pretty transparent for a FFF. A good amount of head and quite a bit of carbonation. Smells great; hops on hops on hops. Tastes good too (although its more like an IPA than a PA). Great on the palate. Overall, one of the best in its class.

Appearance: Persian Gold color. Eggshell white head, 1.5 fingers worth. Lacing is exception; outstanding retention.

Aroma: Blood orange sorbet. Citrus smell just explodes from the glass. Very slight bit of breadiness and not much pine. This is a blood orange, ripe pineapple bomb!

Taste: expertly balanced. The malty sweetness and the hop bitterness are so well balanced here. You really get the fruity, juicy hops. No alcohol. Slightly bitter, crisp finish.

Mouthfeel: Light/Medium body. Just a perfect amount of carbonation. 

Overall: Wow. I literally could drink this beer all day, every day. Three Floyds never disappoints. This one is just so drinkable. Perfect beer for warm weather. One of the best beers Ive ever had.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-23-2011 00:50:11
this is one of the best beers ive ever had in my life. It is the pinnacle of american Pale Ales.

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2016 Fresh bottle, 2 weeks from capping.

This beer has an amazing piney, citrus, skunk aroma. It smells like fresh hops.

The mouthfeel is medium and perfect.

The flavor is that of the quintessential pale ale. This beer is the new gold standard. A perfect citric bite mixes with a slightly sweet malt. The beer continues to coat your tongue and the hops literally dance on your tastebuds. The alcohol is invisible and it is dangerously refreshing.

Im the first to admit that I am a three floyds junkie but this is without a doubt one of the best beers I have ever had. 10/10
12 ounce bottle pour.  Orange color with a nice white head.  Citrus and pineapple aroma and taste.  Very drinkable and well balanced.

Draft. Easily the best pale ale Ive had, but Im not much of a pale ale fan.  The aroma is a spectacular beginning to the experience....very much citrus.  Pour was golden with a thick frothy head.  Hops very much present in the tastes...but not overly.  A real quality brew....cannot wait to get my hands on more.

12oz bottle thanks to Mar) Pour is golden yellow with about no head...Nose is Hops, pine, pineapple, grapefruit, field grass...Taste is heavy hops, and pineapple, Palate is slightly bitter and fresh..This is the best American pale i have ever had..wow

12oz shared by MartinT.
Appearance : Clear amber with medium foamy head. Lots of lacing.

Aroma : Big malt with big citrusy hops. Floral and fresh. Sweetish citrusy notes like in a lemon pie.

Taste : Big citrusy hops with big floral notes. Nice malt again. Finish is very citrusy and fairly lasting. Again that sweetish citrusy feeling. Not very resinous.

Overall : Very nice. A bit linear maybe because there seems to be only citra in there. The finish is mainly citrusy which is tasty but not as rich and deep as most of the top APA. Very drinkable and very well made. Id drink this often if I could.
Very amazing pale ale.  Clear orange pour.  Amazing grapefruit aroma. Aroma makes this beer.  Nice balance

Thanks to wimperoo for this.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with a small white top that ends as a rim around the glass.  Aroma is intense citrus hops and grapefruit.  Taste is again loads of grapefruit and citrus hops as the citra stands out as there is no doubt what style this beer represents.  Awesome,  I only wish I lived closer to 3 Floyds.

A murky orange appearance.  Aroma is very citrusy and pleasant.  The taste is mild upfront and last a little while through the back. Enjoyable pale ale for sure.  Lasts a little too long with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Really citrusy smell here. Love the aroma. Grapefruit and just a little bit of pineapple in there. Really crisp sweet and dry taste, almost champagne-esque. Really nice beer and hope to get some more in the near future.
Nice pale ale.  Clear orange pour.  1" soft head and good lacing.  Aroma of citrus (mostly grapefruit).  Good mouthfeel with a nice finishing bitterness.  Citra hop is outstanding.
Draft. Rich Os. Hazy orange, thin wispy head. Pineapple, citrus, somewhat grassy aroma. Grapefruit, bitter and dry finish.

Wow. One of the best smelling beers if not the best Ive ever smelled! The best APA I have had. Give it up for Three Floyds, man what an awesome brewery! Bought a six pack at the brewery and did a tour. I definitely understand why its one of the best breweries on the planet! Been looking forward to trying this beer for a while and it absolutely lived up to the hype!

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2014 36cl, no mention of ABV, new American brew Anno 2011, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, bitter/fruity and slightly malty, balanced, clear, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

Uber fresh 12oz bottle.  Cloudy honey colored pour with nice white head some retention and a little cling.  Nose is hops, peach, citrus, and floral notes  Taste has some nice front end bite and then a nice citrus taste in the middle with a small bite on the back.  Crisp and light on the palate.  Overall a great PA.  In the same league as Alpine Hoppy Birthday.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Zombie Dust pours dark amber orangish color.  Very little head is poured and not much lacing throughout the glass.

Right off the bat you know this is not your normal Pale Ale.  A unique and big smell for the style.  Citra says hello here.  Citrus smacks the nostril.  Other tropical fruits come in next with some floral notes and a biscuit malt backbone.  Let this one warm up a bit, then just sit there and take it in.  Its not super hoppy.  Its not super malty.  Its just right.

This beer pulls off a bit of a magic trick when it comes to the taste.  Up front is bitter citrus.  Then it melds into the tropical fruit and honey taste, then once again it does another trick and ends with a caramel and biscuit malt.  Its unique to any Pale Ale Ive had.  Its big and packed with flavor while being totally balanced along the way.  Lovely.

Mouthfeel is medium bodied and smooth.  Goes down perfectly.

12oz bottle. Thx Mr. Keats!  Pours a crisp golden hue, with a thin white lacey head.  Aromas of citrus and pine, Tastes citrusy sweet with a bit of resin from the hops.  Overall very delightful I just wish I could get my hands on this beer more often than just when me or a friend travel to Indiana.
Wow, crisp amber/gold with a thin cream colored head.  Tropical fruits, resin, uber fresh hops, melon, faint bitterness.  Fantastic on the palate, fresh hops, tropical fruits, great hop resin finish.
Pine, citrus (orange/grapefruit) and honey.  Vague hints of tropical fruit.  Medium bitter finish with a medium duration and a black pepper note.  Very good APA.

Pours golden yellow with a great foamy white head. Pine, grapefruit, mango, nice grass notes, caramel and lemon on the nose. Grapefruit, lemon, pine, orange, caramel, very smooth malt character with a great hop bite! Medium on the palate with a balanced malt and pine citrus finish.

I think it is close to Bells Hopslam, but without the hops after taste. It is also much less expensive than Hopslam, but availability can be an issue. I stopped by FFF last Friday and guys were lining up to buy cases of this stuff. I think it is great, but like Hopslam a little better.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bright orange. Aroma of light peach and hops, with hints of grapefruit. Tastes smooth, with lots of grapefruit. Backend citrus similar to eating a grapefruit. Despite all the citrus and fruit flavors though, it holds its pale ale name well, with an intriguing hoppy profile.

Bottle 355 ml  
 Aroma:   citrus , fresh clean cut, aromatic with friendly side. Hint of apricot, floral hop end.7+
 Appearance:  hazed, cloudy amber with bright white top. 3+.
 Palate / Taste:  medium bodied. Mild character, hint of mineral notes, grapefruit. Soft walls , smooth alcohol. Pleasant aromatic pale ale.

2012-01-19. Lightly hazy golden orange body with a modest foamy white head. 3+ Nice citrusy hop aroma with lots of grapefruit and grapefruit seeds, lemon drop candy, sweaty resin notes as you go on. 7+ Flavour is similar, grapefruit and lemon, sweaty resiny hops, grapefruit seeds linger in the finish. 7+ Smooth average to light body. Quite nice and enjoyable but I had high hopes for it to be even better than it is. Bottle via trade with flandersned

Bottle courtesy of jerc and mabel. Hazy golden pour. The aroma is loaded with white grapefruit, pineapple and loads of dank hop character.  The flavour is really juicy and fresh despite an odd sort of rotted fruit character in the aroma. There is a bit of soft juicy tropical fruit. Some apricot and a little bit of soft bitterness.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2015 bottle thanks to reynolds314. I love the citra hop here, the body has a touch of malt sweetness in it that is amazing. I like when the hops and malts blend perfectly. IPAs shouldnt really be all about the hops. Great job!
One of my new favorites. Smells and tastes fantastic. Lots of pine and citrus with just the right amount of hopiness. And the label is pretty badass too.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass

A.  Pours a beautiful orange color, almost the same as the McDonalds orange soda from when you were a kid.  Light foam head, about 1mm thick, settles to a light thin ring.

S.  Smells of sweet citrus, fine northern pine, and lots of orange peel

T.  Tastes of sweet orange peel, wonderful citrus and trangy fruit, with a hint of pine

M.  Medium body, slightly water, a little bit coarse with a nice light finish.

O.  This is a very good beer.  Tangy and sweet, not as much like a normal DIPA, but still very goo.  I would suggest everyone try this at least once.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2012 Pours a cloudy golden orange with off white head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of resin and grapefruit hops with a bit of the caramel malt backbone.  Taste and smell are mighty powerful for 6%.  Big grapefruit hops that are intense enough but nicely held back by the sweetness of the malts.  Superbly crafted brew and something I could take back 6 without thinking.

Big thanks to hellbilly for sharing. It pours gold with white head. The pulsing aroma is big and yummy with chewy sticky malt infused pineapple, grapefruit and orange juice. Smell just terrific. The taste doesnt reach the boldness attained in the nose. It is nice with grapefruit and pineapple notes sweetened by malts and then running into spicy hoppiness midway and into the finish. Nice citrus to spicy hopped brew where the hops are bridge by a modest level of sweet malts.

Bottle at home, on New Years Eve 2011/12. Massive thanks to phalesu, who rushed this one to me, so it was fresh! Pours cloudy orange, thin white head; lacing is spotty to good. Surprisingly small head, for a bottle that nearly gushed when opened, expected a thicker head. Regardless... Nose is spicy pine, with mandarin orange, tropical fruit, and nice grapefruit coming through underneath. Maybe not as over-the-top with the hops as I was expecting, considering the reputation of both the brewery, and the beer, but then this is my first hoppy 3Floyds brew, so Im in new territory here. Flavours are DOMINATINGLY mandarin orange. This tastes just like eating a freaking mandarin orange. Its truly bizarre. The remainder of the palate, beyond the mandarin notes, is spicy, piney, and balanced, with nice bitterness that in no way keeps this beer from being sessionable. Very, very nice.

Bottle, thanks go a generous Secret Santa. Hazy golden pour, with some hop or yeast residue floating around. Decent head. Very nice citrusy, piney aroma, also some pineapple and melon.
Smooth, creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. 
Taste is orange and citrusy hops, melon, shortbread. Smooth, bitterness on the low side, a bit abrupt finish. A great pale ale.
Pour is a yellowish gold color with a small white head. Nose is of citrus and grass for the most part. Taste is pretty much all hops, though nothing overpowering, still rather light and refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a nice Orangeish golden color. The aroma is big citrus, grapefruit. Just fantastic! The taste is a perfect bitterness up front with big citrus flavors. The back end has a perfectly balanced maltyness to smooth it all out. Just a perfect example of a Pale Ale. If it was a blind taste test, I would have thought it was IPA. Fing great beer.

Good beer but heavy in the grapefruit department. Poured with a huge foamy, frothy, off white head that lasted a while and lots of lace. Color is a slightly hazy amber. Aroma is hop, malt, fresh cut grass, wet grain. caramel. Flavors the same along with carbonic tang that accents the hop. Finish is like flavor, has lots of length, and is satisfying. Good stuff.

Auction.

Hazed / golden pour with aromas of citrus, grassy hop. A nice crisp hoppy and citrus taste. A well -balanced brew.
Bottle @ cdc b5. Thanks! Golden pour with some light tan head. Citrus and grassy aroma tones. Flavor is full hop, not overally heavy, citrus, grass, earthy fresh tones.

12oz bottle .. . Pours a deep yellow gold .. medium foam .. great lacing .. . lots of flowers, citrus, and fresh pine .. . clean mouth .. . a great assertive pale .. . . If trees could scream, would we be so cavalier about cutting them down? We might, if they screamed all the time, for no good reason..

bottle thanks to secret santa poured a light amber in color with a thin covering of off white head. aroma has citrus, pines, caramel malt, and some resins. mouth feel coats well and there is good carbonation to push this across. flavor has medium bitterness, citrus, some caramel malt, and a finish that is good and drying. an ipa. in my eyes and certainly showcases the hops well but does not get juicy like I had hoped.

Bottle via kbutler1, thanks for this awesome extra! Pours an orange to dark orange with a small white head.  Aroma is citrus, more on the orange side than lemon or grapefruit.  This stuff smells like heaven.  Taste is off the charts for a pale ale.  Crisp hops with more balanced malt/bitterness.  Some more orange/citrus notes and just an awesome beer to drink.  How I wish I could have access to this stuff off the shelf and fresh.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Bottled sample via oakbluff. Dark gold in colour with fairly strong carbonation. Aromas are of orange, sour peach, and grass, along with both grainy pale and light caramel mats. The hops translate to more of a white grapefruit and green grape combo in the mouth, backed my crispy pale malt. Medium to light bodied with a finish that is both bitter and grainy. An enjoyable pale ale, but not the total hop bomb I was expecting.

Bottle many thanks to ICEatALAMO.  Clear golden copper pour, with a nice foamy off-white head.  Beautiful hoppy, fruity nose.  Same nice hoppy flavor, pine, citrus, caramel, and sweet fruit.  Lightly grassy.  Light on the palate, very refreshing.  Very glad to try this!

Received in trade from phisigben, thanks for the opportunity. 
Pours a slightly cloudy golden color with a huge fluffy white head that displays great retention and lacing. Smells of citrus, pine and resin mostly with hints of green onion and garlic. If there is malt in here I cant find it. Taste is citrus, pine, resin, and green onion with maybe some bits of bready malt if I squint a bit. Long lingering onion hop bite in the finish. Medium to light body with a moderate level of carbonation with a sharp resinous mouthfeel. Im glad I got the opportunity to try this brew, but to call this a pale ale is quite a stretch, we could safely call this an IPA. That being said, this is a great IPA.

Bottle.... pours hazy golden with a large fluffy white head.... the aroma is loads of hops, citrus and grape.... the flavor is melon, grape, flowers and some perfume ..... very balanced ! :) very nice mouthfeel .... bitter and lots of flavors in the finish.......

Bottle. Thanks Kingcecil for sharing!! It pours hazy deep golden with a medium and steady creamy off white head. The aroma is first of all pine and citrus with some underlying peach and mango. The flavour is highly fruity and citrussy with notes of malt and pine. Long fruity hoppy finish. My kind of hoppy pale ale.

12oz. Bottle:  Got in trade from Phaleslu; THANKS Peter!  Aroma of hops, grass, citrus, pineapple, peach, apricot, hop oil, skunk, Citra hops, marijuana, and a hint of pale malt.  Poured amber/orange in color with a large, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is light to medium sweet and medium to heavily bitter.  Tastes of hops, pine, grass, citrus, hop oil, slight caramel, and a hint of malt.  Medium body.  Oily, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Medium sweet, medium to heavily bitter, hop, pine, citrus, hop oil, skunk finish is dry.

UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Draft at FFF way before all the hype.  Hazy, golden tan with a lacy off-white head.  Smooth, medium to full bodied.  Grainy solid hop tones, fresh and enjoyable.  Soapy hops, but an excellent balance with the malt.  Well done, well executed, but pretty straightforward and tame. 7-3-7-3-16

Just kept my brewpub rate here for shits and giggles.  This beer is awesome.  Always a treat.  12oz bottle.  Scooping up some fresh sixpacks from the brewery is always a treat.  Green onion, garlic, very earthy, zesty hops.  Fresh, clean, bold hop aroma.  Frothy off white head on top of a filtered orange-tan body.  On the fuller side of medium bodied, very drinkable.  Extra points for seriously raising the bar for American Pale Ale.

Big citra hop nose, juicy fruit, orange, grapefruit, light pale bready malts. Pours golden, nice head and lace. The flavor is citrusy and juicy, fresh orange, grapefruit, and juicy fruit gum. Light bready malt, a faint hint of sweetness. Smooth, juicy hop flavors round out the finish. Good shit!

Big big hop citrus hop flavour, orange and grapefruit.  Not quite a palate shredder, but definitely last beer for the night. A good showcase of citra hop which stands next to the Great Lakes Ontario use of citrus as a great citra showcase. 
Thanks Tim S. Big hop aromas.
Another awesome offering from 3 Floyds.  Very hoppy citrus aromas.  Pours a murky yellow with a small white head. Awesome hop flavors.  One of the best pales Ive had.

Bottle from Jer & Karen.  Thanks!  Shared with Mike.  Hazy light orange body, frothy white head.  Nose is pink grapefruit juice, grapefruit pulp, lemony hops.  Flavor is grapefruit juice, a bit of coconut, some alcohol bite.  A bit of malt comes forward to sweeten up the finish.  Reminds me of a super fresh Lagunitas New Dogtown Pale Ale.  Amazing that the Citra here presents as grapefruit.

12 oz bottle courtesy of Wnoble. Pours a hazy orange gold color with a 2 finger white head that leaves rings of soapy lace.  Clean citrus hop aroma. Not overwhelming and not to weak. Just right. Flavor is dominated by citrus as well. Oranges, pineapple and grapefruit. What I loved about it is it wasnt trying to hit me over the head with hops. Very drinkable. This brew was delicious.
bottle shared with Rudolf. golden orange pour, grapefruit rinds, citrusy, tropical fruit notes, sun tan lotion, coconut, lots of flavor & bitterness, pretty big APA. well done

(12oz bottle courtesy of zathrus13!).  Pours a clear copper color with frothy off-white head and nice carbonation.  Aroma has lots of tropical fruits like mango, papaya, along with some resinous notes.  Taste is sweet malts with bright, refreshing tropical hops.  Bitter with some spiciness.  Medium bodied with a slick texture.  Dry, bitter finish.  Absolutely delicious.  The first hoppy beer that made me momentarily forget my first experience with Alpine Nelson.

12 oz bottle.  Thanks to Dan from Pinocchios for this freebie.  Clear orange brown with a white head.  Nose is toffee, grass, marijuana and grapefruit pith.  Crisp and resiny medium body with zippy carb.  Taste is catty hops, grapefruit juice and lime zest.  A wonderful bitter citrus amalgam with hints of mary jane.  Very good but not quite the King.

Thanks to GT2 for the bottle! Classic amber pour. Nose holds spruce, grass, grapefruit, cedar, hemlock, and lemon zest. The falvor is a bit more restrained, but drinks wonderfully with increased notes of pot and manure. Soft palate. Damn good.

Bottle, courtesy GT2, thanks man! Pours a clear golden orange with a massive white head, good retention/some lacing. Aroms of melon, citrus, floral hops, light biscuit. Taste is melon citrus/hops, caramel, biscuit, light pepper. Palate is soft, creamy, moderately bitter finish. Excellent.

I received a 12oz bottle in a trade with a friend in Chicago (thanks, Rob!).

Appearance: Hazy apricot-skin orange hue. Forms a large, soapy, white head which retains and laces very well.

Smell: Pure tropical fruit juice: orange, passion fruit, guava, pineapple. Extremely appetizing and inviting.

Taste: Its a beer like Zombie Dust that reminds me why I love hoppy beers so much. This is a palate full of delicious flavor combinations of juicy sweetness and hop bitterness. It begins with a lightly sharp, slightly dry hop bitterness. Then the palate opens up its juicy core and unleashes a cornucopia of tropical fruit and citrus. Not as tart and acidic as many West Coast IPAs, but does have the same amount of authentic juice flavors. Yet its not sticky, sappy, or syrupy either. From what I understand its a single-hop brew using the Citra variety and if thats the case I think the hop definitely lives up to its name. Absolutely delectable palate with the bitterness to match but nothing absurd. 

Mouthfeel: Medium in weight, but full in flavor - theres not a moment where youre not tasting something. Lightly dry bitterness in the aftertaste, but extremely tolerable.

Drinkability: Since I cant get Zombie Dust easily I had to restrain myself from guzzling it down. It has the perfect combination of a tasty, refreshing palate with a comfortable mouthfeel and smooth finish to match. At 6.2% ABV it would seem to be more accurately classified as a single IPA rather than just a pale ale, but thats for the beer nerds to sort out. This is a perfect companion for a spicy meal, but works wonderfully as a dessert beer too (you could make a sorbet out of this).

Intensely floral nose, lilly, marigold, fresh cut grass with peach undertones. Clear amber, medium yellow head with little retention. Strong but less intense and more simplistic flavor of marigold, leafy. Pleasantly bitter. Medium body, sessionable, full flavored. There are many different hop preferences, but this is what an APA should be. Exemplary.
Bottle courtesy of GT2, thanks!  Bright golden color, small white head.  Aroma of bright pine.  Taste is pine branches, hay, white pepper.  Nice stuff.

Bottle thanks Greg (DalzAle)!  Pours hazy amber with a soapy off white head that fades to a foamy film. Aroma is piney spruce and grapefruit with a mild caramel in the background. Taste is awesome resinous bitter piney grapefruit hops with a smooth sweet caramel finish that is very subtle. Palate is medium and awesome with a dry bitter finish. Please let me have more!

UPDATED: APR 3, 2012 From the 12/2011 3R6P tasting. I had good hopes for this one but it really did very little for me. +++ Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a dark amber color with a small white head that faded quickly and left no lacing. The aroma was dryish catbox with a hint of spice and pine. The flavor was dryish pine, resin, catbox, mint and faint caramel. The finish was long, dry, piney and resiny. Medium body. Disappointing.

Thanks GT2! This beer rocks! Lots of citrus and pine in the nose, leading to dank floral herbaceous hop pungency. Great balance of hop facets with a super clean malt character makes for a hop-bomb phenomenon.

poured from a 12 oz bottle into a snifter.

A:  Nice thick white 2 finger head.  Good lacing.  Beautiful golden honey/orange body with good carbonization.

S:  Really pungent floral hoppyness.


T:  Malty sweetness upfront followed by a nice hop bitterness that lingers on the tongue.  Each sip has a nice dry finish.  Delicious.

Great pale ale that seems more along the lines of a IPA.

Bottle as an extra in a trade.  Pours a clear golden orange with a medium sized white head.  Big bright hops on the nose, spicy citrus, earthy malt.  Cool and clean, spicy malt and hops, thins out a bit flavorwise, but still tasty throughout.  Long earthy bitterness on the finish.  Nice easy drinking pale ale.  Quite tasty.

Big thanks to Jim for this bottle.

Pours clear bubbly amber with a small creamy beige head that recedes to a thin collar.  not much lacing.

Whoa, this thing packs a serious punch in the nose with grapefruit, pine resin, lemongrass, pineapple.  Some light biscuity malts as well.  Without a doubt, the best nose Ive come across in a pale ale.

Taste doesnt quite match the standard set by the nose but its still great.  The initial taste is juicy citrus with grapefruit and floral pine and grass - really showcases the Citra hops.  There is a light bready malt in the background but the taste is all about the hops which leave a tangy bitterness in the finish.

The mouthfeel is light, well carbonated and really crisp and clean.

This is probably the best APA Ive tasted.  The Citra hops are certainly the dominant player and it works really well.  Excellent beer.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 355mL thanks to vw73182. Bottle release from the XV anniversary party. About two weeks old. Pours a clear amber orange with a towering, massive, rocky, off-white head. Sheen appearance with ridiculously insane, webby lace. Big sheets of complete lacing. Nose is huge orange juice, ultra dank mango, pineapple, mild sweet onion, pineapple flavored alcohol. My girlfriend thinks it smells like caramelized onions with meat...not necessarily bad. It certainly is not just a citrus/floral hop aroma. I would place the nose more at something like tamarind or other meaty Asian fruit we are not as familiar with. As it warms it gains more starchy character and sweet potatoes. In general, the nose starts off explosive and mellow out so no reason I see to let this decant like most beers. Taste has a nice biscuity quality to stave off astringency. Huge orange juice, ultra quenching malt character, with mild pineapple like alcohol and meaty fruits like jackfruit and durian. Very soft biscuity, quenching mouthfeel with decent amounts of butterscotch richness I get from Sculpin, Duet, and Alesmith IPA. Hot damn this is good. Ive now had about three bottles of this over the past few days and the palate gets super quenching, small orange juice acidity, citrus fruitiness. Whoa. Like APA category demolition right here. Forget about topping this ever. Well, maybe fresh Spring Peeper. Perhaps a little boozy for the style but who cares. Would be dangerous as a session beer.

12 oz. bottle poured into a New Belgium glass.  A moderately aggressive pour yielded a dark, golden brew with a 2-inch white head which lasted.  Lacing was spotty but lasted throughout. The nose was the resinous and the lemony, hop-centered smell you would expect from the citra. The taste was dry, lemon, orange and mango, grassiness, pine but there were tones of some nice malt notes and grain as well.  I loved the healthy carbonation and some nice bitterness at the back end. The mouthfeel was medium to light.  What a wonderful surprise this beer was.  I just wish I could get more!

awesome brew from FFF.  I have had a lot of it in the past month and it keeps getting better.  Smells of citrus, taste is not too hoppy, and it goes down very smoothly.  Very well balanced beer in my opinion.  Its like Gumballhead on steroids

Bottle - This is an intensely hopped pale ale. It pours a copper orangish color and has a nice sticky white head. The Citrus and tropical fruit flavor is great. Flavor is crisp and not bitter. This is a great Pale Ale and possibly the  best FFF brews.

Golden orange hue, acceptable head.  Almost pure pineapple in the aroma. Lively carbonation followed by tropical citrus flavor and a hint of grain, finishing with an aggressive bitterness.  It feels just a BIT one dimensional; I think it could benefit from a touch more maltiness to balance the bitterness and give the finish a little more depth.  Overall though, a great showcase for Citra hops; its easy to overdo it with Citra and end up with a beer that tastes like gummy bears.  They have managed to squeeze the perfect amount of flavor from it to keep that under control.
Very smooth, easy drinking pale, citrusy boys, but not crazy bitter, foldable pigs find wheat, buttery grits . Sweet, light malt, but still present hops.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 On tap in a lager glass.  Pours golden/amber with a lacy, off-white head.  Aroma of strong citrusy hops, caramel malts, and some spiciness.  Flavor about the same.  Average texture.  A really good beer.
Edit: 12oz bottle in 2013.  Way more hops than I remember.

Brilliant bonus from kmyers8807!! Awesome copper/orangish pour. Nice sticky white head.  Citrus and tropical fruit nose is gorgeous. Flavor is so crisp, awesome fresh hops, grapefruit, guava, light honey. Damn folks--THIS is a pale ale!

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2011 Draft at hop leaf. Transparent honey with heavy white lacing all over glass, head remains. Nose is insanely fruity, grapefruit and pineapple all over, bit dusty and doughy with warmth but ultra bright. Resinous flavor shows light pine and bubblegum though sweetness kept low, more dough, sticky but lighter body through the finish where higher carbonation keeps things lively. Shit this is good stuff, arguably best FFF beer Ive probably had.

Bottle to tulip. Bottle courtesy of claaark13. Fantastic aroma. Great citrus smell. Heavy on grapefruit and orange. Light amber orange color with a large white head. Fantastic pour. Has a sweetness to it and a perfect bitterness. 

This may be one of my favorite beers. I love this beer. This OS what an APA should taste like.

A couple of 12oz bottles thanks to Matt! Amber with a thin biege head. Light citrus, bark, earthy, malt, peach, pineapple - hops are nicely balanced, not overwhelming and well nuanced. Nice carbonation and average body, prickly on the palate but not boozy, some sweetness but the bitterness quickly overwhelms, a nice soapy solid feeling develops, becomes dry, little bit of brown sugar, malt comes through, quite nice. Like the lower alcohol offerings from FFF.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 Since the last time I had this or at least my last notation, my thoughts on this beer have gotten much better. The green earth notes have a great pop and resin without being overpowering. Still light body and easy drinking. I solidly dig it. 

Original rating
Bottle from phaleslu. Pours a pure straw color, lightly hazy, and clean. Small head which doesnt hold for long. Aroma holds good hop character, with, citrus, orange peel, light straw qualities, and a light, very mild sweetness. Flavor is amazing, great hop character, citrus notes, really enjoyable. Body was thin, as expected with a hazy light lacing on the glass. Overall, a very enjoyable pale 20112011

12oz bottle poured into snifter. Great hoppy floral aroma with light hints of honey and citrus. Flavor is well balanced between the hops and malts, which are more prevalent on the back end. Great showing here.

Wow... pours a hazy mud orange-straw into the glass, with a thin ring of suds to lace the glass.  The aromas are incredible, a floral-pine extravaganza. It permeates perfectly the flavors: a piney citrus upfront with a clean bitter back palate.  The finish is crisp, but lingering... a brightly aerated pine bitter.  The mouthfeel is substantive and diversely complex, but the quaff is exquisitely drinkable, not too heavy.  3 Floyds does the APA like no one else, seriously.
Wow. Killer aroma. Citrus, pine, and very floral. Pours a small head almost pure white, light orangish yellow n color. Huge hop flavor, same as aroma. Solid malt backdrop. Very impressive.

Bottle from Greg, thanks!  Pour is a clear light gold, decent white head, OK lacing.  Aroma is huge citrus.  Can place the hop variety like no other PA I have had.  Amazing citrus hop flavor, light straw malt.  Very, very nice.
On tap at Beer Geeks. Wow, now I know what all the hype is about.The smells coming off this beer is heavenly. Taste is a close second. =)

Bottle, thanks Tim. Pours gold/orange, with a white head. Aroma is citrusy hops, along with some fruit and malt. Flavor is citrus, tropical fruit, and malt. 
Medium to light body. Starts a little sweet, and ends a little bitter.

Pours a clear deep golden orange with a light tan head and some large bubbles sitting on top.  The nose has a light grain profile, a touch of doughy malt, citric bite and notes of mango.  The flavor follows the same path but a bit fruitier and more integrated.  The grain and dough malt balance pretty nicely on the assertive fruity hop flavors of citrus and other tropical fruits.  The bitterness is assertive but not overpowering on medium body with a clean semi dry finish.  Another solid hoppy offering from FFF, if only they could get sugars eaten in their stouts.

Aroma is outstanding. Pine, lemon, grapefruit, that are propelled by the Co2 yes. Simcoe and centinnial hops come to mind. Especially with the bitterness sticks to the tongue(tropical fruit, spruce, citrus) that suggest moderately high lvls of cohumolone aa %. Light malt sweetness that balances well and really showcases the all mighty hops! One of the greats.

This poured a darker yelow to orange color with a biege head. Aroma was just straight citra hops, lots of tangerines and peaches, with hardly any sign of malt.  Flavor was incredibly fruity, mainly tangerines, peaches and oranges, fairly bitter but not a tongue bruiser. Reminded me alot of a younger brother of Arctic Panzer Wolf because its so juicy. Great stuff!
12 oz bottle.  Pours a lightly hazed deep golden orange with a frothy white head, great lacing.  Big nose of dank hops and citrus fruits.  An epic Pale ale.

Yeow.... this beer does it for me. Havent had it from the bottle, can find it here and there at a few of my hot spots. The aroma is all citrus, grapefruit, orange, spices... its insane. The taste is delicious... it kind of reminds me of how Gumballhead used to taste (fruity, citrusy) when that beer was first introduced to the masses. Im probably wrong, but maybe Im not?

On tap at Prime Bar on Wacker in Chicago....several times.  Excellent.  Citrusy hops, so its one of my favorites.  It makes me think of a toned-down Arctic Panzer Wolf (another one of my favorites).  If its available near you, go get some NOW.

Bottle, generously supplied in trade by my man pantanap! To be honest, I had never heard of this one from FFF until I opened up Kans box a few weeks ago. I guess it shows Im not into the beer game as I was back in 07. Gotta get my geek back. The beer: well holy shit this might be the best pale ale Ive ever graced my taste buds with. Fantastic citrusy aroma with herbal pepper, lemon and grapefruit character. The flavor, while straightforward and uncompromising, is a blissful experience of the Citra. Super clean on each sip, I dont think a beer could be more crisp than this. Imagine a honeycrisp apple infused with grapefruit and lemon juice with tons o hops. Not to mention the kickass label to boot. Kan, I need cases of this. Name your price.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2013 Recent review: 17FEB12, 3/4.5/4/3.5/4 (4)
Okay, Im gonna give this another fair and balanced review:
Bottled: recently Im assured
Pours a golden ale with a finger of off white soapy foam that falls to a broken sheet of the same leaving some spotty lace. I am reserved about smelling....Alas, the smell I remember, lemony, citrusy zest and a hint of peach. So nice. Flavor follows suit with just a hint of alcoholic sharpness. Finish is sweet and juicy. Medium on thin with moderate carb and a watering finish. Much better this time around. Gotta say, this beer MUST BE FRESH, so far as I can tell.

Original Review: 11NOV11: 3/1.5/1/2/1 (1.3)
Ive had this beer out of a growler, and it was one of the best APAs Id ever had. Too bad the transition here was flawed....heavily. 
Bottled: unk 
Pours a yellow straw with foam which falls rather quickly to a mirror of the same. Smells like: citra, grapefruit, citrus, more citrus?...NOT AT ALL!!! This smells like band aids and onions. Wow, god awful. Then the flavor is brutalized as well. Bitter, astringent, nasty. Body is fine beyond my clinching jaw. This beer is ruined for me. WTF happened to this bottle?!

Serving type: bottle

02-18-2012

12 oz. bottle from Woodchopper over on BA.  pours a honey gold with a one finger head, fades to spotty lace.  the nose on this one is off the charts, full of orange, mango and apricot.  taste is sweet caramel malt with a nice balance of lingering yet mild bitterness.  very nice and Id love to sit down and have 2 or 3 of these, but if I had to choose between this and Alpha King, Id go with with the King.

Bottled.  Poured crystal-clear honeyed golden with a tall, sticky, white head.. looked great in the glass!  The aroma picked up fresh orange zest, black pepper, and a hint of rye over honeyed malts and soft, sweeter breads.. balance was spot-on, and I really dug it.  The flavor opened with tangy orange zest, floral notes, and some black pepper.. semi-sweet middle with honey and bread again.. finished spicy, bitter, and refreshing, showcasing a lot of tasty citrus.  Medium-bodied with higher, prickly carbonation on the palate.. rolled well through the mouth.. great brew, and it certainly did the Citra justice.

This bottle was courtesy of Strykzone.  It pours a hazy amber with a very nice foamy off-white head and good lacing. . The nose is a huge blast of pine hops  Medium body and resinous and sticky mouthfeel. The flavor is intense with lots of grapefruit and pine, and the finish is long dry and bitter. This really shows off the  Citra hops.  Exceptional.
Bottle from fear025. Great hop aroma and balanced taste. Such an amazing pale ale.
Bottle. Golden. Smells fantastic! Nice and hoppy and funky. Still light bodied.

Bottle 33 cl shared with friends (28.09.11). Pale amber colo... ...uh, well... fuck a shitty normal rating, man, Zombie Dust deserve something different. This is probably the freshest beer ever had. It stunned me with a MASSIVE aroma of basil, sage, *living grass* like smell uhm... a creature like the Treebeard from Lord of the Rings, maybe. Moreover, its really piny, like a pine needle decoction. Citrus too. After such an extreme aroma you could reasonably expect an extreme body; on the other hand, beer is totally balanced among malt and hops over a medium body, drinkable just as a top-class session one, and leads to a fabulously bitter finish harsh full of resin, leaves, citrus, grass, herbs, ecc., ecc., that lasts almost forever. No way, try this one and you want more and more. I could imagine a scene like this: a 24-crate of Zombie Dust in a fridge box nearby me, comfortably relaxed on an armchair reading Salinger or Foster Wallace, while Pink Floyds notes spread over the air, and sounds me like a little fragment of heaven despite Im atheist. APA? IPA? Uh... does really matter? Seriously: Zombie Dust goes to the top in my personal best session beers chart, just below the Pliny the Elder... or, maybe, goes even draw with. Need to had both close again. For now, thanks Three Floyds for that fucking masterpiece!!!

I am a sucker for good pale ales and this brew just blows the palate away. The smell is intensely citrus hops and a backbone of bready malts. Those citrus hops dominate tastebuds until the bitter finish. Clean and crisp. More please.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Labonix.  Thanks Zach!  It pours a slightly hazy amber with a nice foamy, off-white head.  Nice head retention.  The nose is a blast of orange peel and resinous, sticky, herbal hops.  Dank and outstanding!  The nose carries right through to the palate with grapefruit, big herbal hops, sticky oranges, and a light malt sweetness.  Lasting grapefruity bitterness.  Medium bodied with prickly carbonation.  This is a damn tasty brew and a great showcase for the Citra hops.

Thans turd for sharing.  Pours rich toasted amber with one finger of dense off white head. Resinous nose, kind of piney and oily with some garlic.  Oily and resinous flavor with a medium hop bite and toasted grain.  Nothing like the Citra IPA I just made,  much more resin and pine heavy than I was expecting.

Wow, great beer. Better than Dreadnaught in my opinion. The aroma is citra hops all the way. The appearance is a very typical golden that the IPA style normally is. The taste is full of citra hops and is balanced by more citra hops. I really enjoy this beer and wish I didnt have to have friends send me six packs out here in California

Pours a cloudy orange with a nice white head and descent lacing. Intense smells of pine,citrus, grapefruit, grass. Taste is top notch with hops in the forefront and some malts. Great mouth feel and carbonation. This is really easy drinking. Amazing how great the balance is. This is the best APA i have ever had, hands down.

On tap. Dark golden sunset orange with a medium white head. This beer smells and tastes amazing. Probably the best Pale Ale out there. Enormous grapefruit aroma with a touch of earthy pine and bready malt. The flavor is out of this world. So much citrus for a beer of this style. Huge grapefruit and tangerine with a big hop resin profile. Extremely well-balanced with a delicious bready, biscuity backing. Medium-bodied, slightly syrupy, and very easy to drink. Fantastic lingering hop bitterness. Simply an amazing beer.

Bottle thanks to pantanap. Thanks Kan! Pours cloudy amber with nice white head. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus hops, pine and resin. Flavor is grapefruit, dry, citrus hops and tropical fruits. Has a nice dry fruity finish. This is a really good apa.

Nice tan head with lasting lace. Lightly hazy amber/orange color. Big, juicey hop nose. Lotsa citrus, grapefruit and pine, large and fruity, some resin. Makes yer mouth water. Medium bodied, oily on the palate, soft carbonation. Gorgeous little hop bomb with all the flavors listed above and a bit of and just a bit of grainy maltiness. Dry finish leaves ya wanting MORE! Damn Gabe, thanks for the bottle! Could drink a few of these bad boys.
Bottle. Pours a gorgeous hazy amber. Skunky grapefruit aroma. Taste is superbly balanced. Hoppy mixes well with sweetness. Clean finish. Awesome.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 Date: October 22, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: Darkness Day. Full description not available as I sampled way too many beers during Darkness Day! 
Had again December 28, 2011 bottle from Fullobs.  Semi-opaque cloudy orange with nice head that faded quickly and some lacing.  Citrus/orange and maybe some lemon, and hops in aroma and taste was similar with mild bitter finish.  Very well done.  Increased overall to 16 from previous rating.
Drank another 5.25.13 during Champions League final.  Bumped appearance  to a 4 with the long lasting head and lacing, but moved palate down to 3 with the bitterness that lingered after the finish.  No change to overall rating at 3.9.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2011 Bottle from Adam - thanks!  Pours a hazy, golden orange with a slight and quickly fading white head.  Aroma is dank, resinous hops, pine, citrus, mango, and tropical fruits.  Extremely sweet and floral nose. Taste does not quite match the pungency of the aroma but its still damn good with clean, slightly bitter hops, a dry malt backbone, and some citrus.  Would absolutely love to have access to this on the regular.  Excellent pale ale.

Damn this beer is the sh!t.... Great nose of seeping wet grapefruit. Clearish orange in color, big head. Taste is grapefruit, tropical fruits biscuits, slight flowers, with a well balanced bitterness.  Super smooth, way to enjoyable to drink. Simple but great APA. WoW, wish this was available in my area, and all the time. This was drank on the warmer side ~50 degrees. Overall. Probably the best pale ale I have had. Dreadnaughts little brother....... Huge "thanks" to stfun for the hook-up!

VERY solid Pale Ale, almost bordering on an IPA. Cloudy  light orange colored brew with some nice lacing and a fantastic smell to it! The taste is simple enough to really let the Citra Hops shine through. Nice Citra hop hit when you first sip it and lingers but than finishes clean. If I could buy this beer regularly I it would be a staple of mine.

On tap at the Brewpub, October 21, 2011.

Slightly hazy dark golden with a white head. Fresh with a lot of hops and fruit. Really, really drinkable and refreshing. I liked the floral and the resinous character of this beer. Would love to drink this one in the summer in Sweden.
