Bottle split with Pat. Pours a hazy orange yellow body with carbonated white head. Aroma is incredible juicy citrus fruits - pineapple, grapefruit, orange, and lemon. Mouthfeel is outstandingly refreshing with again, ripe fruits dominating the flavor along with some citrus hops. One of the best American Pales Ive ever had.

Bottle thanks to StFun.  Light orange pour, lasting carbonation and lacing and a nice sweet hoppy aroma.  Flavor is rich and slightly dry orange hops, a little bitters and finished with a nice mellow malty aftertaste.  Well done, Ill be in IN later this week and am going to look for more of this!

12oz bottle from Marc. Rating #150. Darkish yellow pour wirh some orange mixed in there, it seemed a bit hazy as well with a decent white head that lingered with a nice little amount of lacing. Picking up sime pine and tropical fruit, a little sweetness. Nice amount of bitterness up front leading to a little caramel sweetness and some fruitiness as well, nice stuff. (1966)
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Bottle. 12 oz. Split with and courtesy of James. Pours a bright, deep, vibrant yellow with a frothy, spiderweb laced out head. Aroma of grapefruit, dry champagne, soft buttery and bourbon notes, soft hay and grassy, floral hints, and some amazing soft orange and nectarine hints. Fucking amazing. Flavor is so tasty, man. Pure pineapple, grapefruit, mango, and passionfruit with a slightly bitter, yet overwhelmingly juicy finish. The hop juices in this brew are fucking incredible. What a layered, citrusy, and refreshing pale ale. It might even kick Gumballheads ass. Maybe.

Honey colored pour, 24 karat and murky with a nice 1-inch fluffy white head.  Aroma of grapefruit pith, dank grass, lemon zest, and evergreen.  Flavor begins aggressive but tapers down.  Definitely get the hop bitterness and some herbal, earthy qualities.  Seems a bit sharp.  Medium mouthfeel.  Good but not great.
Totally awesome. The hop and APA flavor here will make anything else boring in comparison.

12 oz bottle from a generous BA trader. Slightly hazy yellow/orange with a small dense head that leaves some lacing. Big aroma of grapefruit peel, tropical fruit, pine and a light sugary caramel. The flavor is bitter throughout but with a firm malt backbone to balance it out, the dry hopping is very apparent, tons of hop flavor. Medium to light body with average carbonation and a clean, dry mouth feel. This is a fantastic beer, I have enjoyed Citra hop beers before but didnt think they were that great, but this one could make me a believer.
UPDATED: NOV 2, 2014 Bottle and tap. Golden pour with a frothy white head. Rich aroma and taste of citrus hops and bready malts. Loads of pineapple. Killer APA.

Poured on draft into an imperial pint glass. Appearance is a translucent amber with a beige head of foam. Aroma consists of grapefruit rind and watermelon.  Taste is a juicy grapefruit presence with a nice fruity note that lasts through to the long dry finish. Medium bodied and easy to drink.

Bottle shared with buds - thanks Bryan! Pours a hazy gold with small head.. Aromas of bright citrus hops, grapefruit and pineapple. Taste is very balanced with full blown hop flavors. Nicely smooth on the palate vs. bitter as I would have expected. Some sweetness up front with a easy finish. A really tasty brew. Will seek out more.

12 oz bottle from Shep- thanks, Shep! Pours a cloudy gold with a little bit of an orange-amber hue and an initially thick white head that leaves plenty of lace in the tulip. Big hop aroma- oily, fruity, fresh citra hops, wet dead leaves, caramel malts, melon, apricot, and pineapple juice. Flavor of leafy, citrusy hops, not as oily as the nose suggests, pale and sweet malts, plenty of tropical fruits, citrus, and grains. Medium-bodied, with modest carbonation and a smooth, juicy mouthfeel. Absolutely excellent APA.

This beer smells very resiny and citrusy, full of hops.  It pours a hazy yellow body with a bubbly white head that leaves decent lacing.  It taste very bitter up front followed by a light sweetness.  This is a very smooth beer and easy to drink, also gets your fix of alpha acids.   mmmm

12oz bottle, courtesy of pantanap. Thanks, Kan! Pours a slightly hazy golden orange color; fine-bubbled light tan head with good retention and lacing. Just huge amounts of grapefruit and tropical fruit hop character in the nose, like this was dry-hopped with the dankest Citra hops out there; dear lord. Medium body; moderate CO2; adequate core bitterness, but just tons and tons of hop flavor: passion fruit, lemon, grapefruit, papaya... Certainly the best showcase of the Citra hop Ive tasted, and the modest carbonation lets everything play out. Wow wow wow. Medium finish thats toasty and dry. Beautifully rendered beer.

Bottle shared with Doodler and company poured a clear tarnished gold with a lasting offwhite head. Aromas of grassiness, biscuit, pine, skunk bud and light citrus. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, skunk bud, grapefruit and pine with a crisp dry lingering skunk bud finish.

Multiple bottles thanks to jrallen34 and mikem409.  Thanks fellas!  Orange amber, mildy cloudy, with a sudsy white head.  Nose is fresh citra, nicely bitter, mild sweetness, lots of tropical fruit and grapefruit.  Hoppy flavor, with  a creamy, sparkling hop palate that pale ales dream of.  Yummers.

Bottle.  Hazy burnt orange pour with a white head.  Grapefruity hop aromas.  Bitter and with bland almost grapefruit hops, but not really.  Very unbalanced with little malt characteristics.  Hey, the label is cool and Im glad I got to try it...

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2016 Bottle Hazy and light yellow with a small, creamy, white head. Good retention. The nose is chock-full-of fruity pineapple and juicy peaches -  skins included. Medium-bodied with a raspy mouthfeel and prickly carbonation. The flavor presents fruity peach and pineapple up front and medium to heavy tannic bitterness on the backside. Finishes fruity, mildly acidic, lightly bitter, and then bone dry. Nice pale ale. Kudos to fear025 for shipping some bottles my way!

Bottle with Doodler and Co. Thanks everyone! Clear, golden yellow appearance with a white head. Piney, resiny, sticky hoppy, mary jane, organic, potent aroma. Potent, resiny, grapefruity, piney hoppy, pale malty flavor. Hopheads wet dream. Hoppy as Hell. Great!

Bottle at a recent BA/RB tasting...  Poured golden-yellow with a white head.  Insane amount of citrus and bitter orange peel, or rind qualities.  A little bit of mango fruitiness, especially in the aroma.  Clean, and beautifully balanced.

Nice  head smells very much of pine and citrus. I taste a lot of grapefruit. Bitter. Nice bit and fizz on tongue. Color is hazy orange. Pretty wild beer very good very fresh thanks for the great trade been looking forward to getting my three floyds cherry popped great way to start.

Pours hazy golden with a medium fluffy white head.  Aroma is a hop bomb with citrus, grapefruit, orange, tangerine, and tropical fruit....just smells awesome!  Taste is fruity and citrus hops all the way.  This is absolutely delicious and at 6.2%, I could drink this all day.

a couple bottles courtesy of bauermj, thanks man! definitely a fine pale ale, no doubt. has a malt profile that reminds me of blind pig and pliny, the hops are big and blanced, bitter and sweet, drinks very well. great finish with the hops transitioning into the light cereal like malts. your basic citrus, tropical and a hint of red berries. delicious.
Sampled on cask at the map room in Chicago. Very good. Clean and mellow citrus hop aromas and flavors.  Green and fresh and delicious.

Bottle: &nbsp Golden colored, a little dull and hazy, nice white frothy head, sticky lacing. &nbsp Fairly assertive hop nose. &nbsp Also noticing some candyish fruity notes as well. &nbsp Oh wow, thats a nice juicy hop flavor right up front. &nbsp Bitter but not harsh. &nbsp Decent malt sweetness, a bit citrusy, otherwise some pale fruit too. &nbsp Wow, this is amazingly clean and tasty! &nbsp Robust Pale in that its hoppy but not overly bitter. &nbsp Nice malt base, right amount of citrus/fruity sweetness to balance it out. &nbsp This was a real treat! &nbsp Thanks Diego for this freebie!

sample at GABF on 10/1/11. very excited to try this one and wow is it a hop bomb!  deep golden pour with a small white head.  big citrus / dank hop nose.  aggressive bitterness throughout the body.  dry bitter finish.

bottle. fantastic. pours a hazy amber with minimal head. aroma of big florals, tropical fruits, and fresh citra heaven. huge and impressive for an american pale. flavor is much of the same...very floral with just a touch of subtle sweetness and mild bitterness in the finish. great

Pours a rich golden amber with a creamy off-white head that leaves a sleeve of lacing.  Orangey piney hop aroma.  Fairly mild overall but with a nice hop forward flavor which is resinous with a citrus and floral character.

Pours a little darker golden than a normal pale ale with a decent white head - really nice. The aroma is excellent - some cat piss and funky hop going on there with the juicy grapefruit notes from the citra. Best pale ale aroma ever! The flavor is strong juicy hops on a light typical pale ale body with some smooth bitterness to help settle on the palate.
Amazing pale ale.  Usually love stronger and hoppier but I cant get enough of this

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2012 GABF 2011 
Appearance: Slightly hazy golden with a medium sized white head 
Aroma: Tropical fruit and citrus 
Taste: Floral, caramel and tropical fruit 
Very nice and tasty 
8/5/12: Just had this again. Dallas gave me a bottle, thanks man 
Im not going to change my original rating. This is very good, I could drink this everyday.

On tap at Three Floyds. Pours a yellowish orange with some head. Aroma is absolutely terrific; hoppy grassy citrus and sweet fruits (pineapple, cherry, grapefruit), plus pine. Just want to dive in it. Taste is citrus, pine, more malt presence than expected. Some orange zest. Finishes medium long and sweetly bitter. This is excellent!! We bought a case to go and that has been equally terrific out of the bottles. I did not think a pale could be made to rival Daisy Cutter or Alpha King, but this is better. Indeed kudos to FFF for having a great pale and creating something better.

UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Re-rate: 12 ounce bottle. Sweet, grainy. quite bitter at times, insanely drinkable, very full of all the hop goodness you can get really. Oranges and light pine. Excellent. First class. 
On tap at GABF. Pours a opaque orange color with a medium white head. The aroma is sweet citra and some biscuit. The flavor is all massive tropical fruit, some bitterness but mostly a super smooth drinkable IPA or Pale Ale. Very nice and superbly drinkable. 
Re-rate: Ive had about 12 of these since my insane winning of a case for FBW! Superb. More drinkable than water by some measure.

Fresh 12 oz. courtesy of Patty BrugBee.  Pours a slightly hazy golden orange, with nice lite pillowy off white head.  Smells like some dank, fo reals, and orange, grapefruit, citrus, pine, etc.  Taste is pretty great, medium lite on the mouthfeel, fairly low actual bitterness, hops really shine thru here.  There really isnt much else going on - which is fine.  The best thing about this is the freshness - smells and tastes just like truly fresh hops - and theres no malt to get in the way!  Perhaps just a tingle in the very back end mite possibly alert you that its above 6%, but it is supremely quaffable.  High Poundability, fer shure.

the hops hit you right away. very bright hazy orange with great foamy head. taste of orange and grapefruit but not overly bitter. light body for the amount of flavor. overall this is an amazing pale ale

Pours hazy, vibrant orange-gold. Medium head. Nose is incredibly laden with citrus hop notes, tangerine and pineapple. The palate is something else entirely. Very green, herbal hop flavors with much less of the citrus thats on the nose. Mild malt level really lets the hops take over, but the bittering is on the low end of the moderate side, so its not too unbalanced for my taste. Theres a really distinct sweetness up front before it transitions to the hop notes. A really unique brew.

Thanks to GatorGuy92 for sharing this one.  Wow.  Just when I was beginning to lose faith in Three Floyds.  Pours a hazy orange with a white head.  Nose is intensely hoppy- lightly floral and a mushroom cloud of piney and bitterly citrus hops.  Flavor is similarly explosive hops- massive pine and citrus character with peach, apricot, and floral hops.  Light in body and extraordinary character for a 6.2% beer.  Absolute home run.
Possibly one of the best Pale Ales I have ever tasted, I spent a good 5 minutes just smelling the hops, I will be looking for this beer as much as possible!!
Super drinkable with a great floral body.  This is one of the most drinkable APAs Ive come across.  I hope 3 Floyds keeps this one in the regular rotation.

Id almost describe this as a junior version of the 3Fs Arctic Panzer Wolf. Hazy orange color, lots of dankness in the nose, and the Citra really shines for an undead ale. Runs the gamut from citrus and pine to floral. Good mouth feel and an overall keeper. To be fair though, 3Fs rarely does anything that disappoints me.

12oz Bottle. Thanks for sharing James! Super heavy papaya, flint, catty, and piney aroma. A little too 

much like the flavor of raw, mineral galena to me. Flavors are 

similar, but laid down a bit and more slippery. Body is not 

quite there for all this "zombie dust." Is this a Magic the 

Gathering card or a beer? Does it cost three mana to cast? Or 

does it have three ounces of Citra hops in it?

12 oz bottle.  Generous extra from dougofthefuture.  Thanks Doug.  Pours a cloudy golden amber with a small white head that has good retention and leaves a small amount of lacing on the glass.  The aroma is wonderful.  Huge mango, light pineapple, light grapefruit, and some light honey.  This is definitely a Citra hopped beer.  The initial taste is some sweet mango that goes into a light breadiness with a bit of pineapple.  The finish has some biscuit, more mango as well as a light bitterness.  Light, slick mouthfeel and a relatively low carbonation.  Great beer.  I would love to be able to drink this regularly.

I had no idea what to expect from this beer, but I was impressed.  Pours cloudy orange with white head.  Awesome aroma of citrus hops.  Great smooth flavor.  This was a damn fine APA.  Wish I could have gotten more than 1 six pack.

Quite the gift from Lendi! Smelled like a Christmas tree, full of dry pine scents and dried citrus fruits. The taste was incredible as well, the hop profile was very zesty and fresh with a strong taste of orange peel. Finished dry and refreshed the palate pretty well, very nicely balanced too.

UPDATED: SEP 25, 2011 Incredibly grateful to try this one. A big thanks goes to Lendi, whom some friends and I met at CCBs BA Hunahpu release, that had and shared a bottle of this with us. Cheers!! Smelled like sweet citrus and pine with a "clean" summer breeze smell. Hard to describe, but awesome. Poured a nice golden/light orange color with white colored head. Taste was fantastic with slight pine and citrus notes from the hops and a refreshing light herbal/grassy note. Reminded me of Headwaters Pale Ale but + some. Sooo refreshing and crisp. Could sip on one of these all day and not want anything else.

On tap at a trendy local establishment where some dudes were getting tanked before one of them was getting married (classy). Pours golden-orange with a substantial eggshell head that leaves impressive lacing. Aroma is tangerine and that Three Floyds dirty socks yeast. Taste is quite sweet with plenty of bitter and even a little tartness. Palate is medium, active, with a nice bitter finish. Refreshing yet potent. Hype or no hype, this is a pretty nice beer and worth a shot if you can find it. Not sure if anyone outside of Chicago will be seeing 6-packs in stores, and Im not gonna race all over hells half acre to score some, but I was impressed nonetheless.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2014 A: Clear pale-orange body. Large white head upon initial pour. Quickly receded. Moderate amount of sudsy lacing left on the glass.

S: Bright grapefruit, orange, pineapple and just a tad bit of resinous pine. Assertive tropical fruit blast -- reminiscent of fresh Sculpin.

T: Like biting into a fresh grapefruit -- with almost none of the bitterness. Amazing tropical fruit component that shines in a fresh, vibrant way, but not super-bitter like most IPAs/dIPAs that pack this much flavor per sip.

M: Smooth, medium bodied, with assertive carbonation (but not over-carbonated). Refreshing, clean finish.

O: A wonderful "APA." Like Alpha King, its hard to call this "just" an APA, but whatever it is, its damn tasty. Speaking of Alpha King, Id love to try this head to head with fresh Alpha King.
Bottle thanks to Jason! Pours cloudy apricot with white head. Nose and taste of tropical fruit, caramel, sweet malt and hops. Taste is full of fresh tropical fruit. Dry pine finish.

12 oz bottle. Pours a deep glowing orange with a big frothy off white head. Aroma is great, dank citra hops, very fresh and bursting fruitiness with grapefruit and a nice weedy note. Flavor starts with a big citric burst and an excellent balance, just all around a great showcase for the hop, finishing lightly bitter but super refreshing. Medium body and a soft but crisp carbonation. Great beer, I can see myself drinking a lot of this

(Bottle via trade with pantanap, thanks Kan!) Pours hazy light gold-amber with two fingers of stiff, level off-white head. Pungent aroma of grapefruit and pine with caramel underneath. Mouthfeel is fairly smooth, medium-full, perhaps lightly pebbly. Flavor of big grapefruit and pine over smooth caramel. Very hop-forward, yet balanced and not harsh. Yummy.

Scored some cases of this deathly beast.  Aroma has grapefruit and melon tones to it.  Appearance is golden orange mostly clear.   Leaves a great taste in your mouth with a nice citra-hoppy aftertaste.  No malt backbone.  A heavy-weight contender of American Pale Ales.  A session beer with 6.2% abv, cant go wrong with that.

Bottle shared by Deyholla, thanks Derek! P is chestnut gold with a white head that fell to a soapy film. Nose is citrus rind, hops, fall leaves and sweet apples. taste is a refreshing sweet citrus with a pretty smooth mouthfeel and a strong hop presence for a PA.  The nose wrote a check that the taste did not cash :-p

Big thanks to Adam for hooking me up with a six pack! Pours a clear gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges and remains some what thickly. Aroma is full of grapefruit with some backing citrus and resin and a bit of sweet grains to cut the bitterness. Flavor begins with citrus and sweet grains but has a good amount of grapefruit and a bit of resin that come out in the finish.

Bottle as an extra from pantanap! Pours with a hazed orange hued body with a white head that lasts and leaves very nice lacing. Aromas are huge, dank, stinky, tropical fruits. Guava and mango. Hops have a slight tropical sweetness to them. Straight lilikoi as if you were in Hawaii. Somewhat strong grainy malt note. Tea and some medium to light esters. Flavors are medium bitter with an overall slightly bitter balance. Malt is dry and grainy. Hops are all tropical fruit that even lend a slightly sweet fruit impression. Finishes clean and lightly grassy. Medium bubbles and very dry and light bodied. Not without its flaws, but overall its extremely good!
This is a nice American pale that drinks lighter than it is while still being wholly flavorful. Dryness and herbal bitterness compliment the medium to light body and citric hop nose.

Growler thanks to pantanap, thanks Kan. Poured a orange body under an average sized foamy light white head. Aroma is sick!!! Citrus, cat piss, slight pine and some sweet honey upon warming and lots of apricot through out. The body has a good amount of carbonation even though this came from a growler shipped from several states away. Medium bodied, average duration on the aftertaste with a nice touch of bitterness. Flavor of citrus rind, apricot skins, peach pits, toasted multi grain bread. This was just awesome, oh and 3 Floyds growlers are twisted.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2013 fresh bottle.  astoundingly bright and clean hop aroma; fruit / citrus-forward (peach, apricot, pineapple) with striking acid and a mild cheese rind character.  malt is clean, biscuity, lightly toasty.  zippy, snappy body with high-acid hop bitterness, low resin, soft carbonation and lasting citrus acid finish.  rather impressive beer that would easily be my daily drinker were it available.

Interesting beer, though the first impression I had of it was rusty well water. This one takes a few swallows to grow on you. Pours a nice golden yellow with a fairly thick head of white, creamy froth. Citrus and pine notes in the aroma and flavor. Mouthfeel is a bit thin, almost watery. Not quite so full-bodied as some pale ales Ive tried. I like it, but Ive tasted better (and Three Floyds makes better).

Bottle graciously given to me by pantanap...thanks Kan! - Pours pale amber with a quickly dissipating off-white head. Smell is...damn...an eclectic mix of hops, dominated by mango, garlic, onion, melon, and a bit of citrus. Not much malt presence to speak of. The taste is pretty onion-and-garlic forward, with some light mildew, tropical fruit, and some light, sweet malt. A bit grassy/piney in the finish. Taste is obscured a bit by the biting carbonation, and its got a little heavier body than the APAs Im used to. Pretty good, but the taste doesnt match up to the smell.
Sampled at an ESBLS tasting.  Big citrus hops are smelled.  Those are also dominant in the flavor.  This is kind of like one of Mikkellers single hop series.  Good but one dimensional.  Again, good.

Draft samples at DLD 11.  Pours a hazy dark golden color with a large white head.  The aroma is big tropical fruits and citrus that filled the area around the picnic table even on a windy day.  The flavor had more nice citrus and tropical fruits, caramel malts and a decent amount of bitterness to the finish.  This is as flavorful as many IPAs that you can find.  I cant wait to get my hands on a couple bottles to see how well they compare.

Big thanks to enelson for this. Poured into a pint glass.

4.0 A: Moderately hazed golden color. One and a half fingers of pillowy white head. Retention is about average and a good sized, full ring of lacing is left behind.

4.5 S: This APA has the hop aroma of a DIPA. Strong mango, followed by pineapple and orange. Grapefruit and pine after that. Sugary cake icing. No hints of any malt. Pretty clean overall.

4.0 T: The taste isnt as crazy citrusy as the nose. Still theres a good bit of pineapple, mango, and orange. More pine and grapefruit than the nose suggests and not even close to as sugary. Moderate bitterness. A bit of malt this time in the way of breadiness and a light yeastiness. A little less clean than the nose.

4.0 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation, especially for a growler. Reasonably creamy and smooth overall.

4.0 D: This is a pretty good beer. It reminds me a lot of Selins Grove IPA that I just had a few days ago, but a less intense version of that. Still, I would have no problem drinking this to get a citrusy hop fix.

Serving type: growler

Reviewed on: 07-21-2011 21:47:34

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2012 Draft at The Dash-In.  Great orange color.  Really nice aroma.  Plenty of hops in this beer.  Bitterness is restrained, with a great hop bouquet and flavor.  However, there is a substantial malt presence.  And, its almost a little too sweet for me.  Citra is nice, but does add some sweetness on top of the malt.  I would love for this to be drier.  As it is, its a nice beverage.

Much thanks to Dmac for sharing this growler. Pours out an attractive copper color with a light white head. Aroma is very nice. Juicy citrus hops, tangerine, orange, tropical fruits. Taste is complex, nice tropical fruit, tangerine, light coconut, and some grainy bread creeping in there for light balance. Awesome brew.

Had my brother pick m= e up a growler Pours orangish copper with white head. retention and lacing. Aroma of bright citrus hops and caramel malts. Flavors of bitter hops, citrus, and caramel malts. Finishes bitter but extremely balanced. Nice pale ale.

400! And what a beer to celebrate. On tap at brewpub pours a clear bright copper with a medium khaki head. Aroma is a resinous pine, citrus, and caramel, could smell it as soon as it was put down in front of me. Taste is a swirling caramel maltiness intertwined with resinous pine and citrus, glorious! Finishes clean and mildly bitter. One of the best beers Ive ever had! I could drink this all day.

UPDATED: AUG 30, 2011 Growler courtesy of Brophmonster!  Thanks!  Vibrant & clean orange pour.  Fluffy off white head and great looking lace.  Aroma is very resinous with hints of peach and tropical fruit.  Easy drinking full of flavor, and very resinous.  Lingering peachy finish.  Man is this stuff good!

Thanks to GOT for the growler. Hazy dark orange pour. Huge peach, pine and citrus hop aroma. Clean crisp malt body with notes of peaches, oranges. Such a huge citrus note from the hops, quite a nice refreshing beer.

Enjoyed for the 3rd time on tap at the Firkin on 8-26-11. Very well balanced enjoyable pale ale, think Gumball Head with some extra umf! Cant wait for this stuff to be bottled!

Nice orange color with a fluffy white head that fades fast, nose of spices, and citris fruit. Very easy drinking and very enjoyable

Draft at brewpub loved this beer.  Aroma was tropical fruits with light herbal aroma.  The flavor is delicious with notes of mango, orange, lemon, grass and light spicyness.  Absolutely phenominal pale ale.
On premise. Golden pour with a nice white head. Aroma is fruity hops. The taste is so good. Fresh, tasty fruity hops with a great aftertaste  Another fantastic beer from Three Floyds.

On tap at GTMW (2011)

Maybe I just havent gotten on the citra bandwagon but this APA didnt excite me all that much. A solid offering with the typical hop bite we have all come to expect from Three Floyds it did not leave me wanting more. The semi-tropical notes of mango, pine, and citrus hold the attention for a while but I soon found myself moving on to the next tap in search of a more interesting discovery.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2011 Big thanks to Deuane for picking me up a growler of this one during his recent trip through the brewpub.

A - Pours slightly hazed golden orange with a nice one finger tall white head leaving 

S - HUGE amounts of grapefruit throughout this one. Tons of oily citra hops dominate the nose with a bit of lightly toasted sweet caramel malt hiding in the shadows. The second we cracked this growler I could smell it from across the room.

T - Starts off with a huge, oily, citric hop bite quickly giving way to a mix of strong tropical fruits like grapefruits, pineapple, and oranges. Once the hop resins die down you get a bit of the chewy, lightly toasted, caramel malt but this one really is all about the hops. The alcohol is nearly undetectable, only coming through at the very end of each glass. The finish is a mix of citric hop oils and some light chewiness, lingering for some time.

M - Medium-Light body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Lots of hop oils and some light chewiness in the feel, lingering through the finish. Even with all these hops it remains quite light.

O - Well that growler disappeared pretty damn quick. I could drink this one all day, every day, it is that good. The citra hops are the perfect choice for this beer and this is easily one of the best hop-forward pale ales I have ever had.

Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a slightly hazy copper color with a large creamy offwhite head. Decent head retention and lacing. Aroma of big citrus, resin and earthy hops, some spiciness and caramel malts. The taste is bitter citrus hops, earthy notes and a malty caramel backbone. Medium bodied. Well balanced. Very nice.

GTMW.  Orange.  Big Citra aroma - fruity apricot, mango, pine - as well as, some caramel malt.  Clean, well-rounded hop flavor and bitterness.  Inter-mingled fruit flavors.  Clean bitter finish.  Best use of Citra Ive tasted.

On tap at GTMW 2011, pours a clear dark golden/orange with a nice head, aroma is full of citrus and dank hops, the flavor is very nice with a huge amount of citrus and tropical fruit, some pine in the finish, awesome.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2011 On tap at Great Taste of the Midwest. Huge hop aroma... super dank, citrus, and more. Equally awesome hoppy flavor that still manages to be light enough to be refreshing and enjoyable. Very good!
Re-rate 12/2/11. 12oz bottle via cbfobes! Thanks, dude! MAN, this stuff is awesome. Huge pine and lemon peel/citrus in the aroma with an equally hoppily delicious flavor. Like I said in my original rating from GTMW... still light bodied enough that you can throw these back. This is delicious and I could drink gallons of it. Shit, this is good.
Thanks to telios.  Seriously awesome.  Fresh and tasty.  Peaches and citrus in the aroma.  Smooth and light.  A superb brew.

On tap at the brewery.  Pours a clear orange with a thick white head.  Aroma of sweaty, stinky, grassy hops, a hint of sweet fruits, jam, and citrus.  Flavor of pale malts, some toasted malt, grassy and earthy hops, bready malt,  jam and light fruits.  Interesting IPA - not crazy hoppy but plenty of malt, fruity notes, orange and citrus.
8/4/8/4/14 [3.8/5]

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2012 Has this at the brewpub and got a growler and am drinking it now to give a proper rating.  But the growler was a little flat, so I am accounting for that. Big aromas of citrus - grapefruit, lemon, and notes of tangerines.  Appearance is golden, with white head and lacing that sticks.  Taste is a great balance of sweet and bitter with some faint sourness.  Man this is good.  From memory, the palate was lively carbonation and a nice, long, dry finish.  Overall, this an outstanding beer right up my alley.  The low abv makes this a great session beer.

Sampled off the tap at the brew pub.Orange gold color in the pint glass. Nice tropical fruit in the nose along with tangerine and lemon. Very smooth and balanced in your mouth. Initial sweetness quickly gives way to a solid hop backbone with the citra hop flavor well apparent.  Balanced finish not overly sweet. Loved this beer.

Draught at FFF.  Pours a hazy light gold, with ample white head.  Aroma is grapefruit, tangerine, lemon. Taste is citrus, herbal, and slightly bitter.  Palate is light, with average carbonation. overall, the best session beer I have ever had.  This is one amazing beer. Wish it was available in area.  Excellent overall.

Showed on tap at the brewpub when we got there. Nice surprise, I had a lot of expectations since I love citra and what Ive heard from it.

Aroma: This one is all hops: earthy, citrus and soap.

Appearance: Pale orange with small head.

Flavors: Light, some tropical fruits. Feels likes there is no backbone.

Palate: Quite dry but too watery.

Overall: Expectations were not met.
Gold in color with a thin white head.  Super (citra) pine hop aroma and taste.  A nice pale with great hoppiness.

On tap:  The aroma is citrusy and fruit with peach, mango, and grapefruit.  Its a transparent amber with a small white head that leaves behind some spotty lacing.  The flavor starts with peach, mango,  and a hint of pineapple.  The finish has light-moderate grapefruit and a hint of mint.  Light-medium bodied with soft carbonation.  Id love to have this available in Michigan.
Draught at Beer Trappe. Oh man, is this tasty, Big floral nose and all the right IPA notes regarding taste. Big grapefruit and pine, Fantastic.

Tap sample. Poured clear copper color with an average frothy white head that lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy citrus hop aroma. Moderate bitter flavor with a moderate to heavy bitter finish of medium duration. Medium body with a slick texture and soft carbonation. Very good brew.

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2011 16oz pour at Haymarket in Chicago.  Pours a hazy, burnt orange with a creamy, lacing white head.  Nose is very nice and inviting, citrus, oranges, orange peel, a little candy, some light caramel, a little earthy.  Flavor is also quite nice, sweet, citrus, candied oranges, orange candy, light caramel, some fruit, a little vegetal.  Medium bodied, sweet, citrus finish.

*****Re-rate 12/24/2011, 12oz bottle pours a clear, deep orange with a thin, creamy, lacing white head.  Nose is nice, orange zest, a little caramel, some grapefruit peel, pine needles, leafy veg, flowers, a little honey.  Flavor is sweet, zesty hops, pine needles, orange peel, lightly peppery.  Medium bodied, refreshing finish.  Easy drinker.
UPDATED: FEB 16, 2015 At Ace on Fullerton. Very strong pine citrus hop aroma. Citrus and fruit flavors. Taste changes as you drink. Interesting. Somewhat sweet. Serving: Tap

Mostly a straight up barely above average wheat if you ask me. Im getting strong banana, clove, hints of bubblegum and small bits of flowery hopiness. Wont have again, unless I find out this is an older not so fresh version Im drinking.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2017 Pours a cloudy amber with no head on ta at the Hopleaf in Chicago. Aroma of roasted grapefruit. Flavor is absolutely red grapefruit. This is gumballheads darker stronger cousin. This beer is growing on me. Its hard not to actually taste dust. 4-6-15 This beer has quite grown on me. Its awesome. Did not contain bobcat would drink again. 11-18-15 just stopping by to make sure we made it perfect rating. Good show! 5-26-17 yup still the single best beer Ive ever had

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2013 re rate just got a 6 pack in the mail yes! pours a golden hazy orange brown nice frothy white head sticking to the glass nose is orange peels and flower pedals very hoppy nose taste was bitter yet still not a hop bomb this is why citra hop makes so many beers amazing grapefruit and grassy glad i got 5 more

Crushed at the FFF Brewery with Honkeybra.  Wow those citra hops are something else.  Sweet but balanced and packed with orange and tangerine flavors and aromas.  A great name for a beer, and also a ridiculously good pale ale.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2011 Growler pours hazy pale gold, slightly orange with minimal 1 finger head.   Aroma is like heaven!  Redolent of all types of citrus, grapefruit, lemon peel, but particularly tangerine and a hint of green apple and honey, this is the best smelling beer Ive had in weeks.  Taste is an utter hop bomb--tangerine, grapefruit and mild caramel dominate the palate.  Body is medium with lower than average carbonation, oily on the tounge, and finishes extra dry with a very long lasting tangy/bitter citrus aftertaste.  This is basically a perfect beer, I expect no less from 3F.
On line at BA speedway release. Shared from a growler.  Apples and light malt on the nose. Big light sweetness in the mouth. Great beer for 7:15 am. Light citrus and cinnamin hints. Very nice.

A great pale ale. Crisp with light citrus that compliments the hops perfectly. Hoppy and sweet without a think syrupy mouth feel. One of my all-time favorite IPA and definitely one of the most balanced.

Rich orange pour and substantial white head.  The nose is strongly reminiscent of the cat box...weirdly good.   Flavors are likewise catty, citrusy, earthy...all hop-forward.  But there is a nice bready malt pale roastiness underneath it all.   Very tasty summery APA.

aroma is citrus, floral, and hoppy.  Straw color clear and one finger head.  High hop content, low malts, no citrus taste, nothing special.  Palate is clean and crisp.  Okay, but would not drink again.  A typical 3F brew.

On tap at DLD. Pours a hazy/cloudy amber but close to orange hue with a two-finger wide off-white head. Aroma is of grass, pine needles, caramel, mangos, apricots. Flavor is not as complex but soft on the tongue with notes of sweet caramel, citrus, and just a touch of pine needles. Medium bodied and very smooth, great carbonation levels.

aroma is fresh mown grass, lemon then sharper lime.  appearance is clouded straw, messy head with large pockets and disappearing legs.  flavor is fresh hay, bitter foliage, twist of lime late.  mouthfeel dries early, immediately even and right up front.

A: The beer pours a hazed golden orange color with a huge off-white/khaki head and nice sticky lacing.

S: Great hop nose to this beer. Big pine and citrus peel. Tons of grapefruit with a little bit of bready malts and a hint of toast and caramel. Mildly grassy on the back end.

T: Mildly sweet malts of bread and toffee. Big citrus peel, pine, and grass hop flavor. A moderate level of bitterness to it and a hint of fruitiness. Nice solid flavors to the beer.

M: Medium in body with a medium level of carbonation.

O: Really easy to drink and a great flavor and aroma.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 On draft at DLD 12 as well as several bottles at home.  
An amazing pale ale / ipa with a sick amount of juicy citra flavor.  Extremely easy to drink with a lighter body, huge aroma, and big flavor.  You really cant ask for much more for the style.

Orange with good, creamy, white head / Fresh, subdued, nose of citrus and cut pine / Medium body, a little watery, mellow but fresh hops with good balance and fresh finish / Flavors of orange zest, pineapple, and fresh cut pine / Fresh hop juice with low bitterness.

Tap @ 3F, cloudy honey w/ heavy lacing, aroma is bursting with Citra, huge tropical fruits and citrus, flavor is citrus peel and and tropical fruits throughout, very smooth and drinkable, one of the best examples of the style Ive had

Appearance:  Pours a vibrant dark orange with no head.

Aroma: Dank bud, mango, apricot, tangerine.


Taste: Citrus out the wing wang. Punctuated bitterness, slightly sweet malt. Like most beautiful Citra beers Ive tried, your tongue is looking for bitterness that just isnt there, and it makes the beer fall off in the finish.


Mouthfeel: Thin with moderate carbonation. This would probably be remarkable on cask.


Overall:  Even though I thought it could be a bit more bitter, to balance out that amazing dose of citrus, I still finished it loving it.

Apr 30 @ DLD, courtesy of pantanap. Pours slightly clowdy golden with a good head leaving nice lacing. Aroma is so good; piny, citric, cat bin, malty and fruity. Flavor follows the aroma with pungeant and sweet caramel tones, mmm so good. Finish is great hoppy bitter tart.

Draft at DLD. A lot of what I thought were Amarillo hops, but I see from the description its one of the new catbox smelling hops. Which I like. Very cloudy color in my plastic cup, with a short head of foam. Taste is a little more malt forward than the usual hoppy 3F beer. But still another in a long line of very good, very hoppy 3 Floyds beers.
On tap at Dark Lord Day. Thanks for the share. Very citrusy in the aroma and flavour. Fantastic but not overly complex which works for this beer. Would like more of this stuff.

This stuff was fantastic!  Poured a nice hazy golden color with a bright white head.  Nice strong citrus hop aroma giving plenty of grapefruit and pine.  Really surprised that this is an APA and not an IPA.  The flavor is really bright offering hops and a strong caramel backbone.  This is just a marvelous beer!  Id love to grab a sixer of this stuff!

Draft at DLD, pours a nice golden yellow, tastes very hoppy, close to an IPA I would say but very drinkable, nice citrus to this one and a good bitterness. Would definitely like some more of this one. Very good offering

UPDATED: APR 17, 2016 On DRAFT at DLD....how much better can you get? Pours a hazy amber / orange color with a nice head and lacing...or as good as you can get in a plastic (sigh) glass...both nose and taste is hoppy hoppy hoppy...but not the overly bitter hops that dominate some IPAs and some APAÃ¢â‚¬â„ short, a great beer. Some PAÃ¢â‚¬â„& suffer from shelf life, but this one was probably brewed yesterday! Great stuff.

Draft at DLD(11) - Pours amber with strong hop notes that drive into a bitter grapefruit and light vegetbale like spice palate.  The finish gives the bitter hop hints with a decent balance of unerlying malt to allow the hop from going to crazy.

On tap DLD11.  Pours hazy orange/amber with nice white head, aroma is overpowering orange and grapefruit, with a touch of vegetal notes from the hops.  Taste is good with notes of bitter grapefruit, sweet orange, some slight lemon, and a vegetal note finishing slightly bitter but clean.  Wish it came without the vegetal, but overall a delicious beer and good showcase of the hop.

Draft at brewpub.  Aroma is very hoppy with a nice malt backbone.  Notes of grapefruit, mango, citrus, and some grassiness.  Palate is where it should be.  Taste is bitter and hoppy.  Pretty damn good.

Enjoyed on tap at Dark Lord Day at 3 Floyds in Munster, IN.  Appearance a  vibrant orange haze with a thin white head.  Aroma citrusy hops with rich malts, leans heavy on the hop side.  Taste rather bitter, rich in hops, nice flavors, Im not sure if this is supposed to be an ipa but it sure tastes like it.  I wrote this review while at DLD and now that Im at home I can see its an APA.  Definitely a hoppy APA, but I wouldnt expect anything else from 3 Floyds.  Pretty good stuff.

On draft at Dark Lord Day 2011.  Pours a hazy amber color with a white head.  Aroma is hoppy, citrus.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, with a nice bitter hop finish.  Excellent.

On cask at the Real Ale festival at PP Carlsbad. It pours orange with a fluffy white head. The aroma is grassy with marijuana and some grapefruit. The flavor is full with marijuana, tropical fruit, and a touch of toffee sweetness. It finishes rather earthy bitter. One of the best beers of the day.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2013 The special tapping of the night at Fountainhead. Pours a very light gold with a fluffy white head. For a single hop brew, the nose is fantastic. Lots of hops with huge citrus coming through. Not too over the top in bitterness. Has a caramel malt backing that goes well with the Citra hops. Good beer

tap at Trion - Pours copper and has a hop aroma that to me, surprisingly enough seeing that this brew is single hopped with Citra, smells strongly of pine.  Its moderately bitter with a slightly toasted caramel backing and lots of lingering bitterness to go with the ample pine flavors.  Very good.

Pours a light gold color. Smells like pineapple, mango, candy. Incredibly easy to drink. Filled with tons of good hop flavor. Hops really take over in this one but the malt character is right where it needs to be. Before I knew it, I had 4. Cant wait for this to be in bottles. Delicious.

On tap at the brewpub. Served in imperial pint glass.

Pours a nice orange color with a two-finger head. Quite bubbly at first and eventually falls down into a light cap. Slight lacing on the edges of the glass. The nose is nice with a bit of citrus as well as the usual tropical suspects that come with a Citra brew.

The flavor really takes off on what was present in the nose. There is quite. Bit of tropical fruit, some orange, and then quite a bit of nice bitterness. Really nice how the flavor and bitterness interact here. Feel is bitter.and a bit light with really nice cabontion. Thrilled that this was still here and am very glad I got to try it. Will be bringing a growler back for the DC folk to enjoy.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-23-2010

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2011 Tap at the pub.  Lots of citrus and tropical fruits going on; mango and grapefruit dominate, lots of floral hop aroma.  Slightly hazy straw color, massive white head with great retention, lots of thick, soapy lacing.  Flavor follows the nose pretty well, lots of citrus, pine, mango, as well as resiny hops.  Bittering is pretty forward, but malt flavors do help balance.  Some faint cereal grains, toasty flavors.  Light-medium body and medium carbonation, slightly sticky and creamy.  Really great showcase for the citra hops - highly drinkable and enjoyable.
The aroma reminds me of that of the gumballhead. The fruit notes that come through make it slightly sweet to my taste. .
Tried it at day of the ales 2011 in chicago. I really enjoyed it and it definitely made my top 5 beers of the event.

Growler courtesy of jlanning215.  Pours copper with a nice, lingering tan head.  Initial citrus gives way to resin, melon, sweet oranges.  Tastes of pronounced resin, pine, some sap hints, nice underlying caramel and molasses with a balanced, bitter finish.

On guest tap at Revolution. Pours a mostly clear, orange-golden colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of soapy lacing. Aroma has tons of Citra hops with plenty of fresh grass, grapefruit-lemons, some resins, oranges, peaches, and a nice floral too. Fresh, pale malt balance with some grains and a light bread. Flavor is similar. Lots of grassy, fresh, citrus grapefruits and lemons. Some more peaches, sweeter oranges, and florals. A nice pale malt, cereal grain sweetness with a light caramel. Finishes grassy and piney with a moderate bitterness that dries with some resins and a nice, light malt sweetness. Lengthy aftertaste following a lighter, very smooth and clean, crisp body and soft, moderately fizzy carbonation. Overall, a very flavorful pale ale. Lots of grassy citruses with a nice pale malt sweetness. Very easy drinking and enoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2011 5 hour old growler provided by Alex...Pours a brilliant clear orange, a light white head good retention...Citra aroma, what else do you expect. Not much different than any other citra beer. Nice, just doesnt stand out from the others, but I like it...The taste is more citra hops, a little orange, and yeast, not bad but Im not feeling this as much as the citras Its not meaty enough to stand up to the flavors, needs a strong backbone.

Zombie dust -  bottle review... a few days old and this much better than the several times Ive had it on draft... nose is bursting with fresh oranges and citra, supremely easy to drink, original reviews was 3.7 this is a solid 4

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 On cask @ 3F. Slightly hazy golden orange with a big frothy head that lasts quite a while. The aroma is awesome, tons of tropical fruit...tangerine, pineapple, pine needles, bloodorange, and sweet caramel malt. The flavor starts out sweet, with rich malt, then comes tropical fruit, and finally finishes with floral hops and loads of bitterness. Nice smooth palate with soft carbonation. One of their best beers imo and thats saying alot. Bottle version isnt as good.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and shaker served with a cloudy, apricot nectar color, modest amount of silky, white head foam that was fairly lasting, and curtainy ribbons of lacing. The aroma was a pungent dose of hop as sharp, white grapefruit, some resin, and just a hint of sweetness layered in. The flavor was very hop dominant, with lingering bitterness, and a touch of caramel malt buried in there somewhere. Not bad, but a bit on the astringent side for my tastes.

Tasted on 3/16/11 on draft at Local Option.  Pours clear golden straw with a thick white head that slowly recedes to rocky lace.  The nose is very fresh pale malt with citrus hops, and hints of resin and white peppercorn.  The flavor follows suit with the pale malt, and very fresh citrus and lightly resinous and herbal hops, and once again, just a hint of white peppercorn.  The body is light with lively carbonation and a long bitter citrus hop and light white peppercorn finish.

Slightly cloudy orange-yellow with white head.  Juicy mandarin orange nose with  pine, grapefruit, brown sugar, and a bit of booze...which is surprising...Taste is more of same with surprising bubblegum, rock candy, and and caramel notes.  Clean finish with lasting pleasant mandarin orange/hop bitterness.  Good one, but not a standout.

Pint cask @ Three Floyds poured golden. Pine and grapefruit in the nose, very nice floral bouquet, with caramel and cereal notes.  Flavor is a solid punch of hops up front, resinous pine taste. After the hops, caramel malts come through with cereal and sweet flavors. Nice hoppy aftertaste that dissipates quickly. Really enjoyed this brew.

Growler.  Smells great, tastes great, drinks great.  Fantastic use of citra hops.  Cant believe someone was trying to convince me it was something else >=p
Refreshing and clean but still has plenty of character.  Love it.

FFF tap. Pour hazy yellow golden color with minimal head but great lacing. Aroma pineapple, citrus and tropical fruits and resiny hops. Taste guava, grass, malt , strange herb like taste that bent my facial expression. MF bitter not sweet not balanced with nice fizzy carb. Overall this is an odd duck brew I didnt overly enjoy.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2011 Aroma of a pine tree and coriander. Easy to drink full pf character. An awesome brew. A perfect balanced brew. Its overwhelming to drink this and the other brews here at the brewpub. The smell and taste of coriander are prominant. A great experience citrus. a cloudy yellow pour. Amazing

Had it on the engine pull today (march 7th 2011). So perfect with no carbonation....so good.

On tap at Trion. Deep golden color with a sticky off white head. Sharp orange zest nose. Nice warm citrus flavors with orange juice, grapefruit rind, and some apricot.  Nice malty sweetness balanced with copious hops. Alpha Kings little brother.
Where I am from its all about Bells Oberon for summer time, but I think I will go with Cenotaph instead.
This was a a bright yellow to gold pour with a nice frothy head,flavors of citrus and lemon with a nice bittering affect.This was very drinkable and would be great for summer.CHEERS!

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2011 Draft at Marias, pours hazy light amber with creamy white head. Aroma had lovely grapefruit notes and grassy, earthy melon too. My nose could be a little stuffy today so Ill have to try it again soon.
Flavors are extremely bitter with grapefruit rind, lemon, and tangerines. Really hoppy and long bitter finish, tasty unrefined hop flowers camp out on the palate for a long long time. Extremely dry and clean. Very well dry hopped and fermented. Wow this is tasting pretty fn good. Ill have to try this again when my nose is a little clearer.

Draft at Trion...pours a bright gold with a massive white head, nice retention and lacing.  Nose consists of a ridiculous amount of citrus, mainly white flesh peaches, pineapple and lemon...a hint of light toasted malt apparent.  Medium bodied, flavors are absolutely insane...crazy amounts of peach and pineapple concentrate with a bit of piney bitterness to round it out.  Unbelievable brew...heres to you FFFs!!

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2012 On tap at the 3F brewpub.   Golden orange pour with white head.  Aroma of strong citrus, lemon, pine, a bit of odd earthiness.  Flavor is dead on: hoppy, mild hop sweetness, delicious and smooth.  Nice, medium bodied, the hops really stand out on their own.  FInishes hoppy and bitter.  Absolutely delicious. 

ReRate 9/19/11: bumped up a few points.  Slowly becoming one of my favorite beers ever.

On tap @ 3f. Pours a clear copper gold with a white head. Hops pour off the aroma soon as it gets in range. A little cat pissy but lots of lemon and pine. Bitter juicy lemons, grass, and some pine flavors with sweet caramel malts. Soft carbination  medium body.   So delicious and bitter. It seems like their new good hoppy beers veer away from the grapefruit and pine bombs of yesteryear. Nit sure about the evolution of hoppy beers here.  But this one is delicious.
On tap at brewpub. Aroma is citrus--mainly grapefruit. Flavor is also citrus/grapefruit, with a nice lingering aftertaste. Very smooth, enjoyable, and sessionable beer.
lemony goodness, just a hint of pine-cone, assertive cattiness, but not offputting; subtly complex straight forward pale ale.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Tap at 3F brewpub.  Strawberry/raspberry malt and citrus hops aroma.  Dark golden yellow color with small head and nice lacing.  Lightly sweet berry malt and lemon peel hops flavor.  Nice body.  An excellent APA.   Bottled - hops seem more forward and malt flavor not quite as strong.  Still damn good - too bad that this will be as hard to get as Hopslam.

On tap at the brewpub.  Intense floral and citrus aroma is followed by a heavy dose of mango and sweet tangerine flavors and a sharp bitterness at the end.  A rather thick mouthfeel for a beer in low  6% ABV range tasting like a more significant IIPA.  Notwithstanding, an easy drinking and outstanding pale ale.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2010 On tap at three floyds, half-pint... Pours a transparent golden copper penny hue with a creamy frothy white head... Flavors are hop forward with a tropical fruit pacific northwest bent, some tea, with an assertiveness that is to be enjoyed. Doesnt have a residual sweetness as some other citra focused brews (kern river and one another comes to mind). Earthy bitterness concludes the aforementioned qualities with a hint of sweet crystal malt through the middle which is quick to disperse. Mild bodied overall with carbonation that holds up well if a little lively. Solid.

Draft at brewpub. Pours amber with dissipating off white head. Nice fruity and citrusy hop aroma. Lighter side of medium bodied with soft carbonation. Flavor of pale american malts, countered but a firm citrusy hop bitterness, Nice!

Draft at Three Floyds. Hard to say if this was the highlight this time or if Hells Black was. Either way, I love a new hoppy beer from Three Floyds. Just seems right. Pours an attractive reddish bronze with a sticky white head. Nose is incredibly. Great juicy apricot and peach notes, some nice tangelo and a hint of biscuity backbone. West coast in every way. On taste, the bitterness is not astringent at all, but is definitely full on. More juicy fruit notes. Finishes hoppy. Just a fanstastic pale ale. Awesome.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2012 Had the opportunity to share an imperial pint of this and Alpha King with my wife, setting up a side by side tasting.  It is an orange-copper ale with a fluffy white head that recedes, but remains atop for the duration.  Grapefruit, mango, apricot, and tangerine aromas fill my nostrils.  The first sip fulfills the promise of the aroma, with a slight bitterness backed by light malt base.  This tastes like what I imagine a combination of Gumballhead and Dreadnaught may, minus much malt or wheat flavor.  The only let down is the mouth feel, as it is a bit thin; however, that makes it dangerously drinkable.  While the malt backbone is not that of Alpha King, the hop profile makes it just as tasty.  I expect to see this at number 2 on the APA list.  FFFs answer to those that think Alpha King is unfairly categorized as an APA.

Update 6/4/2012:
It could be my palate, but Zombie Dust seems to have developed a harsher bitterness since I first had it as Cenotaph.  Still smells wonderful, but Id honestly rather have an Alpha King.

Draft on tap at the brewpub (Munster, IN). Apparently, I missed Shawn. Pours a glowing deep golden orange tinged hue, dark with light haze, a sunset mysyique and a big offwhite cakey head that laces well and stays moderate sized. Aromas smack from quite a distance away: lively Citra hops provide a boquet of fuzzy peach, grapefruit, tangerines, and lemons, touches of floral, biscuity and pale bready malts interwine with a a big peachy presence, apricots and grapefruit. Tempting. Initial is lighter end of medium bodied, big tart peach, citrusy grapefruit and lemons, touches of tangerine, floral bitterness, some grass, lingering fruity melange coupled with pale malts, bread, biscuits, and grainy malts. This brew really is all about displaying this hop varietal though. Lively citrus and peach, lingering bitterness, florals, a tasty brew. Quite drinkable, delicious hop presence, lingering fruity melange, bitterness and dry. A winner for an APA, the aroma is potent, the taste and balance on the palate, enveloping the mouth with flavorful Citra hops. Yum.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2011 Always exciting to try a new hoppy little pale ale from FFF.   imperial pint at the brewpub.   pours a clear orange amber with a small offwhite head.  aroma of big juicy orangepeel, grapefruit, and fresh cut flowers.  super drinkable.  couldnt help but basically chug this- so tasty and easy drinkin.   really nice, clean fresh juicy, floral, hop profile. clean, well made awesome beer beer. would drink again and again.   another very enjoyable beer from FFF

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2011 On tap at FFF. Pour is light clear golden with modest white head. Decent retention and light lacing on this one. Aroma is sublime; citrus dominates and I suppose that shouldnt be unexpected. Medium bodied with nice sweetness as well. Im honestly blown away by this one. Light but sweet malts fuse with a wonderful citrus and floral hop profile. Bitterness is lingering but limited, and it is just so incredibly palatable. Had it when it was Cenotaph - the new bottles are fantastic.
